Reviews.Title: “Very nice little respite!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy53
Reviews.Content: Drove in to Boston to celebrate 2 birthdays and stayed at the Onyx Hotel. The valet arrived immediately to take our car and we were very warmly greeted at the front desk with "Happy Birthdays". We arrived early and the staff made sure our bags were secure as we went out to do some celebrating. When we returned, we were promptly checked in and off to our rooms where we found a fresh platter of fruit and a bucket of beer. What a nice surprise. We enjoyed a glass of wine during the wine hour and the waitstaff in the Ruby Room made sure we were comfortable. The front desk had a cab waiting on us to take us to dinner. We had a very nice night, slept so comfortably, and overall really enjoyed our brief stay. A great little boutique hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “As promised we went back”
Reviews.Author: Treycb
Reviews.Content: We loved it just as much! Without a 2nd thought, when we bought tickets for a Bruins game, we booked a room at the Onyx exactly 1 year to the day from our first trip. When we found out last minute it was going to snow the morning we were originally supposed to arrive, we were easily accomodated with a 2nd night, and drove in a day early. Everything I mentioned in last year's (January 2011) review stands true, so I will not repeat. But I will touch on a couple of things. The service is amazing! Lauren the receptionist and LJ the bell boy were so welcoming and extremely friendly. They engaged us in conversation from everything about sports to pets. LJ even introduced himself and asked our permission before picking up our bags. He didn't want us to "have some stranger touching our stuff." I would have to say I was a little disappointed in the Valet service this time. When we arrived, my husband (who is handicapped) had to sit in the car while I went in to ask for someone to valet. I don't know if they were short staffed, but I felt we should have been greeted by someone as soon as we pulled up, even if they were not taking the car right away. On the other hand, when we checked out, our car was retrieved very quickly (about 10 minutes). The only other downside was our room was directly across from the janitor's closet, so when they were cleaning in the middle of the night, because the doors are so heavy we could hear them opening and closing the door. Because of our not so great experience,and the number of restaurants in the area, we decided to pass on the hotel's restaurant. However we did try the room service one morning. The food was above fair, arrived a little cooler than I would have liked it, and the french toast was more like standand toast with some cinnamon, but it was not terrible. It is expensive in typical room service fashion. However, my husband enjoyed his eggs and I would be willing to try again. The coffee and wait service was AWESOME! The second morning we were there, we just walked 1 block over to Dunkin Donuts. In addition to a repeat visit to McGanns Irish Pub, we also went next door to Porters Bar and Grill for burgers and a beer after the game. I also highly recommend this restaurant. The food and atmosphere was great. There are soooooooo many hotels to choose from in Boston, but any time we return for a visit to the Garden, the Onyx is the only place we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: MisterPickyEater
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in winter. The staff was super-friendly and helpful, the room clean and quiet. Breakfast in the Ruby Room was way overpriced, however.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Ann S
Reviews.Content: I love the Kimpton chain, and the Onyx met and exceeded my expectations. I was there with my family (husband, 2 kids) for short vacation; the hotel was wonderful in terms of accommodating our needs, giving us adjoining rooms, always being cheerful and helpful when we needed advice, and knowing the city well. One of the staff even lent me her gloves one morning when I went for a run in the cold (I'd forgotten mine). And I love the slightly funky design, furniture and artwork -- I spend a lot of time in hotels for business ,and it's great to see something other than the standard pastel color scheme and boring landscape paintings.

Reviews.Title: “Want to feel special, this is the place.”
Reviews.Author: Becky N
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Onyx several times initially because of its close proximity to the Garden. Now we look forward to the surprises and excellent service the staff provides. For my husband's birthday it was champagne and cheese. When taking our granddaughter to see the Jonas Brothers, it was bottled water for her, a split of wine for me, and a gorgeous fruit tray. Then to add to it they brought her fresh baked cookies after the concert. Wow, what pampering!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawn I
Reviews.Content: We were up in Boston for a very quick weekend trip up from NYC to take care of a few wedding things in Gloucester. The hotel we usually stay at up there was booked so we stayed in Boston at the Onyx and were very happy with our experience. I have always loved Kimpton hotels but this time we were dog sitting and had one extra dog with us so the more than welcoming staff was greatly appreciated. Check in/check out was a breeze, I forgot to bring dog bowls which they supplied for us for free, I also forgot my toiletries bag and they were more than happy to bring up some free things for us to use for the night. The staff is extremely friendly and I love the fact that they are a nice, clean and trendy hotel that welcomes dogs! Also with no weight restrictions or a fee they truly do mean it when they say they are dog friendly! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Onyx In Boston is an EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: bob g
Reviews.Content: I come here anytime I go to a bruins game as the hotel is basically accross the street and just 2 short blocks from the t line. Lauren Weir who emailed me before my arrival was very nice and went out of her way to make me feel welcome. IN fact I mentioned to her how much I enjoy diet coke and she sent some up to my room no charge which was appreciated and came out of the blue. This hotel cares about their guests as I have stayed there often over the past few years since i discovered it online.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, easy access to attractions”
Reviews.Author: MaineTraveler24
Reviews.Content: Great location beside the Garden, two blocks from North Station T-stop and a five minute walk to Faneuil Hall, North End, or Beacon Hill area. Beds are comfortable with lots of pillows. Lots of extra touches to make it a great stay- free wine hour, robes, free internet with kimpton loyalty program- all added to the experience. We booked the Onyx because of a deal on their website. If you can get this hotel for a good rate, it is definitely worth it! Parking is too expensive, but if you can find a cheap place to park outside the city and take the T or train into North Station, you will save some money. Rooms are a bit smaller, but comfortable, and if you are visiting Boston you probably won't spend much time in your room. The only complaint I'd have is that it can be a little noisy- on a Saturday night around 2am we could hear a few people yelling in the street outside the bars, and you can hear vehicles going by sometimes. Staff is very attentive and friendly. Great place to stay- will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: TravCT2
Reviews.Content: Came to town for a conference and stayed for first time at the Onyx. Desk staff were great - enthusiastic and accommodating. Rooms were eclectic and bright. Freebies of being a Kimpton frequent user were great. Not sure about the leopard print bathrobe but quirky is part of the charm :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Teacker
Reviews.Content: Booked for a one night stay to take in a Bruins game in Boston. Location couldn't be more convenient to the Garden. Hotel is older but very quaint and cozy. Rooms are on the smaller side but perfect for our purposes. Only complaint was that they didn't have free internet access. In this day and age a must! Come on Kimpton- time to modernize! Free internet would lead to a 5 star review!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Boston”
Reviews.Author: BessAust
Reviews.Content: First time in Boston and a very warm welcome from the front desk staff (one Lauren, before we met the other the next morning!). Small room but nice decor etc, including very comfy bed. Evening wine hour is always nice, and staff gave some good recommendations on getting around. We discovered how small Boston is and were able to walk around easily. Nice pub next door too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 2DogsatHome
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights this past December and was very happy with the hotel location. It is very close to the Garden and a short distance from Quincy Market. The room was clean albeit fairly small. We were given the option to choose 3 upgrades - via an email several days before our stay - that we did not avail ourselves to. We could have had a larger room for $50 extra per night, early check-in or late check-out for a nominal fee. There is free coffee, hot chocolate and spa-water in the lobby all day long and a bar with some light meal options. The hotel is pet friendly but doesn't smell like it. The staff are super friendly and helpful with directions, recommendations, etc. The negatives are that you have to pay a small fortune to valet your car here. The walls are also pretty thin and we had a romantic couple on side and an "excited/emotional" child on the other. The work out room is in the basement and is very small and sparse. I think there were 3 treadmills and 2 bikes. They had run out of towels and it didn't look like a lot of attention was being paid to it. Ice machines are located on every other floor. I would stay here again but likely upgrade to a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Drea012
Reviews.Content: Cute boutique hotel! Rooms are beautiful, functional and the beds as with all Kimpton hotels are the best! The hotel is in a great location, very close to the Garden and T if youâ€™re looking for that. The customer service was excellent, used their â€œforgot it, we got itâ€� service and had hairspray up to my room in no time and had the bellmen hold my luggage after check out so I could do some shopping as I was not leaving the city until later in the afternoon. The lobby area is small, they host their evening wine hour there and it can get a bit crowded with people coming and going.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've ever stayed in !!!!”
Reviews.Author: downeasttraveler053
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was amazing. I've traveled all ove the world, and have never run across such accommodating, cheerful helpful staff. Lauren and Michael at the front desk were especially kind. The rooms were fabulous - clean, spacious, beautifully decorated. The beds were the most comfortable of any I've ever slept in!! When we arrived, we were greeted by chilled bottled water, a plate of fresh sliced fruit, and a very nice handwritten note from the hotel staff. The buffet breakfast was superb. Every evening a free glass of wine was served in the lobby. Coffee/Tea service in the lobby in the morning was complimentary, and was of the utmost quality. There was always iced lemon water in the lobby also. Such attention to detail is not common nowadays. We had appointments at Mass General Hospital, and asked to leave our luggage in the room after checkout time. It was no problem. I can't say enough nice things about this hotel!! Roger, Karen and Lauren Quirk, Lubec, Maine.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton experience but not as nice as the Marlowe!”
Reviews.Author: tomeghale
Reviews.Content: Kimpton hotels are generally pretty awesome and I have to admit i was psyche to get to try a new one in Boston. The onyx is close to Boston garden in the north end, and since I usually stay at the Marlowe in Cambridge, I was excited to see how the onyx fared. Let me say this - it was a solid hotel experience, but not as good as my other kimpton stays. The bed was fantastic, the furnishings and style top end, but I missed the designer public spaces and high quality restaurant/bar i've come to expect. This felt more like an efficiency hotel for someone who was not going to spend any time in the hotel. Plus: they had a car service ready to go on demand, which was a lifesaver as it was tricky to catch a cab. Minus: the lobby/restaurant was small and not as welcoming as other kimpton properties.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Place When In Town For A Game.”
Reviews.Author: RangerAngel
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Boston, and came to see my Rangers take on the Bruins on 1/21. Another hotel was suggested to me, but I had discovered the Onyx by accident and based on convenience to the T and to the TD Garden, so my friend who I was traveling with decided to spend a few bucks more and stay there. We had arrived about 2 hours before check-in time and were prepared to leave our luggage and sight see. The friendly desk staff (they all were) looked to see if anything was available, and lo and behold we were able to get settled in before heading out. As many have mentioned, rooms are small. If you're just 1 or 2 people each with a carry-on it's perfect. (I can't speak to other rooms, but the room we stayed in would not provide adequate room for a family.) But it's quirkily decorated, with faux fur throws on the beds, the checkered carpet. Oh yeah, and the fabulously tacky animal print bathrobes. The bathroom was a nice size and there was adequate room for 2 ladies to fit all their toiletries. The room was clean and the beds comfortable. From our room on the 3rd floor, there was no scenic view (we looked out what may have been the back of other buindings on the block behind us). But that was not what we were there for so it was not an issue for us. The only issue we ran into was when we returned from The Four's after celebrating the Rangers' OT win, our room keys did not work. But that was quickly rectified with a simple visit to the front desk. After a little talk about the game, it was back to the room, with working keys. I would like to come back and explore more of the city, as time did not permit us to see a whole lot. I would certainly consider making the Onyx my "home base" again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but loaded with personality!”
Reviews.Author: onlinequeen
Reviews.Content: The Onyx is a small hotel in the North end area of Boston, just steps from the TD Bank Garden. Keeping with Kimpton charm, this hotel offers very friendly, VIP service to all their customers. They even made arrangements weeks in advance for me to a driver take me to the airport at 5am, at a very low fare I might add. The king corner room was very nice, and complimentary wine and beer in the lobby at 5pm was a fun, cozy eperience. Though they have a small bar and restaurant at the hotel, we opted to walk around the North End and find a spot we hadn't tried before. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: shanehb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Onyx Hotel in November for 4 nights, and we were very impressed. The service in this hotel is excellent; every member of staff we came in contact with went out of their way to be of assistance to us. The rooms were well appointed and very clean. We joined the Kimpton Hotels In-Touch programme prior to our stay, and I'm glad we did. Free wi-fi, welcome bottle of wine, welcome bottles of water, plus a $10 gift voucher so you can 'raid the mini bar'. All nice touches. I will not definitely be staying in Kimpton Hotels when I have the opportunity

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, chic lobby, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Guest_from_NewportRI
Reviews.Content: Needed a room in Boston for an early morning meeting so we found a great deal at the Onyx, a Kimpton Hotel, a chain we had never stayed with. Greeted in the chic lobby at check in, we immediately were offered a complimentary glass of wine and help getting checked in. Rooms we nicely decorated and the bed was comfortable with a great bathroom. Best of all was the outstanding service there, from check in to check out staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. When I forgot my toiletries bag at check out, a call to the hotel lost and found got a reply back within an hour to make plans to ship me my forgotten items. Special thanks to Sophia at the front desk who went out of her way to help me address a delay with valet services getting my car at checkout and getting me my forgotten items back. We will definitely be back on our next visit to Boston to catch a Bruins or Celtics game as the Garden is a 2 minute walk away..

Reviews.Title: “Busy hotel, loud clientele”
Reviews.Author: MaineTravelGirl77
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel when looking for a place close to the Boston Garden. It IS close to the Garden, so in that respect it met our needs. The hotel is clean and has attractive contemporary decor. We checked in after a Bruins game, and had to wait a while for valet service. I was told upon check in around other customers that I needed to provide another credit card due to mine being expired, which it was not. This was embarrassing. The beds are very firm, which doesn't work well for us, but that is a personal preference. My most disappointing experience was the loud, drunk people who set up outside of our room/near the elevator and hung out for hours in the middle of the night. The valet service in the morning was much better, as we called ahead to have our car ready for us. We weren't asked about our stay, but rather hurried out because there were several people checking out at once. This was very different from the other reviewer's experiences with the hotel's service. Maybe is was an off weekend?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Topnotch Service!”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyMaine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel spur of the moment for a mid-week mini-vacation in the North End of Boston. From the moment we walked into the hotel until the time we drove away, we received great service. The staff was profession in demeanor, experienced in their jobs, and anxious to please in an understated way. Each time we left for an excursion into the North End, we were wished a happy trip and greeted when we returned. The desk staff worked efficiently and pleasantly. The breakfast choices were either the cold buffet or the hot buffet. Both were very good. Our room was cleaned well by pleasant staff as well. My two suggestions would be that there be a more comfortable chair in our room so that reading could be more relaxing and that the table be a bit larger so that the Keurig coffeemaker would fit better.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Extra-Accomodating and Child Friendly”
Reviews.Author: MrOnion2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Onyx in mid-December before heading up to Maine for the Christmas and New Year break and I have to say that we were very pleased with everything the Onyx did for us during our stay. From the welcoming reception staff and the very informative Bell-Boy who helped us with our bags to Joe behind the bar and the excellent free wine hour, everything was done with a smile and we felt able to ask anyone about anything we wanted to know in the local area. The staff gave us some great tips about where to eat and what to see in our limited time with them, and for this we thank them. They were spot on each time. We felt safe walking around, even with two young children (6 & 8) and the hotel is an easy walk to Quincy Market, the NE Aquarium and most other tourist areas. We walked the shops and the Frog Pond, and if you don't fancy the walk the tram station is close at hand. We would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for looking at colleges”
Reviews.Author: travelmagic
Reviews.Content: My high school daughter and I stayed in Boston in order to visit Tufts, Harvard, and Brandeis. After extensive research on Tripadvisor I chose this hotel. It was perfect for our needs--a beautiful, fairly new, clean hotel. Rooms were small but fine for the two of us. The location was great for us getting to public transportation to the various colleges. We liked being able to walk to the North End for dinner (it is a little walk, but we like to walk--we felt pretty safe at night, too). We also had one day for sightseeing and the location was fine for that too (we walked alot). The breakfast was expensive at the hotel. We went across the street to Au Bon Pain and got breakfast (not open on Sunday however). I highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again if ever in Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: OhioTravelerZ
Reviews.Content: My wide and I went for a weekend to Boston and stayed at the onyx....great place! Staff was over the top accommodating, free wine happy hour, and accepted pets. Room was very modern and hotel atmosphere was great. Great location if seeing game at the garden.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: sara0721
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Onyx Hotel December 9th and 10th. I picked this hotel because we were participating in a pub crawl on the 10th that ended at The Harp which was right around the corner. The hotel was very nice and very clean. Our room was pretty standard with a king bed. I liked the color scheme of black, white and red. It seemed very modern considering the building is pretty old. The room was small, but it's what you expect in Boston. The staff that greated us were very friendly. Check in and check out was a breeze. All of the staff were nice, making a point to say hello, or have a nice day as we left and greeting us as we returned. I accidently broke the plastic lock on the mini-bar, so I immediately thought we would get charged for something but we did not. I was glad it wasn't an issue at all. The hotel is in great walking distance to Haymarket, the North End, the Boston Garden and if you don't mind walking you can get to the Common and the Public Gardens very easily. They had free maps upon check in that were great if you didn't know where you were going. And the hotel is about 4 minutes from the subway so it's very easy to get around the city. I would highly recommend this hotel. We had a very enjoyable stay and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Kimpton I know and love”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorVacation
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Onyx because it was convenient to where I was traveling and part of the Kimpton family, one of my favorite chains. However, this hotel did not live up to the brand. They did have all of the great amenities (happy hour, free wireless, free minibar), but the room was very outdated and poorly decorated. The valet rate was excessive (it was Downtown Boston, but almost $50 is nuts) and they cater to pets (which is probably good if you have one, but if you don't be forewarned). Overall, would not stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “*Almost* perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: milril44
Reviews.Content: PROS: The hotel is about two blocks away from North Station (Green Line) and also within less than two blocks is CVS, Subway, 7 Eleven, Bank of America, Soverign Bank and TD Garden. Also within walking distance of a beautiful Holocaust Memorial and Fanniuell (sp?) Hall. The hotel is very dog friendly - so much so that if your dog is staying there, they have a welcome sign with his/her name and a bowl of water and kibble in the lobby (ADORABLE). According to the hotel guide book, they also walk and babysit your dog for free. Totally awesome. The rooms are clean, decent sized, modern art deco type furnishings, in room safe, hairdryer, robes, nice wide sink, Gilcrest & Soames and Essential Elements toiletries, got very reasonable rate on Expedia for $169 a night (not including taxes). The people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. There was a small gym room in the basement with about five - seven machines with tv's in the consoles and headphones and a business center (one Mac computer). CONS: The location is both a blessing and a curse. There are 3 bars on the block and it is one block from TD Garden. There was a home game and you could clearly hear the fans honking their horns, shouting, talking and laughing on the street below, even though we were on the fifth floor! The walls, doors and windows are thin, so we could also hear some noise in the hallway. But once the crowds thinned and left, it was generally quiet. The only other quibbles I have: the one Mac computer they have you must pay to use and the lobby was a bit dark. If I was returning to Boston, I would definitely return to the Onyx, but making sure to bring my earplugs if there is a game at TD Garden.

Reviews.Title: “The best of Boston!!”
Reviews.Author: Azonetworkmanager
Reviews.Content: I am a Kimpton Loyalty member and I am a loyal Kimpton fan. In a country that prides itself on its customer service, as an Englishman abroad I have to say that the service offered at their hotels in unsurpassed! This is my third stay at The Onyx in five years and to be greeted by name on arrival made me feel immediately at home! I don't leave until tomorrow, but I just wanted to say a huge thank you to both the Lauren's, Jon and all at the front desk, a particular mention for Kevin whom I met at the Nine Zero last year...quite superb at his job and real gent to boot! This had yet again been my home from home and a great one to come back to each day! Well done Team Onyx....you rock!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small room”
Reviews.Author: nhunixguy
Reviews.Content: I want to give the Onyx a 4.5. It's clean, mostly quiet, and fun in the Kimpton way. There were well-behaved dogs in the lobby and the staff was always happy to do anything they could to make our one night stay pleasant. There were no problems, but I found room 1008 to be really small, I thought the HVAC system was noisy, and parking seemed expensive at $42/night. I liked the Marlowe (another nearby Kimpton property) more and if I could choose between the two, the Marlowe would win. Having said that, the Onyx is convenient to the North End and to the Faneuil Hall area, and it's easy to drive to and from this hotel, so it's a good bet for tourists. The neighborhood is noisy and not Boston's most impressive, but it's not bad either. If you're thinking of coming to Boston as a tourist for a few days, here's how to get the most out of the Onyx: First, join Kimpton's free InTouch program. You'll get email telling you when there's a sale and when there is, make reservations fast because rooms don't last long. And wi-fi is free if you're an InTouch member. Now see if there's anything happening at the nearby Fleet Center (aka TD Garden). You're staying nearby so check it out. If you like Italian food, make reservations for dinner in Boston's North End. We went to Marco and it was amazing. Stay 2 or 3 nights, and let the staff at the Onyx help you decide what to do. As long as you don't mind the small room, you'll love it. Okay, this should be a five-star review, right? If this was a regular hotel, I'd easily say yes. But this is a Kimpton and they've spoiled me over the last 15 years so I expect a lot. By Kimpton standards, the Onyx is actually sort of average. But Kimpton's average is pretty amazing and there was nothing they could have done better, so I'm going to call it excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Just like the W”
Reviews.Author: Brent E
Reviews.Content: A trendy boutique hotel. Rooms are tiny, though nice. The leopard-print robes are a bit odd. Great location for the garden and a quick walk to Faneuil Hall and the rest of the city. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite spot in Beantown”
Reviews.Author: megawattage
Reviews.Content: I cannot express to you enough how wonderful this hotel is, how amazing the staff are, or how likely we are to stay again. The staff is fantastic and responsive; the rooms beautiful (albeit a little small, they were nice for a city room). The bathroom was very-nicely sized with all the additional accoutrements available. Though we stayed over a holiday and couldn't take advantage of room service or the restaurant, it was a short walk to all the Freedom Trail sites, the best Italian eateries, tons of pubs, 7-11 and the T! We had our pups with us and they seemed to be just as at-home as we were. I highly recommend this chain, and this hotel in particular, for any of your travel needs...<3

Reviews.Title: “Holy cannoli! I've never been treated with such amazing customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Dsp1974
Reviews.Content: I booked our room through the Internet and put in a note stating that it was my 4 year anniversary. My husband and I arrived and were informed that we were upgraded to the penthouse room. That would have been more than enough for us, however we opened the door to our room and disscovered that it had been decorated with rose petals EVERYWHERE, chocolate covered strawberries, and a bottle of champagne!!! The Onyx has clearly done their job in hiring the best staff in Boston. Everybody is knowledgable, helpful and extremely kind. We didn't think it could get much better until we decided to order room service at 1am. After a very short wait, our meal arrived and we were told it was "on the house!!!". Really, WHAT HOTEL DOES THAT??? Oh, and by the way, the meal was fantastic! If you want to be treated like royalty stay at the Onyx!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ALA51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Onyx primarily due to its super-convenient location one block from TD Garden. After experiencing the warm hospitality, the comfortable beds, and the surrounding neighborhood, we will be back! We were greeted warmly every time we entered the hotel. The staff was quick to suggest things to make us more comfortable, such as an umbrella if it looked like rain. We were on the penthouse floor and our room was a good size and it was very quiet. It was a quick walk to the North End and convenient to public transportation. The Wi-fi was the best we have encountered in a hotel anywhere---as good as our home wi-fi. This was our first stay in a Kimpton and we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Onyx Hotel- Will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: casey99
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Onyx for 1 night in November and cannot say enough about the property. We were able to check in early as we had reservations for an event at 3pm . Lauren, at the front desk, was so accommodating and helpful through out our stay. She is a great example of how customers should be treated. The Onynx provides personalized, friendly service that I do not usually find at other hotels. The room was great, beds comfortable, and immaculate clean. The location is great if you want to explore the city on foot. The complimentary coffee in morning is a great "perk". This is the second Kimpton Hotel I have stayed at and will definitely consider them again when making any travel plans.

Reviews.Title: “Right On, Onyx!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew R
Reviews.Content: Went to see the Foo Fighters in Boston this week - and found the Onyx to be the perfect hotel for us. It was intimate - very classy, and warm. The employees all treated us like gold, and the accommodations were VERY nice. Clean rooms, comfortable beds - and the place is pretty cute! (Also, I work for an elevator company...and the elevators were in fine working order). They offered free coffee in the morning, strawberry ice water throughout - and even a complimentary happy hour; all this just a short 2-3 minute walk from the "Boston Garden". Don't really know what else to say. We did plan ahead and stayed in the penthouse (for a very reasonable rate)...and it was super secure and very quiet! Kudos.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Stay at the Onyx”
Reviews.Author: WhereamInow09
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Onyx on a quick business trip to Boston. The hotel is in a great central location - adjacent to the Arena and close to many restaurants and bars. After dinner off-site we grabbed a drink at the hotel bar and there were many Hockey fans that were in town for that night's game. Rooms were well outfitted with great linens and mini bar was well stocked with good snack options. The only downside to the stay were the hotel guests that decided to yell in the hallway at 3am. Other than that, I would fully recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Walls are too thin!!!”
Reviews.Author: gnat_NYC
Reviews.Content: We are loyal members of the Kimpton chain but this hotel by far has been the worst experience. We were staying on the 9th floor and could every conversation coming from the room next door. I even had earplugs in and it was non-stop til 3am! The staff was gracious enough to try and get them to keep it quiet but to no avail. The next night of our stay we requested a move and was moved up to the penthouse level. It was great for a while but after 1am, our neighbors next door decided to have a party. They were even playing around with the joining room door trying to open it. Up all night and then awoken again at 9am with the frat boys next door. The location is great and the customer service is fantastic but if you want to sleep, forget about it. The Nine Zero is better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay - Our Dog Loved It Too!”
Reviews.Author: TheCanuckChick
Reviews.Content: As the proud parents of a fuzzy four-legged canine "son", we are constantly looking for good dog-friendly hotel options while on road trips from Toronto. The Onyx did not disappoint! We love a good 8-10 hour road trip but few hotels welcome dogs. A handful of chains do, but don't truly make for a dog-friendly experience. In such establishments, owners need to be present in the room with the dogs or have to crate them while out for dinner. Anyone reading this who has a dog will know that crating a dog for a couple of hours isn't ideal in an "outside of the home" environment. ALONG COMES KIMPTON! YAY! We learned about Kimpton's dog-friendly services online and researched them here on TripAdvisor and are so glad we did! Our experience at the hotel was amazing! We checked in with our dog and were welcomed with open arms. Based on Kimpton's email blitzes and website blurbs about dogs, I almost expected staff to make a bigger deal out of how cute our pooch was, but since there were apparently several other dogs in residence, ours was just another guest. Fair enough. LOL! The nice part of staying at a Kimpton hotel with a dog is that you're put on a floor with other dog owners and you can leave your dog in the room - uncrated - to go out for dinner/shop/etc. On top of that, if you plan on being out for more than a couple of hours, you can hire staff for a very fair rate to stay in the room/entertain Fido/walk the dog/Etc. Guests without dogs: Have no fear! As mentioned, the rooms for dog owners are confined to specific blocks/levels. Plus, they only allow a certain number of dogs on site per night. On to the room! We loved the decor and leopard robes. :) The room was not especially spacious for the price but it was chic and comfortable. We had plenty of space for our two suitcases and our dog bed so all was fine. I have paid more for less at other places. The room had all of the right amenities compactly tucked into space saving shelving. Again, the room's design was lots of fun and felt cozy and comfortable. The wine "happy hour" in the lobby was a nice perk. The lobby itself was quite small so we felt a little crowded. It wasn't like we could kick back and sip on a leisurely glass of vino. But it was fun anyway. I mean, really, there should be no complaining about free wine! :) The wine reception is a very smart concept because it gives Kimpton staff the opportunity to answer a bunch of guests' questions all at once. It probably takes pressure off the front desk/concierge later in the evening as they won't have to deal with constant calls asking about restaurant recommendations, directions, etc. As a guest, it's simply refreshing to speak with staff in person rather than on the phone. It felt more personal. Valet parking was efficient and the usual pricing applied. (I can't remember what we paid but it was at par with any US/Canadian metropolitan city.) The location makes for an excellent base exploring the city and is especially close to the Boston Garden, Quincy Market and North End. We started our evening off with some authentic clam chowder at a pub in the market followed by the best pizza I've ever had at the famous Regina Pizzeria in the North End. After a wee walk we were able to justify indulging in the outstanding dessert cannoli from Modern Pasty. We bought extra cannoli to enjoy on our drive the next day, but our dog found them when we weren't looking and gobbled them up! Lucky dog! LOL! Needless to say, you will find much to do in the area and the subway is nearby as well. You really won't need to drive in Beantown. Nor would you want to. I've driven all over North America but always get confused with all of the little one way streets in Boston! :) The only downfall was that we only had time on this particular trip to stay just one night! We would have loved to stay longer! We will definitely be back. I have always liked Boston and can't wait to return to The Onyx with our pooch and explore the city again. I need more time so I can go shopping and enjoy more of the amazing restaurants that have popped up over the past few years. I looked at their website today (November 12, 2011 and it looks like they have some good specials on 3 night stays in January! The travel bug is biting! Don't hesitate to book this deal if you can! Boston is beautiful in the winter!) Thank you Onyx for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: titilulu4
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Onyx Boston. The room was a bit small but that is to be expected from a boutique hotel. Very comfortable huge beds. Pet friendly, I love that. Friendly and very helpful staff, cool decor and great location in close proximity to attractions and just a short walk to the Celtics TD Garden and the North Station. We hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Location a plus (and a minus)”
Reviews.Author: Dyova
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 2 nights over a weekend at the Onyx, and were pleased with the hotel amenities: bed was very comfy, room was not cramped (one expects relatively small rooms in the heart of the city), bathroom nicely appointed, and morning coffee in the lobby was a nice touch. We didn't take advantage of the nightly wine tasting or eat anything at the bar restaurant. As others have mentioned, you should become a Kimpton loyalty program member before checking in, to get free wireless and a $10 credit for the mini bar. ($10 won't go very far, however, when it's $6 for a large bottle of water or $4 for a bag of chips that elsewhere costs less than $1: the price of convenience, I guess!). The lobby can get a bit cramped when many people are checking out around the same time, but that's not a huge issue. The front desk personnel were friendly and responsive. We were slightly peeved by noise late at night in the streets below, when the local bars close. On Friday and Saturday nights, we could hear drunken folks in the streets despite being on the 8th floor. Perhaps a room on the back side of the building would be quieter. None of the lots nearby allow overnight parking, so we went with the hotel valet service. Not cheap, but convenient. However, the person who took our car into the garage late Saturday night apparently forgot to turn off the lights, and the battery was dead the next morning. They didn't tell us this, and offered no explanation for why our car was an hour late being delivered in the morning despite our having called in a half hour in advance. But when we finally got the car, it was clear there had been an electrical interruption because the clock was blinking and the anti-theft lock on the audio system needed to be reprogrammed. Luckily it was all easily restored and a relatively minor inconvenience. But the hotel should have been upfront that a mistake had been made, instead of trying to cover it up. When we complained, we were graciously credited the two-day parking fee, yet then shortly afterwards, we were charged again for one day. Not very smooth, as we pointed out to them. They then re-credited the second day, but the damage had been done: we weren't upset about the money, we were disappointed with their lack of professionalism and transparency. One problem with the garage shouldn't prevent you from staying at the Onyx. The location was fantastic for walking throughout the city, even if its situation right by a bunch of sports bars may mean some late-night noise in the streets. You're less than 10 minutes' walk from the heart of the North End, 10 minutes to Beacon Hill, and just a bit further to the public gardens. If we had paid rack rates our rating would be much lower, but we got a very good deal through Priceline so that tempers the criticism quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Onyx Hotel a Gem in Boston”
Reviews.Author: bobswifecleveland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Boston Onyx Hotel (a Kimpton Hotel) in September and were extremely pleased with this property. It was within walking distance to the Quincy Market and other major Boston attractions. The staff was excellent and very friendly always helpful with any questions we had, and actually a lot of fun! The price was right inline with other Boston hotels and we would definetly stay there again when we return to the area. Our room was on the smallish side but VERY comfortable and Quiet. Loved this Hotel and its staff!! They also offered free wine in our room waiting for us and when we said we did not drink, they sent up Diet Cokes which was terrific-on the house.

Reviews.Title: “Smallish, friendly, cool decor”
Reviews.Author: cwight55
Reviews.Content: We chose this for our first trip to Boston (from London). The area is a bit post-industrial in feel, reminding me of the scarier parts of Liverpool or Manchester, but that was just the impression we had arriving after dark, and after a long and tiring journey. Might not suit the elderly (I am 56!). Actually the location is handy, 3 mins from North T station, with a very decent bar (Porter's) next door. If coming from Logan airport, you have one easy change to make. Lively and efficient welcome, with the young and intelligent staff up for 'the craic', which suits me fine. A clean, stylish and comfortable hotel. Room service was excellent value: in fact one sandwich with fries was supper for us both. Breakfast a bit pricey; suggest you grab the free coffee or tea and go elsewhere to eat. Free wifi worked well.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: mykk02
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked through priceline so it wasn't our choice, but what a find. They didn't have a king room for the whole 5 night stay but they offered us either the larger handicapped twin room or the choice of moving hotel rooms if we wanted a king room for 3 of the 5 nights. We opted to stay in the twin room for the duration. The decor was lovely and the room clean. The leopard print robes finished off the look perfectly. When we rang down on the first morning to ask if we had to collect the coffee from the lobby or did we order it to the room, a coffee machine was bought up and topped up daily. The location of the hotel was great for easy access to the touristy areas and if you don't like to walk the T station is a 2 min walk away. The staff were fabulous especially on our last day when we weren't quite ready to leave but had already checked out. The bar was closed but staff bought us coffees (for free) and called us a cab when we were ready to leave. Nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Kate23454
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a family wedding and had a complicated set of reservations, with people constantly coming and going. The staff were wonderful! They helped us with reservations and transportation, helped search for a lost item, checked on our well-being, and were without exception exceedingly friendly and helpful. The rooms and the lobby area are not large, but that is not unusual for an urban boutique hotel. We got a great rate through Snique Away. The location was perfect for our purposes--only a couple of blocks from the T for the younger members of our group--and having an Au Bon Pain right across the street was very convenient too. Very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kaye S
Reviews.Content: We got a deal on Sniqueaway.com that enabled us to stay 3 nights at the Onyx. The room was small, but the location was the best. We were close to transit and were given great directions when we walked. The breakfast in the morning was expensive and not all that special, so we opted to go around the corner to Duncan Donuts. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. The location was very quiet. We were quite happy with our stay

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in downtown”
Reviews.Author: plcape
Reviews.Content: Location is okay near North Station and T.D.Garden so if you are coming to city for hockey or basketball this is great. There are some local restaurants but better off going to North End which is walkable. Hotel itself is well done. Lobby is small but comfortable. Rooms are a decent size,very clean, nicely furnished. Staff was friendly at check in. Really good value!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: IndyMedic2006
Reviews.Content: This is a Great little boutique hotel. The lobby is small but has very nice bar/lounge and a very friendly and helpful staff including the two Jon's and Lauren. They were very accommadating at helping with dinner reservations, getting a cab to the airport, and getting the cables I needed to hook my laptop up to the TV in our room. I couldn't have asked for a better bed. The room was very clean. I liked the faux mink throw at the foot of the bed and the leopard print bathrobes. My only disappoint was that there was no coffee make, microwave or fridge (besides the mini-bar fridge). As a Diabetic, it is always nice have a fridge so I dont have to ice my insulin. I would recommend the hotel to anyone. It is in a great location and within walking distance from the aquarium, Boston Commons and Boston Gardens. You can see TD Gardens from the bedroom window.

Reviews.Title: “Urban hotel in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: Triangletravel
Reviews.Content: The Onyx is one of the Kimpton hotels and while it was nice, it wasn't my favorite. Situated on a street lined with brick buildings and close to restaurants it was an urban stopover for our group. The lounge is a signature red but in the daytime its a little brash. The rooms were well appointed but very small. The staff had their smiles on but we didn't have a sense of any warmth from them. Overall, it was certainly an upscale hotel, but I wouldn't stay long at this one.

Reviews.Title: “The service is worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Katrinar787
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend at the Onyx hotel for my sister's bachelorette weekend. The decor was very fun for the occasion (the leopard print robes are so fun). The staff was so incredibly friendly and accommodating from booking to checkout. They quickly resolved a error in my reservation months in advance and jumped into action when I had a problem with my room, making sure I stayed in a room I was comfortable with. Lauren, at the front desk, was a sweetheart and very knowledgeable of the area. They even gave me late check-out the day of which really helped with planning. Plus the location is amazing (in walking distance from the north end, Quincy market, Backbay, Etc.) The Ruby Room served as a the perfect place to start our night as its very intimate and quiet. Hint: The Ruby room is a private establishment not owned by Kimpton so sometimes they have functions and close the room to guests. Hint: Become a Kimpton in-touch member online (completely free) and there are perks (free internet, newspapers, Etc.) Also, the Kimpton is a boutique hotel so the rooms are on the smaller side (even with two beds, fitting four guests is very hard).

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: tamwil7
Reviews.Content: Really small rooms with alot of excess furniture in them. Ruby Restaurant is a joke and the Bartender is horrible. I will definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel near TD Garden and North End”
Reviews.Author: sportytraveler89
Reviews.Content: The Onyx is a great hotel. The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming. They remembered my friend and me after when we returned after a year! The location is awesome to see sporting events at the garden, just down the block. There are plenty of great restaurants and bars within walking distance. But you never need to go outside of the hotel if you don't want to. The hotel restaurant has fantastic food, the lounge has a very cool vibe and the room service is overly accommodating. They ran out of muffins one morning and instead of telling us we had to order something else, they had them delivered from a local bakery! Did I say I love this hotel!?! It's definitely my first choice on any trip to Boston. It should be yours, too. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: 1VirginiaTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Onyx was perfectly located in the the equally perfectly walkable City of Boston. My wife and I loved the proximity to the North End, Beacon Hill and Charles Street, as well as the Boylston Area. We actually had a nice stroll all the way to the South End for art and food. The hotel itself was really just a launch pad to the surrounding area, but it had all we required, including 5 p.m. cocktails. The property is a little dimly lit and about 10 to 15 years dated in decor, but the staff are friendly and helpful and the price was right on Snique-away.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is defined by the Onyx.”
Reviews.Author: MowerFamily
Reviews.Content: The Onyx is located near the North End of Boston and close to the Garden ... you are able to walk to many great sites - the Freedom Trail, Aquarium, Quincy Market etc ... or take the "T" or a cab for all the other great spots in Boston. The staff were top notch and met or exceeded our expectations (and isn't that nice, for a change!) they even provided us with a goldfish for our two 8 year olds to enjoy while we stayed. The rooms have a small footprint so if you do bring your family members - small and or large - suggest that you get two rooms adjoining/connecting so you have enough space. We enjoyed our time at the Onyx and look forward to staying at one of her sister properties in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Desk and great location”
Reviews.Author: robert l
Reviews.Content: Just spent 12 days at the Onyx Hotel in Portland Street, Boston and cannot praise the staff and hotel more highly. Mum and Dad and two 16 year olds were made to feel very welcome by Michael and team on the desk- hugely knowledgeable about Boston and surrounds and a very pleasant and welcoming atmosphere is apparent. For families, I can really recommend the use of adjoining rooms behind a common access door, which can be opened by both room keys- allows privacy per room, but you can open up both room doors behind the access door too. Portland Street in Boston is a good location for all the city has to offer- 3 mins walk to North Street Station, 10 mins to the North side ( great food!) and no more than 15 mins to either harbour or Boston Park. Tip- use the trains and the subway to get out and about. Taxis are not expensive by European standards too. If it's your first time to Boston, make sure you check out the weather and temperature forecast- walking can be great, but beware temperature extremes. It can get very hot and very cold. Great time and thanks to the great staff for a memorable stay, somewhat longer than expected courtesy of Hurricane Irene...

Reviews.Title: “Great start but poor finish”
Reviews.Author: MJoan66
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Onyx hotel fairly late at night, tired and ready to relax. The front desk person was so fantastic- friendly and welcoming- she even gave us wine to take up to our room, where we were suprised by a welcome fruit plate and nice note. My expectations were high at this point, I suppose that's why I was so disappointed in the lack of service given when our room was made up each day. The empty fruit plate remained in our room during the course of our 4 night stay and the coffee was never replaced- even after I left a note requesting more. I have never seen such poor housekeeping, which is too bad because they are doing some things so right. I wouldn't discourage anyone from staying here, but I would suggest speaking to the management right away instead of letting it slide, like I did, and then having a bad impression on departure.

Reviews.Title: “Another winner”
Reviews.Author: Dave707
Reviews.Content: We've become Kimpton fans...we have yet to stay and not had a great experience...and the Onyx continued the trend. Absolutely no complaints...room was great, clean and comfortable....front desk staff was pleasant and knowledgeable. Did not eat onsite, but the lobby bar area was a great place to end the days adventures with a cocktail. If this trend continues I may have to restrict our vacation travel to cities with Kimpton properties...;-).

Reviews.Title: “Another Perfect Stay at Onyx!”
Reviews.Author: Meghan D
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in until we walked out the door the next morning, the staff was amazing. They were happy to answer any questions and fill any requests we had. The room was spotless. I never feel like I'm staying at a hotel when I'm at a Kimpton property, I feel like I'm staying in a friends posh guest room. There is no better hotel experience than Kimpton!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaFenwayI30
Reviews.Content: I arrived in the pouring rain after a horrible day at work, feeling really sick, and the check-in was so quick and friendly. The woman asked how my trip was, if I needed a map of the area, a dinner recommendation, just was really really nice. The room was great- and the bed was so comfortable. I was very sick and I still slept amazingly. The room service was up in close to 15 minutes- and I had a great salad for dinner. The next morning, check-out again was very fast and friendly. They seemed genuinely happy that you were staying there. It was a great value. For those who are not familiar with Boston, it is a great location walking distance to the North Station Bars, the North End, and the Faneuil Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Constantine-TA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Onyx Hotel over the Labour Day weekend. Our 2nd floor room (202) was small and facing the roof and an ac unit, but clean and comfortable. Bathroom was a decent size with good water pressure. This hotel is conveniently located 3-5 minutes on foot from the North Station and about 10 minutes away from the Quincy Market. Lots of restaurants and pubs around as well as a 7-11 on the corner. Two things were a let down: 1) When we checked in and went to our room - we discovered that it wasn't properly cleaned after the previous guests (e.g., dirty wine glasses, unmade bed, etc.). However, once we spoke with the reception, we got a different room within the next 15-20 minutes. These things happen but are nonetheless annoying. 2) Breakfast was rather disorganized in terms of service. We only had breakfast at Onyx once per our stay (thanks to the complimentary breakfast cards) and didn't eat there again after finding that fruits were not fresh and somewhat spoiled... However, overall we enjoyed staying at the Onyx Hotel and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dklskgray
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of many Boston attractions. The location, friendly staff, and clean room comfortable room made this a great vacation. We stayed for 3 nights with our teenage son. The room is a bit small, like probably most in Boston, but the hotel amenities were wonderful. Besides I didn't go to Boston to be in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - even through a hurricane.”
Reviews.Author: MistyLuv79
Reviews.Content: The Onyx was a great place to stay on my first trip to Boston. While it may not be right in the center of the â€œtouristyâ€� stuff, it is very close to two T stations and within walking distance of some amazing restaurants and bars. The hotel is on the small side, but is more cozy than cramped. The King bedroom was sufficient for two and the bathroom was great (amazing water pressure in the shower). The bed was extremely comfortable and it was possible to get the room completely dark, which is very important to me. There is a wine hour every evening in the Ruby Room lounge area. We joined the other couple we travelled with for one night and loved the sangria. There is also breakfast every morning. This was the only thing I wasnâ€™t 100% happy with. While we had coupons for a continental breakfast, the hotel offers something slightly larger for a bit more money. Unfortunately, the breakfast items are not separated in a way that makes it clear what is included with either option. The wait staff didnâ€™t make any comments regarding what we ate, but I felt uncomfortable not knowing what was allowed for my package. One additional thing that impressed me was how the hotel dealt with its guests. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. When many flights were cancelled due to Hurricane Irene, they offered a discounted nightly rate for everyone who was stuck there. Finally, they had umbrellas in the closet, which really helped out with all the hurricane related rain!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fraire
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as we wanted to be close to the centre of Boston, and everything really is just a short walk (Faneuil) or a quick T-ride (Harvard) or taxi away. The hotel is stylishly comfy in the manner of other Kimpton properties we have stayed at. Our double queen room was a little on the small side for a family of four with luggage in accordance for a 3 week trip all over the USA, but it was very comfortable nonetheless, particularly the beds, which were heavenly. If I had to find something negative about the room, it would maybe be that some corners were quite dusty, which is understandable in a room full of furniture ( housekeeping must have trouble moving around with the vaccuum cleaner, I know I would), but not something for 'clean freaks'. Please understand that I am saying 'dusty', and not dirty, as the room was perfectly clean otherwise. To get back to the positives, the staff in this hotel are absolutely fantastic ! Our check-in experience was a delight, were always greeted cheerily when entering or leaving the hotel, and when we got caught in a pre-Irene deluge just before we were due to leave for the airport, all of the staff at the front desk stepped in to literally save our sodden souls from what would have been a very cold, miserable & drenched trip to the airport. They gave us a place to change, plenty of towels, a hair drier and even a bag of sweets for our 7 year-old to cheer her up. We have found Kimpton staff to be very good in the past, but this was just wonderful. Thank you all once again for your friendly professionalism, it is much appreciated, and what makes your hotel stand out.

Reviews.Title: “great service goes a long way”
Reviews.Author: sam s
Reviews.Content: The customer service was incredible. Although the 10-20 minute walk to areas of interest got a little tiresome, the staff at this hotel was so kind, considerate and helpful. I was asked about my stay by different staff members in different departments at least 5 times a day. The employees there created a "home away from home" feeling. Any and every request or concern was addressed immediately. If someone even sensed that you may need some help, an employee was right there with a smiling face. We traveled with handicap elderly, and small children and the staff was absolutely wonderful offering assistance and accommodating our needs. This hotel is more animal friendly than any hotel I've visited, but still clean. A+ for great service

Reviews.Title: “Very confortable rooms!”
Reviews.Author: LanoDJ
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through a famous portal because it had the best prices for its category in the city. We were really pleased by this confortable business hotel: rooms are big and very clean, staff is very kind and helped us with anything we needed (flight booking, checkin, etc), location is just 5' walk from the nearest T station and 10' from the most central locations. Breakfast wasn't included in our rate, but we were offered with a complimentary continental breakfast anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Neat little hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: krummi
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in the Onyx for a few nights after getting a good deal on it through Hotwire. I have to admit that I was a little disappointed with the location, was hoping for a hotel closer to Feneuil Hall and the downtown area - but having said that the location is far from terrible and it's a short walk to the aforementioned area as well as to Beaconhill and over it into the Boston Common and Newburry Street. The hotel delivers as promised. This is a small boutique hotel, the reception area is small but nicely decorated and next to it is the Ruby room (which we did not try, neither for breakfast or anything else). All the staff we interacted with were very friendly and willing to help us with anything we needed (storage, restaurant tips, taxi etc.). The room itself was not the biggest one I've stayed in, but despite a few suitcases and shopping we never felt it was too small. The bathroom was fine with a great powerful and hot shower. I also liked the shampoo and conditioner bottles that were mounted to the showerwall, far more environmentally friendly than all the small bottles you usually get. The only thing I can complain about in the bathroom is that it would have been good to have more shelfing space in it. The hotel is pet friendly...not sure I would have booked it knowing that (those of you who know Hotwire know that you don't get the name of the hotel until after booking and paying for it). Not that I have anything against pets in general, have a very furry cat myself, but I didn't necessarily cherish the thought of a furry carpet in my room.... and I didn't have to as the carpets were just as clean as in any other hotel, no smells or doggy hairs...But you can request a pet free room according to the hotel website if you are not convinced! Overall we were happy with our stay at the Onyx and ended up exploring more of the North area and Feneuil Hall area than we have on previous visits. P.S. the wine reception is a very nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: PeteB62
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend at the Onyx - quick get away for my wife and I. We booked a Penthouse room - very comfy. The staff was super - from arrival thru departure. Knew our names and room number. Always had great recommendations. Good fun people. The valet Paulos was super!! Lauren, John and Michael at the front desk were great too. Fun and very helpful. They definitely make the hotel special. We were treated royally. The location was perfect for walking to the North Side, Boston Common, Quincy Market and the water front, Aquarium, museums, and is right around the corner from the Boston Garden. Definitely wonder the Little Itally for dinner and check out the street festivals. Fun and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, accomadations, and style.”
Reviews.Author: JPieper66
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Onyx this past weekend and felt like a King. Boston is literally at your fingertips from this location, and I would know becuase I am from the area. I attended a cruise of the harbor before going out around the town. Out of the ten plus years I have been going out in Boston that night had to be in the top five expereinces. The Onyx staff was very friendly and helped me with whatever I needed in a timley manner. I've stayed at other hotels in Boston and none of them come close to the style and decour of the Onyx. The Onyx is everything you expext in a hotel and more. The gold fish throughout the hotel is a such a nice touch that leaves you feeling like a rockstar.

Reviews.Title: “Posh downtown hotel with top notch appeal!”
Reviews.Author: tszjackie
Reviews.Content: Great downtown boutique hotel within walking distance to Fanueil Hall and the Garden... Also very close to North Station. They describe themselves as a luxury boutique hotel and I couldn't agree more! The rooms are on the smaller side but the furnishings are beautiful. Much attention was paid to the small details. The bed was super comfortable- I slept like a baby. Service is excellent - everyone was friendly and hospitable and always more than willing to help with anything whether offering directions or recommending restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect 10”
Reviews.Author: thelma_11
Reviews.Content: What a find! I just returned from a girls getaway in Boston and loved our stay at the Onyx hotel. The hotel was a great home base for venturing out and walking to many of the great sights in Boston. The rooms were really clean and comfortable and amazingly quiet for a great nights sleep! All of the staff was incredibly helpful and pleasant making great suggestions for restaurants and fun things to do. We also had very prompt valet and cab service. The entire stay was wonderful and I would highly recommend a stay at this hip and comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Jody C
Reviews.Content: This was by far the very best hotel I have stayed in! The service was outstanding....extremely accommodating and helpful in every way. The guys at the front desk were professional and adorable in every way! The location is so convenient and accessible to great restaurants and attractions! 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Cramped Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jbud10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Onyx for an evening in August, it is centrally located and within walking distance to Quincy Market, Union Oyster House, Faneuil Hall (all roughly a 5-10 minute walk). Rooms were clean, beds were firm and comfortable, staying in a DElux King bed room on the 4th Floor(402). Room was a bit cramped but didnt bother us as we were using the room to simply sleep. Bathroom was nice and spacious. There is no view except of neighboring rooms through your window. I am not sure I would have paid the full asking price for this hotel given the option (booked this through Sneaqaway) but all in all a positive experiance. Would reccomend if you are spending the day/night in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, but customer service needs some help”
Reviews.Author: Seattleself
Reviews.Content: Nice size room with comfortable bed. The problem seems to be with "back office". I stayed for two nights and it seemed everytime I was in the lobby or at the (small) front desk one of the three people crammed behind the desk was solving a billing complaint--making me worry and also causing long delays at the desk. In addition, right after checking in @ 6 pm a male staff member came to my room to check to make sure my honor bar was complete--it wasn't. A little uncomfortable for a female solo traveler. After all that, they charged me $31 for a bottle of wine I didn't drink from the honor bar. If you can't manage it stop offering it! Was also asked for a job by a bellman after seeing who I worked for on a fax they sent for me...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Ramborao
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here for some sightseeing around Boston. Comfortable room, friendly front-desk service at a good rate for a near city centre hotel. It is around 15mins walk from Quincy Market and the North End and close to two MTA stations for trips to Cambridge/Harvard and further into the city centre. Would definitely stay again on a future visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “YOU ALWAYS KNOW WHEN YOUR AT A KIMPTON HOTEL... HIP & friendly”
Reviews.Author: vincentb18
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Onyx Hotel in July, and upon arrival you felt like you were at home.The staff always friendly and ready to help you in any way.The room we got was very clean, the washroom was spotless.The bedsheets were fresh and crisp.The room also has a safe which I find very pratical. Location is good, within walking distance to Fanueil Hall and the North End (LITTLE ITALY), and close to a T-stop.One block away from the TD GARDENS. The complementary wine hour at the Kimpton Hotels is always a treat. Would recomend the Onyx to anyone looking for a great staffed hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: traveler33324
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in a good spot in Boston...You can not walk to attractions. The rooms are so small that you feel trapped!! The worst part is that the service is totally lacking... No valet out front...You have to leave your car and walk into the hotel to find someone to help you...Front desk not very helpful. We had asked for a late checkout so that we could sleep in. The front desk did not tell the maid about the late check out so the maid stormed into our room with one quick knock then opened the door around 10. I informed the front desk who didn't seem to really care....DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! Your money will be better spent somewhere else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff couldn't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghSarahg
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in Boston and were really pleased with the Onyx. The hotel is well placed as close to the Heritage Trail, close to a subway station, 20 minute walk from the shops around Quincy Market. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were well appointed - bathroom big, clean and nice products. Breakfast highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Pet Friendly and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2585
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Onyx for our anniversary. We chose the Onyx because they are pet friendly and the price and location was perfect for us. I booked a Penthouse room for Memorial Weekend and got a great deal (by Boston standards) at $230 a night. When we arrived, there was a cute sign with a bowl and dog biscuits welcoming our dogs. Check in was prompt and to our surprise they offered us 2 rooms for the price of 1! They had some open rooms for the weekend and since we brought our 2 Great Danes with us, they figured we could use the extra space. We were thrilled. The room we reserved was clean and comfortable. The bed was plush and we got a great sleep. Since I had put in my reservation that it was our anniversary, they left us a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolates which was a nice treat! The second room, which we got complimentary, had a pull out sofa bed (no regular bed). The room was large, with a little seating area, a sink and bathroom. Iâ€™m not sure Iâ€™d want to stay in this room but it was great for our dogs. The staff was very helpful. They offered us maps and asked if we needed recommendations â€“ we didnâ€™t take them up on these things though since weâ€™re quite familiar with Boston. I also called down to request bowls because we forgot to pack ours and they promptly brought us two. The location is great. We walked the dogs all over the city. The hotel is within 5 minutes of Faneuil Hall, the North End, and Beacon Hill. Any major attraction can be easily reached by the North Station or Haymarket T stops. We would definitely stay here again. Between the great service, perfect location and the fact that itâ€™s pet friendly, it was a great weekend getaway for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: useyourvacationtime
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Onyx in Boston for a quick weekend trip. The service at this hotel was absolutely amazing! The staff really went above and beyond to be helpful and were extraordinarily nice! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfrandolph
Reviews.Content: Never disappointed in a Kimpton Hotel and the Onyx matches up. Surprisingly good location close to a "T" stop and the North End and all of its great restaurants. Stayed in a king room which was plenty big enough; bathroom had only one sink but plenty of shelf and storage space. The staff was very accommodating even printing out my boarding passes and checking in my bags. They went out of their way to help get us to dinner despite the rain. Greeted with a bottle of wine as part of the Kimpton in Touch program which is a must. After we checked out of the hotel, we remembered we left our IPOD. I called and they had already found it and made arrangements to ship to us. Will definitely add the ONYX as a place to stay and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: CHaynie70
Reviews.Content: My husband an our two children stayed for seven days. The staff was more than gracious. The rooms were very nice, but on the small side. It would have been perfect for my husband and I or for all of us for a couple of days, but it was rather cramped by seven. My children are ten and twelve. It near so many things and just a short walk to the North Station T, which will take you anywhere you need to go in the city, plus the commuter rail is located there as well. It was right across the street from bakery, so you had breakfast every morning. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST SURPRISE EVER”
Reviews.Author: hammy1in
Reviews.Content: I am one of 12 children (incl. "In-Laws") that went to Boston last week to surprise our parents for their 60th Birthdays. We sent them their from Chicago to go to a game at Fenway and Whale Watching. It was a true surprise and they had no idea... it was the first time we were all on vacation together in over 15 years. With us coming from 5 different states across the country to do so... pulling off the surprise was a challenge. Well, the real surprise was the staff at Onyx... THERE WERE FIRST CLASS!!! They were in on the surprise making sure reservations were under untraceable names... we were never spotted... and that it would run flawlessly. They let us know when our parents returned to their room so we could surprise them by singing Happy Birthday outside their door.... and they even took it upon themselves to send up a Bottle of Champaign to the room. I travel a ton and this was the most impressive hotel staff I have ever encountered!!! Thanks to Hayat, John, & especially Lauren... the rest of the staff, and a beautiful hotel in a great location... WE HAD THE VACATION OF A LIFETIME!!! WE THANK YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great addition to North Station area!”
Reviews.Author: SisKish
Reviews.Content: The Onyx is a wonderful addition to the North Station area. Steps from the trains and North End and Quincy Market. My room was gorgeous and very quiet - didn't hear any noise from the hall during the night, bed was super comfortable and I was greeted with a glass of wine when I walked into the lobby to check in. The desk staff was always smiling and cheerful. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jessiekc1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to get away for a few days with our dog Oscar, a King Charles Cavalier Spaniel and we could not have had a better time. The staff, most notably John, Lauren, and many of the other workers were amazing, and catered to our every need. Not only that, they truly made Oscar (our little pup) feel welcome and loved and didn't hesitate to take him for walks, lavished him treats, and were even kind enough to take him downstairs while we had room service (where he was the star of the show in reception I gather). I can't thank the staff of the Onyx enough for such a wonderful stay and for making our whole family, especially little Oscar feel welcome. He misses you all and gives a big "rowf!" which means thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: CaryAnn2
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The staff was nothing short of outstnading. They went above and beyond to make sure us and our dogs were well taken care of. The hotel itself is fabulous. Great location and in walking distance of the best of Boston. The attention and kindness the staff paid to us and our dogs can only be described as pheonominal. While most hotels wouldn't even consider having pets, the embraced them with open arms and make you feel that they are honored to have you and your pets stay at their hotel. If ever in Boston again we will book there again. We will now be planning our all of our vacations of where Kimptons have hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Big Party, Great Rooms, Excellent Service, Super Location”
Reviews.Author: outthere2
Reviews.Content: We arrived the night the Bruins won the stanley cup...The hotel is about 900 feet from the Garden, and a huge awaiting crowd on the streets raised hell until the police gently shut them down around 1 AM, which was about the time we got to sleep. And we all slept well in our adjoining corner rooms 1001 & 1002. The continental breakfast included coffee, juices, yogurt, fruit, cereal, breads & pastries, just enough to get going. If you opt to eat out, there is an Au bon pain bakery accross the street for breakfast, and a Subway 250 feet away, for picnics or late night munchies. The convenience extends to a 7-11 on the corner, and a CVS a block from that, and at least 20 bars, pubs and restaurants in the immediate area of the hotel. The hotel is also close to a T, which we used a lot in our 5 days in Boston, The Charlie Card that allows you to use all MBTA assets within the greater Boston area, (and Salem, Concord, and Lexington) is a great value (kids under 12 free w/adult). Hanover street, heart of the North end, and all that great Italian food is just far enough away to walk off your meal back to the hotel. We had drinks and snacks one night in the Ruby Room, it was nice to have that available on the property The customer service at the hotel was excellent, despite being full to capacity due to the Bruins win and the parade; the staff was always helpful, friendly and professional. On my Birthday I was presented a bucket of Sam Adams', which made the trip even better. The rooms themselves are smaller, pretty much a theme for Boston; but done in muted contrasting colors, with comfy bedding and linens, great TV's, wireless internet, and bathrooms.
