Most important....we all slept great, this from people who live in the country. All in all the great location, and great customer service contributed to a memorable stay in Boston. Thanks Hayat, Lauren, the 2 Johns, and all.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: melger17
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel using other trip advisor reviews and we loved it. The staff greeted us with a glass of wine which was very welcome after a long drive. The staff were also very helpful with some of our unusual requests as we had brought our road bikes to do some touring around Boston. They were always gracious. We loved being close to the North End and the wharves. The only drawback is that the neighbourhood rolls up the carpets early so it is hard to get a late night drink and the area gets a bit spooky with no one around after 10 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: fujofly
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, true it's very small. It is in the absolute perfect location to see and walk Boston! Taxis can be hard to come by and the hotel had a car onsite that was a flat rate to the airport. Made travel so much nicer at the end of the trip. Staff very accommodating and friendly, all of their recommendations were spot on. Overall a great Kimpton property.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: DurhamMcfarlane
Reviews.Content: Nice room no views but very expensive bar was always empty breakfast average with reluctent staff I feel there is better for the price. reasonable situation

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Onyx is a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Likesports
Reviews.Content: I often stay at a Kimpton Hotel in various cities, second stay here. Love the location, staff excellent, rooms nice but on small side. I love this hotel chain for many reasons, including that they are all different but all excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: ccjohnson2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights in Room 1006. The hotel staff is wonderful and make you feel so welcome. Free coffee in the morning and evening wine reception. It is a 10 minute walk to Little Italy and Au Bon Pain is across the street, with a Subway and 7-11 virtually right out the front door. I placed a bid on Priceline and thankfully the Onyx accepted it. Highly recommend this hotel if you want to be close to the North End with the North End prices. The hop on hop off shuttle stops right up the street (2 minute walk) and that will take you to all the tourist attractions - Freedom Trail, Copley Square, Harvard, the Aquarium, the "Constitution". The hotel sells the shuttle tickets and they are good for 2 days! In/Out Valet parking is available as well. We didn't eat in the Ruby Room downstairs but the breakfast buffet smelled wonderful. You won't be sorry - the staff is superb! The beds are little firm - not cushy! Free internet if you join (for free) their Kimpton In Touch program) and a $10 mini bar credit!

Reviews.Title: “Onyx, You're On It!”
Reviews.Author: cabogolf19
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the Onyx Hotel that hasnâ€™t already been said except, thank you! I stayed here for 2 nights, one of the nights the Bruins were playing in the Stanley Cup Finals. Even in the midst of all the chaos, the hotel shined with wonderful customer service and friendliness. The hotel is quiet, clean and well run. Thank you Onyx. I canâ€™t wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: afc211
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Boston, we were able to stay here recently and really enjoyed our stay! The hotel inside was very nice - it's on the small side, but this didn't detract from anything. The rooms were very nice and comfortable - everything was new and upgraded (new bathroom, TV, etc.). The bed and bedding was one of the most comfortable out of any hotel I've stayed at - I loved it so much I wanted to find out where to purchase their comforters! The hotel itself is located very close to a T station (the subway in Boston) which made it convenient to get around anywhere. It's close walking distance to the North End (Little Italy) and to lots of great old pubs and Freedom Trail landmarks. The area surrounding the actual hotel wasn't very "happening" - it's kind of on it's own little side street. It is right next to the TD Garden though. Other than that, you do have to walk about 10 minutes to get to places, but it wasn't that bad. I'd say the fact that it wasn't in the "heart" of things was the only real down side to this hotel, but it definitely was still within close walking distance of everything, so that made up for that. We also really appreciated their complimentary wine reception every evening from 5-6pm, that was really special. The staff serving wine in the lobby were always nice and socialized with the guests - telling us about places to go in Boston. It was a really nice way to be welcomed back to the hotel after a long day out sightseeing - especially in the heat of May! Overall we were very satisfied with our stay and would definitely stay again there! Thanks Onyx for a great first stay in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Hotels are a great find”
Reviews.Author: meharizona
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy small boutique hotels, you will enjoy the Onyx in Boston. We enjoyed our stay, even though the weather was terrible for the time we were in Boston. The hotel staff at the Onyx was delightful, always ready to answer questions or make suggestions. The room was clean and modern, although a little small. We enjoyed the wine at happy hour. Although the location is not right in the tourist area, it is easy to get around. There is a transit stop within two blocks and taxis are not that expensive. There are a few restaurants within walking distance and an Au Bon directly across the street for breakfast or lunch. We would recommend the Onyx to anyone who is looking for a small hotel that provides more personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Boston Garden events”
Reviews.Author: onatrip76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights. The hotel is quite new so it isn't dingy, but our room was very small (the king bed filled the room) and dark. (the one window looked out to face the other wing. We were on the 10th floor (out of 11) so dark may be what all rooms are like. It was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with modern feel”
Reviews.Author: 1Comment
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is excellent and so friendly. The location is great and close to everything fun in Boston. The style of the rooms is so modern and great decor-an orginal. The hotel bar has great drinks and wonderul serving staff. I'd definitely stay at this hotel the next time I come in town.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: JSpinella1
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a high class, fun and professional experience. The Onyx is conveniently located right near the Garden and they have a friendly and speedy valet service. We checked in on 5/31/11 around 3pm in the afternoon. The front desk staff was top notch and made our experience enjoyable. They were helpful and knowledgeable, and always greeted us with a smile. The room itself was impecable; the bed was so comfprtable! I would advise anyone to visit the Onyx for a truly unique and pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: williamehays
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Room was beautiful and bed was comfy! Had everything you'd need for one night or several. Service was friendly, helpful, and professional. I really enjoyed the location because it was close enough to the downtown hotspots to be convenient but far enough away to be relaxing. Did not try the restaurant but liked the daily wine tasting/mingling sessions. On the pricey side but not outrageous and well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury tucked away in downtown Boston.”
Reviews.Author: chibnik
Reviews.Content: In an unassuming building downtown in Boston, the Onyx Hotel lies in wait. It is an elegant hotel that does not try to be flashy like other gaudy hotels. As a member of the Kimpton family, it has all the luxuries and amenities of other Kimptons, even more so than some! The staff at Onyx is exceptional. John at the front desk helped me out with any of my requests and provided service that exceeded 5 star resorts. He was knowledgeable about Boston, as well as the other Kimpton properties. Onyx was a bit pricey, but that was due to the Bruin's being in the conference finals. The service and location made up for the bit higher price tag. I would recommend Onyx to my coworkers and will likely stay there again for work if I have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, Modern Professional Pet Friendly Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: RachelSapphire
Reviews.Content: Although slightly more expensive that I might normally choose, the amenities and location of this hotel made it worth the price. We wanted to be right in the heart of Boston and be able to bring our medium sized dog with us. The hotel staff was very accommodating and professional, they even brought us a bowl and small bed for our dog to sleep on. The rooms were quiet, comfortable, and nicely furnished. The shower was great, it had an adjustable shower head and very good water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: harveysmommy
Reviews.Content: My nephew and I made our first (of I hope many) trip to Boston to watch the last regular season Celtics game. I heavily researched hotels before our trip. The biggest qualifiers were proximity to TD Garden and the general state of the hotel. I am and always will be picky when it comes to where I will stay away from home. The distance to TD Garden was amazing. It was literally right down the street. There were some great restaurants in the area as well. Including a great pastry shop Au Bon Pain directly across the street. I would stay at this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: henmch
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here for 5 nights ove Easter. We have stayed in other Kimpton Hotels so had an idea what to expect. Once again the hotel was excellent, good service, central location and the early evening wine reception is always an added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: ctgirl311
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend in February with my boyfriend. The price was fantastic for a weekend getaway, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the hotel was conveniently located near everything we wanted to visit. I would definitely recommend staying here and look forward to visiting it again!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Customer Service!!”
Reviews.Author: TristaL_11
Reviews.Content: I have never wrote a(n) review for anything before but this one DESERVED it. To start off I paid nearly nothing for this hotel. I got lucky with this hotel through the unpublished rates through expedia. We wanted to stay close to the Garden to see a Celtics game and got lucky when this was our hotel. With tax we paid $150 for the night! LOVE THIS HOTEL!!! When we got there we were greated with a glass of wine and the conceirge was so helpful with EVERYTHING. When the game was over my boyfriend called for room service for a glass of champagne and some dessert because it was my birthday... They ended up sending a BOTTLE OF CHAMPAGNE and a large ice cream sundae to share!!!! ALLLLLLL COMPLEMENTARY!!! Wonderful Birthday, Wonderful Game, Wonderful Hotel!!!! Couldn't ask for more!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: bonvoyage2007
Reviews.Content: Could do much better for the money. Horrible breakfast, decent location, easy street parking. Nothing else worth noting.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: MaineInnStay
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with a colleague and his pet. Service was great at the desk, checked in with no problems. The room was clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. Bathrooms had all of the necessaries and were clean as well. Did not hear much noise in throughout the night. Only problem was valet parking. It took us an hour to get our vehicle the next day. Other than that, great stay if all you need is sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff at the Onyx!”
Reviews.Author: nfall2010
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our first stay at the Onyx very much, thanks to the friendly and helpful staff - front desk, bellman, and doorman (and even the valet driver). To begin with, we arrived in the morning, and they allowed us to check in immediately, so we could begin our day of sightseeing in Boston. If you stay at Onyx or any Kimpton Hotels, make sure to join Kimpton In Touch program before your stay - you get a $10 credit toward the mini-bar in your room, and can request a free USA Today, as well. We forgot our bottled waters in the car, and the bellman ran downstairs and retrieved them for us, before the car was parked by the valet. The bellman also offered us a complimentary bottle of wine upon our arrival, which was delivered to our room later in the day. The doorman (Binyam) was very helpful in retrieving our car when we checked out - it was raining, and he had an umbrella ready to get us to the car; he also loaded all of our bags for us - in the rain. Our room was not huge, but we didn't feel cramped, either, in the standard King room. The bathroom was clean, with nice towels, and rather than providing travel size shampoo and conditioner, they had dispensers for those in the shower - great idea!!! It was still Gilchrist and Soames brand, which I love. They did provide travel size soap and body lotion, too. The bed was nice - firm, but not hard, and the sheets were lovely, as well. Our room was very clean, too. I don't know how full the hotel was or was not, but we didn't hear any noise from any of the other rooms - the only noise we heard at night was from the street. We were on the 6th floor, but I think the street noise in a city like Boston can't be helped. Our room, like another comment said, was directly across from an office building, so they can see right in - but closing the dark drapes solved that problem. If someone is coming to the TD Garden, you are only a block away from there - and just a few blocks from the North End - with all of the restaurants there to enjoy. Again, the front desk staff was very helpful in giving us accurate directions to walk there for dinner. Also only a block or two from two different T stops. Be aware of the fee for valet parking, and do call ahead before you need the car. There was a lot not far away, but don't know how safe that would be for overnight parking on your own. We enjoyed our stay, and would definitely choose the Onyx again when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good Boutique Hotel,Somewhat Odd Location, Small Adequate Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Arch53
Reviews.Content: I completed a one night stay at the Onyx on January 12, 2011 to attend a business meeting. At first I was concerned about the location. It is near the Boston Garden so handy for sports events but somewhat out of the way for other purposes. As it turned out, the location was not a problem since the T at North Station is only 1 1/2 blocks away. Hotel is generally nice; boutique hotel of 112 rooms. Basically not much of a lobby and the rooms are certainly on the small side (think closer to NY size than Boston 4*size). It was a little odd that the bathroom was so small that the towel rack was inside the shower area of the tub (on back wall) but the room size was certainly adequate for my short visit; longer visits may make the room size an issue since there is not much of a lobby either. But the rooms are comfortable, bedding is of high quality and the staff is very helpful and upbeat. Many good restaurants nearby including Boston's North End relatively close by. You can purchase the continental breakfast available in the lobby for $16 or full breakfast for $20. I did not elect either option but it would be convenient for some. Coffee in lobby in morning is free. Valet parking is $42 but you can find nearby overnight garage parking on for $25. Free WiFi in rooms but I did not use it so I do not know how good the signal is. Overall a good value for the amount charged for my Priceline stay ($89) and I would not be disappointed to get it on a future bid.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Beds & Service was spectacular EXCEPT valet & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RIGuy1024
Reviews.Content: If you are valeting your car, prepare for a disaster upon arrival. Two separate cars pulled up at the same time and just over 10 minutes later I was still in my car. After a good 3-4 minutes, a valet sitting in someone's car knocked on the window and told me to leave my car across the street (in front of a loading dock) and he'd take care of it. Before I could explain to him that I wasn't comfortable just leaving my car on a side street of Boston he was gone. So I sat in my car in front waiting for SOMEONE to come and finally I saw a doorman so I got out and just dealt with him and eventually he took the keys. Check-in was smooth and the staff was great. The room was small but a typical big city room. The bed was VERY comfortable. We took advantage of the free "wine hour" which was a great feature. My girlfriend ordered a martini so there was a small bill. At 6:15 we were told if we weren't ordering food we'd have to leave our table - not great but understood. You could hear the drunks outside during the course of the night. Not fun but absent some thicker windows nothing anybody can do. The next morning the breakfast buffet was sufficient. They have a security guard at breakfast - weird. They automatically add gratuity to your bill which is weird considering the ONLY thing the staff did was clear your plate. They don't even do the coffee, it's ALL self serve. I had my credit card sticking out of the check for over 5 minutes and at one point held it up for the "waiter" to get it - he walked by, looked right at it and kept going. Checkout was smooth but DEFINITELY call ahead for your car from valet. They were hustling and the front desk staff were keeping them on their toes but just due to the sheer number of people checking out there was a 15-20 minute wait. This one you can't fault valet for. For the price I paid I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We will without a doubt be back!”
Reviews.Author: Treycb
Reviews.Content: In picking our hotel for this particular stay, the number one thing we were looking for was a pet friendly hotel. We could not be happier that selected this one. It was a smaller hotel, that had a very chic and trendy look to it and was perfectly located. It was an even bigger bonus that seeing we were in town for a Celtics game, the hotel was literally a 5 minute (if that) walk to the TD Garden. Because of the snow and the amount of cars on the street, it was a little confusing to find the valet at first, but after a second trip around the block we found it. It was $42 to valet but well worth it. Check in was very quick and the front desk attendants were extremely friendly. They treated not only my husband and I as welcomed guests, but also our 5 month old puppy. They even provided a dog walking service and took our puppy out for us while we were at the game. The room was a little smaller than I thought it would be, but was spotless and had everything you needed. We were pleasantly surprised a high quality, clean, dog bed and bowls for the puppy were provided. Our bed, pillows, and linens were amazingly soft and we slept great. Although there was no way to shut the room door quietly, you heard very little outside traffic or hallway noise. There were a couple of small downfalls. 1.) The "doggie relief" area is a couple of blocks away. 2.) Other than the mini bar in the room, there are no vending machines. However there is a 7 Eleven with everything you need a 3 minute walk down the street. 3.) Although the atmosphere and selection at the breakfast buffet in the Ruby Room was high, the taste of the food was average or below average. Definitely not worth the $16 per person. As I mentioned, it is perfectly located and there are many restaurants,and pubs within a short walking distance. We went to McGann's Irish Pub (3 doors down) for dinner and it was SO GOOD and we highly recommend it . We will definitely be back to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseylovedGreece
Reviews.Content: We love the Kimpton chain. They are reasonable, great location and the staff is superb. They really take the time to listen to the guests and go out of their way to be friendly. The Onyx is steps from the Garden but you do not feel you are in this crazy area. Walking distance to Fanueil Hall, Government Center and North End. Rooms are small, but clean and modern looking. Comfy beds and a Wine Hour each afternoon. What more do you need after a day of sightseeing. Great for a winter stay with kids or just a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Sharp, Nice People, Located for North End, Garden and Govt Center”
Reviews.Author: Beachdancer104
Reviews.Content: In a former warehouse area, the Onyx is one of several boutique hotels that have emerged in Boston over recent years. We have stayed here several times because it is walking distance to our daughter's apartment in the North End, close to Boston Gardens, and walking distance to government center - most of the City's other hotels are located on the other side of Beacon Hill. Hotel and rooms are small, but smartly decorated and very comfortable. Bed's are "Westin-like" which is what we look for traveling. Staff has been exceptionally professional and welcoming. Rates seem very flexible at this time of year - we paid $129 for a weeknight.

Reviews.Title: “terrible location”
Reviews.Author: sacarajane
Reviews.Content: nice staff, terrible location lots of street noise not worth the price

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to stay at to attend a event at the Boston Garden”
Reviews.Author: Blueberryhollow
Reviews.Content: Fun hotel, nice location great rooms, kinda funky, enviromentally friendly. Loved everything about this hotel, but the guilt I had driving my crew cab silverado, think they like the prius better!

Reviews.Title: “A nice change of pace.”
Reviews.Author: jakemcg00
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay in the city for my companyâ€™s Christmas party every year and try to switch up the accommodations. When we booked the stay on Hotwire and learned we got the Onyx, I wasnâ€™t sure what to expect. We had a good experience at a boutique hotel at the Ames last year, so I was hopeful the Onyx would deliver. I can say that I was not disappointed. The goodwill started before we got the hotel, with the manager accommodating my request for a high floor and late checkout. When we arrived, a bottle of wine and two fresh baked cupcakes awaited us in the room â€“ a very nice touch. The service throughout the stay was excellent. The rooms are small (the consensus amongst most reviewers), but they pack every inch of the room with a very eclectic dÃ©cor. I liked the style much better than the antiseptic feel of the Ames. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was adequate (although a little more vanity space would be good). My main disappointment was that the restaurant/lounge, the Ruby Room, was closed for a private function. My wife and I like to have cocktails and appetizers at each hotel we stay at, so that was a small letdown. Hopefully the food is as good as the cupcakes, which were superb! All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: DoraDementia
Reviews.Content: Great location,nice room, excellent staff. This is a really nice hotel in the centre of Boston. We arrived to complimentary wine and a really friendly receptionist called Jenny, she couldnt do enough for us. Room was really nice although quite small so if you need lots of space it's not for you. The rooms are well furnished, bed was excellent really comfy. Nice bathroom and toiletries. Mini bar was well stocked but as per norm a bit pricey. You can have complimentary glassses of wine each evening in the lobby between 5 and 6, we took them into the restaurant or up to the room - a nice free treat! Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: sarahbiggie
Reviews.Content: bottleof wine awaited us in our room staff was super friendly hotel was clean daily happy hour for customers great great great!

Reviews.Title: “Above Average”
Reviews.Author: saratogamike
Reviews.Content: I stay here periodically when in Boston for work. Nice hotel - it's clean, staff is freakishly friendly, beds are fine, location is great. Rooms are small but fine for one or two people. I am there alone so it's fine. Rates are OK, mid to upper 100's although I've paid much more at times. It's down the street from the Garden so if you're in town for a game it's ideal. Join the Kimpton club thing if you're going even once because you get free internet and they give you some sort of gift when checking in - chocolate, bottle of wine w/ cheese, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Another delightful Kimpton experience”
Reviews.Author: fiskebolledirigent
Reviews.Content: This is the third Kimpton hotel at which I have stayed. The first was Ink48 in NYC, followed by Nine Zero in Boston, and now Onyx. As always, service is excellent. Also, it was my birthday (in the midst of a working weekend at a conference), so there were fabulous cupcakes and champagne in the room. Their membership club has great benefits, so sign up for that, even if you are not such a frequent traveler. Of course, I do look for Kimpton locations first, although I cannot always afford them. Their occasional "deals" are well worth it. I am not so fond of the decor of the Onyx - an awful lot of patterns all at once. Wonderful bed and small but nice room. Great service staff - good breakfast in the lobby. Coffee beyond awful - cheap dishwater, but the food selection good. Slightly lower score on cleanliness because Ruby Bar needs to be vacuumed before morning service. All in all, a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ShelbyLB
Reviews.Content: I had read the occasional bad review on here and was a little weary of the trip. However after contacting Michael at the hotel he made my troubles go away. I told him that I was coming in with my boyfriend for his birthday and he made sure the room was decorated with balloons along with complimentary cupcakes and even had cards signed by the staff. The hotel is decorated beautifully and everyone at the staff was more than accommodating! If you are going to Boston for a sports event or concert at the Garden, the Onyx Hotel is the place to stay! It's right at the end of the block and there are plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance! We had a blast thanks to Michael and his staff at the Onyx Hotel-we look forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Frilo68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property for a couple of nights. The room is a little small, but overall we had a very pleasant stay. The bed was very comfortable, and the room was quiet, we slept very well. The bathroom is roomy (although more hooks to hang things would be helpful). We liked the large basin sink and the shower was also good. I liked the fact that shampoo and conditioner were hung on the shower wall: it makes it easier to use the products (instead of those little bottles, that are so difficult to open and hold in the shower), plus, they eliminate the waste of gazillion one-use plastic bottles. We liked the location, away from the noisiest touristy areas, but close enough to many interesting places with a 5-10 minute walk. The best part of the stay was the concierge: exceptionally helpful and attentive staff made our stay very enjoyable. Only a negative remark: the room could have been a little cleaner, it was clean, but not spotless. I have extremely high standards when it comes to cleanliness and I was a little disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well maintained, with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CA_Jayhawk
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly nice, comfortable hotel. I thought the staff was particularly good. I needed to print a page. Most front desk people would have said, "well, go to the business center". In this case, they said I could email it to them, and they would print it for me. I really appreciated that. In general the whole team was cheerful and helpful. The style of the hotel and furnishings is a little 80s for my taste, but that's a highly subjective and aesthetic opinion. To be clear, I don't think anything IS from the 80s, everything looks virtually new. The design just seems a little overdone. They are making a real effort to be eco (or to market themselves as eco), which I like. For our purposes (working at the convention center), the location wasn't ideal. It is right down the block from the Garden, so if you're coming for Bruins or Celtics games, this might be great. (I saw the Celtics beat the Heat in LeBron's debut.) There are certainly more charming neighborhoods, the vicinity of the arena doesn't seem to draw a very genteel crowd. If you're looking for an area of town oozing with Boston charm, this probably isn't it. If you do stay here, be sure to sign up for the loyalty program â€“ it gets you free internet.

Reviews.Title: “modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: lovedit84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Boston to celebrate our first anniversary. We knew nothing about Boston or Kimpton hotels. It turned out to be a great experience. The onyx is a cozy yet modern hotel. The rooms are small but perfect for 2 people who are in and out all day. We loved the contemporary decor.. red, black and white. The staff was extremely friendly and even surprised us with 6 chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne to celebrate the occassion. We had a nice view from the front of the hotel as well. The hotel is located right on the brink of where we felt the area was getting a little isolated, and where they seemed to be a lot of weird people. We live right outside Philly in the suburbs, so this type of atmosphere made us skeptical. However, we quickly figured out that we needed to make a left out of the hotel and not a right. Once you make that left, stay straight and you'll run into Quincy Market. If you want to get to the North end (Italian section) do the same and just make a left at the Macdonalds. Don't miss MIKE'S PASTRY on Hanover street. After our first mistake of making the right, we never went that way anymore and had a great and memorable vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Onyx was swanky and clean.”
Reviews.Author: michellengary
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and very nicely decorated. My room was a mix of browns, reds, and black furnishings. Every amenity you can think of was available. My only problem was that the room was very small and I had to wait a long time for hot water from the sink faucet in the evenings. The shower had hot water at all times,

Reviews.Title: “OK for central Boston stay, but too pricey to be practical for business travel”
Reviews.Author: OldGuyfromBay
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I needed a place to stay in central Boston so we could meet some business partners. The Onyx was recommended to us. There was nothing wrong with the hotel; the rooms were pleasant but small. My main gripe was the cost. Including the $40 parking fee and the taxes, it cost nearly $400 for one night. I don't think I could justify staying there on a business trip again, but if it's within your budget it is a pleasant enough place. The internet was free (if you agreed to join the Kimpton frequent guest program, a mild annoyance). There was no complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: BFWPa
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine from high school and I met at the Onyx for a "reconnect" get together for 4 days in Boston. I only have nice things to say about our experience. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of many of the tourists attractions. Our room was the perfect size for the two of us, with a spacious bathroom and double beds. The beds were very comfortable with four pillows on each and down comforters. My friend is allergic to feathers, but after one phone call someone arrived in the room to "defeather" her bed. The staff at the front desk treated us like family. They provided us with suggestions for restaurants and an easy-to-read map for the tourists attractions we asked about. They marked the map with suggested routes. When we returned from a days wanderings, the friendly staff greeted us eagerly and asked what we had enjoyed about our day. Every afternoon from 5-6, the Onyx provides a complimentary wine bar. The wine selections change monthly with both a red a white choice. We took our wine into the Ruby bar and ordered one of their $5 appetizers to go with it (several delicious hapPy hour choices). Late one evening we returned to the hotel with goodies from "Mike's Bakery" (a must on your trip). We sat in the bar, and the friendly bartender brought us utensils, plates, and napkins to enjoy our dessert. I would return in a heartbeat. Thank you, Onyx, for adding to the pleasure of my Boston vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic destination hotel”
Reviews.Author: colacakes
Reviews.Content: Chic, cosmopolitan boutique hotel. Friendly staff, welcoming to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore the North End!”
Reviews.Author: snr239
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Onyx the day after our wedding and from check-in the check-out we received great service. There was a complimentary bottle of wine and personal note waiting for us on arrival (sparkling wine would have been a nicer touch, but it's the gesture that counts). All staff were extremely courteous, and could not be faulted. An incorrect room service bill was corrected immediately, and boarding passes printed with a smile. The package we booked through the hotel was a great value, including valet parking, a $50 room service credit and late check out - and we were given a room on the penthouse floor which guaranteed privacy and quiet. The location is a little random, and the street a bit gritty, but it is extremely convenient to the North End, public transit, and quick taxi to the ICA. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Gwow
Reviews.Content: Sadly was disappointed with this Kimpton! Really rude receptionist upon arrival. I was shocked and didnt start off my trip very well. Moved rooms twice as they put me right next to the elevator ( my pet peeve). Rooms very small and dodgy decor. Hideous isolated location miles from anywhere and homeless people down the end of the road at night. Not nice. Wont stay here again if I can help it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: CityDoctor2007
Reviews.Content: We'd never been to Boston before but had been recommended Kimpton so thought we'd check out this hotel. The room was very nice-with a pet fish on the side table. My only complaint is that this hotel was away from the action-about a 20 minute walk to Boston Common and the usual touristy things, but the price and the room made it a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Convenient, Central Location; Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: DeWitt66
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel knowing nothing about Boston and having no clue what neighborhood I should stay in/near. Boy did we luck out. Practically central to all the sights, you can pretty much walk anywhere from this hotel--almost all the sights are so close by. The famous North End is a 5-10 minute walk, tops; the Wharf is maybe 15-20; The Constitution is about a 25 minute walk over a nearby bridge; and Beacon Street is also within walking distance. If you're not a walker, take the metro. The "T" is literally 2 blocks away. Want to go out to eat? Have a drink at a bar? Hear a band and do some dancing? All are nearby--some, literally right next door. And here's where I have to give Porters Bar and Grill a plug. They had consistently good, reasonably priced food, and some of the best fried chicken I've ever had. Don't miss it, especially if you're just to tired at the end of your sightseeing day to venture far from the hotel. And the staff. I'm sorry I didn't get anyone's name, but they were all exceptional. Helpful. Friendly. Couldn't ask for more. Probably the only minuses, which is why I only gave value and sleep quality 3 stars, is that we thought it was kind of expensive. But it was not out of line with what other hotels were charging, so perhaps Boston is just an expensive place to visit? Also, something about the bed and pillows wrecked havoc on my back and neck. I don't know if it was the feather bed or the mattress, but it might just be me... altho I didn't have any problems at a few other hotels we stayed in after leaving Boston. Oh, and if you have a dog. My god! they offer services for you dog that I've never heard of gratis!!! If I'd known, I'd have been tempted to bring mine.

Reviews.Title: “The best customer service I've ever received at a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyPino
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Onyx Hotel was one of the best experiences I have ever had staying at a hotel. I had planned a surprise night out in Boston for my wife's birthday including a room at the Onyx. She works in Boston so I planned on checking in to the room and placing the dress and shoes I bought for her to wear out that night into the closet of the room, then going to pick her up and bring her back to the room to find her surprise there. Two days before our trip she informed me she was taking that day off from work and would not be in the city. This presented a problem for me since I wanted her gifts in the closet when she got to the room, but now she would be arriving at the hotel with me instead of after I had already been there. I called the front desk staff and explained the situation. They offered to take the dress, shoes, and purse from me days before our check in, store them for me, and arrange them in the closet of our room as I requested before we checked in. They not only handled the expensive items safely and arranged them carefully in the closet for my wife's surprise, they also placed a complimentary bottle of champagne on ice in our room, a platter of chocolate covered strawberries, and decorated the floor and bed of the room with red and white rose petals. The staff also helped me confirm I had chosen a good restaurant for our dinner reservation and offered to arrange a taxi be at the restaurant when we were done. The front desk staff also recognized us and called us by name even though we only stayed the one night, and they complimented my wife's new shoes and purse as she walked by to go out knowing they were brand new. The room itself was also very nice with funky animal print bathrobes in the closet, an extremely comfortable bed, and a nice view of some of the buildings in the city (we were on the 10th floor). If I have a need for a hotel room in Boston again, the Onyx will be the 1st hotel on my list. I very highly recommend this hotel. My wife was thrilled with her birthday getaway, and I could not be more pleased with the way we were treated by the Onyx staff.

Reviews.Title: “One Of Our Favorite Hotels....”
Reviews.Author: SpoiledStephy
Reviews.Content: I absolutely freakin' LOVE the Onyx Hotel. My husband (first boyfriend, then fiance) and I have stayed at the Onyx three times and each time it only gets better. The most recent stay was last September, for our mini-moon--my husband was in an unfortunate accident and unable to fly until six months into recovery, so we switched to a mini moon week in Boston. The service is always fantastic--everyone always says hello and seems to know who you are the second you walk in. Rooms are comfortable and clean and the decor is fun and modern. The rooms are definitely not too small for a boutique hotel, but rather intimate and cozy. Small amenities like an umbrella in the closet in case of rain let you know that Kimpton really DOES care. The front desk is always able to recommend fantastic food or a great night out--we found Oishii (which is now our fave sushi anywhere) because of their recommendation. The Ruby Room is intimate, but lovely. Drinks are strong and the bartenders that work there are personable and get to know you. I've sampled some of the food and, true to Kimptom form, it's fantastic. I, personally, think the location is fantastic. Is the street a bit odd? Yes. But that's one of the charming things about Boston--you never know what fabulous thing you will stumble upon in it's "back alleys." On this street, it's the Onyx. The North End (ie food lovers paradise) is a five minute walk and the Orange line is only two blocks away. In the other direction, Quincy Market is only five minutes away as well. For the reviewers who have also complained about no WiFi....do yourselves a favor and sign up for Kimpton In Touch. You earn great rewards AND get free wifi, amongst other things. We are heading back up to the Onyx in a few days for our one year anniversary over Labor Day and can not wait.

Reviews.Title: “Staff goes the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: marycate70
Reviews.Content: This is a well-located, small boutique hotel. The rooms are very comfortable and well-appointed, if a bit small. All-in-all, it is exactly what one would expect in downtown Boston at the price. I think what sets it apart, however, is its service. As an example, I stupidly left my cell phone on the bed, only to realize several hours after checking out. The entire staff, even the valet parkers, seemed to have been mobilized to find it. Two thorough room searches that day by the staff didn't find it. Imagine my amazement when I got a call two days later saying that the head of housekeeping had found it by wandering around the hotel dialing my number on her cell!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff at the hotel. 1 800 hotels.com stole $566.01”
Reviews.Author: jackoman
Reviews.Content: 1 800 hotels.com cancelled our reservation in June for our August stay. No notification was given at that time. The staff at the hotel honored the rate we had paid. We have to file a claim with bankrupcy court. Stay at the hotel and enjoy, do not use 1 800 hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: QueenCamper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Onyx Hotel and felt comfortable with booking it. We usually stay with Hilton Hotels. We gave a shot due to my husband needing to be semi close to the convention center for a trade show. We were happy with the Manager's Hour which consists a alcoholic beverage free of charge. We were also impressed with the appetizers that were half price from 4-7pm. The room was comfortable, view was of another building, business building actually, so keep the curtain drawn if you want privacy. Overall, we would stay again considering location with a great Italian section close by. Yummy food there! Shopping close by as well+++

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Franfluche
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in boutique hotels before and I must say this was substandard. The room we had was tiny, with a tinier window. The air conditioning was so noisy we had to turn it off all night! I was also disappointed to find out that we had to pay for everything: $40 for valet parking, 10$ for internet (!!), no complimentary coffee nor breakfast, even the bottled water in the room was not free. The dogs staying at that hotel seemed more welcome! I may also add that there is no place provided outside for people who smoke, we were told to go on the sidewalk! As for the location, the neighborough is somewhat lifeless. When we walked back to the hotel at night, it was even scary. You can certainly find a better located hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: skittles1234
Reviews.Content: We stay in Boston frequently and like to try different hotels. After reading the trip advisor reviews we decided to stay here and I was sorry we did. First problem was the area, while I like the location, it is very walkable to Hanover St, the streets in this area are filled with trash, it is so bad it looks like a parade has gone through and no one cleaned up. Second problem was that valet parking was $40.00! There was a parking deck we found out later about 2 blocks away that was much less expensive. Breakfast which was like what you get for free at a Hampton Inn was $16.00 per person, we went down the street to Dunkin Donuts. The room was no better or larger than most regular hotel rooms, Marriott, Hilton, etc. The first room we stayed in had a tub diverter problem so we had to move. Also, there are a number of bars in the area and at 2:30 a.m. I could still hear some noise outside. What was good was the staff, they were friendly and did a great job, the wine reception was nice and of course it was in a very walkable location.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Fish and Wine”
Reviews.Author: StaceyLeeDee
Reviews.Content: I try to stay at Kimpton Hotels whenever I can (my favorite is the Monaco in Seattle), so we chose the Onyx deliberately (and the price, online, was only a little higher than our budget plan--we decided to splurge). It's a lovely hotel, beautiful rooms, and great service. The clerks who work there are unbelievably friendly and helpful. There is a wine reception each night for an hour (a chance to chat with fellow travelers), and the hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of almost all attractions (including the jogging/walking trail along the Charles River tho you have to walk along the approach to a highway, with a safe sidewalk, to get to it). There is a lovely lounge, and the bartender was also very friendly. Drawbacks: the street it's on is a little dingy/grungy, and the cross street (Causeway, near the North Station) has some unsavory people at night (there's a liquor store). BUT, the other streets nearby are ok and my hubby and I did walk around at night and felt safe. Also, there is no free coffee or breakfast in the morning: You need to pay $16.00 for a buffet breakfast, which is just crazy. There is a donut place (that sells breakfast sandwiches) on the Causeway, and an Au Bon Pain across the street, but for the price of the hotel, they really should at least give away some coffee and a donut in the mornings (you do get a free newspaper, however, and wi-fi). OH, the air conditioning in the room is a little noisy, but it may be that I'm not used to an air conditioner. Otherwise, we loved it. And you can ask to have a goldfish in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with Kimpton's Hotel Onyx”
Reviews.Author: mariesmith313
Reviews.Content: Great location, great hotel. Traveled to Boston from NYC in February with my husband for a family event and we stayed at Hotel Oynx. Kimpton hotels have never disappointed, modern design, friendly staff and most importantly-- excellent bedding and rooms. Next time we travel to Boston, definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ToysCT
Reviews.Content: We planned an impromptu overnight trip to Boston with our two kids (ages 8 & 12) and found this hotel on Priceline. The deal we were able to get was great and we really enjoyed the time we spent at the Onyx. The room was spotless, everything looked new and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were all very nice & welcoming. There's a restaurant/lounge in the hotel - it's not that big and we didn't eat there but it looked nice. The only thing missing was a pool. Many guests brought their dogs along (wish we had too!) which was really cute. The location of the hotel was perfect for us - we wanted to spend time walking the Freedom Trail and enjoying food in the North End. The hotel was an easy walk to all places, including the T, and parking was $10 for 24 hours if you parked across the way at Government Center which was a short walk to the end of the block and diagonally across the street. (otherwise it was $40 at the hotel). Would ABSOLUTELY stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Nice staff, however..”
Reviews.Author: NYJPC
Reviews.Content: We travel to Boston several times a year for a weekend away and have stayed at many different hotels. The Onyx is a clean, nice hotel with a friendly young staff in a decent location. We did come across several faults that werenâ€™t necessarily the hotelâ€™s fault, however, they will prevent us from returning. First of all, the hotel is tiny! A handful of chairs in the tiny lobby that always seemed to have people sitting in them - so you had to navigate around legs to get to the front desk or to the elevators. The Ruby Room Lounge was very nicely done and looks trendy and fun in the pictures, but itâ€™s not used at all. There was a video game for kids set up on the lounge TV and an associated game controller mat on the ground. The utensils from the breakfast buffet never left the bar at night (toaster, sternos, etc). Our room was very clean, but really, really small! Two people couldnâ€™t walk around the bed at once â€“ we had to take turns. We also had two little barking dogs on our floorâ€¦ and they barked for hours. The view from our window was facing directly into the room across from us which was about 6â€™ away. I could literally lean straight out of my window and knock on the other guests window it was so close. No view of a street, sky, anything. Our curtains stayed closed. The location is ok â€“ but thatâ€™s due in part to Boston being so small and easy to get around. There are A LOT of homeless people camped out on the hotelâ€™s block and surrounding blocks and they are very forward. One thing that the hotel did that really irked me thoughâ€¦We requested a later check out and were denied due to â€œthe hotel being fully booked for that nightâ€�. Fine, I understand that. However, on a hunch, I called back, spoke to someone else and requested to extend our room another night which was immediately approved. Dishonest Onyx! Also, $40/day to park your car (as written in pen on the valet stub) - paid in cash to the attendant. Sounds fishy. Our favorite Hotel in Boston, by far, is the Omni Parker House. 5 star all the way. Thatâ€™s where we will be staying next time.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service!!”
Reviews.Author: lamtan
Reviews.Content: We could tell by the pictures on the website, that the hotel rooms, were eclectic, and we liked the decor...well, they were just like the picture! Very nicely furnished. We had a king bed, which was very comfortable. The room isn't really big (at least the king bedroom), but it suited us just fine. The bathroom was very nice..we loved the large pedistal sink. From the moment we walked in the door, which was late at night after a long day....we were greeted with smiling faces, and a warm hello! The staff here was always friendly and helpful. I work in a customer service field....so seeing and experiencing this...was so refreshing! The location of the hotel was a really good area for walking. We walked to Quincy Market and Paul Revere's house quite easly. If you are looking for a nice comfortable hotel, with a great breakfast (we had continental) and AWESOME CUSTOMER SERVICE....look no further...the ONYX is your choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JetfuelJack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Onyx for one night while attending a show at the TD Garden. The Garden is just up the block, extremely close and you can also walk to the waterfront and all of those attractions. The staff was great and the hotel is what you'd expect for the style and price. The rooms are average size for major cities like NYC and Boston, on the smaller side but well planned out, and with great amenities. The area around the hotel is not the greatest at night. Best location for a show at the TD Garden!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jennypenny12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Onyx and had a very pleasurable experience. It's in a good location close to the T, the garden, and the North End. The rooms were very clean and tidy. All of the staff were extra friendly and helpful in making sure we were well-accommodated during our stay. Yes, there is a $40 valet fee, but that is standard with all hotels in the area. We didn't bring our beloved four-legged furry creature with us, but we saw several guest bring their pets with them. They had a water bowl and treats waiting for them at the check-in. I love that they are not only pet-friendly, but also eco-friendly. Would definitely recommend to anyone and would stay there again (with our dog next time)!

Reviews.Title: “Another bad experience at the Onyx”
Reviews.Author: MCarpo
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Maine, and about five years ago I stayed overnight at the Onyx several times on weekend trips to Boston. During my last stay in 2005, I accidentally left a shirt behind; when I called to ask for it to be mailed to me (which would have cost about $1), I was actually told I would have to pay them to send it. Not sure why I thought things would be different this time, but when I ran the Boston Marathon in 2010, I decided to return to the Onyx. Big mistake. In addition to the ridiculous $40 valet parking charge, I also once again left something behind. I called three times in the following days, and none of these calls was returned. I was also charged $20 for a breakfast that, according to my promotional rate, was supposed to be free. Staff wasn't flat-out rude, but definitely was not customer-service oriented. The Onyx is a clean hotel in a great location, but I will never stay here again. It has also soured me on all Kimpton properties, where I've been staying since 1999.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ambernewy0rk
Reviews.Content: BC of commencement activities, all the hotels in boston were sold out. I tried to cancel my reservation at the Onyx, but I was an hour past the 24 hour cancellation window. I checked in, and the room they gave me was the living room half of a suite, and my bed was a FOLDOUT SOFABED. Seriously, if you don't have any rooms, why not let people cancel their reservation??? For $369 a night, you should not sleep on a sofabed. It shouldn't be rented as a room. I'm not even going to go into the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dburkett
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Onyx Hotel for three nights in May. This is the 4th Kimpton Hotel we have visited in the past year. Once again, we had a very pleasant stay. The hotel was clean and located within walking distance to Boston's North End's Italian restaurants. The hotel location is perfect if you are in town to see the Celtics or Bruins play at the TD Arena. In addition, there are pubs, bars, etc. within close walking distance. Kimpton Hotels are pet-friendly. We brought our puppy Bella to Boston and were thrilled by the manner in which we were welcomed at the hotel. Hotel staff were very friendly to both us and our puppy. Finding a plot of grass for the puppy, however, was a challenge (the nearest is a few blocks away) but it is a city so I can't complain about that. Overall, Onyx Hotel met our expectations. The friendlyness of the staff exceeded our expectations. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: ExeterStewie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and tidy, staff were friendly. It is in really good location as only a 5 minute walk to the subway. You can also walk to Little Italy, Fanueille Hall and the Old State House within approx 10 minutes. We booked a twin room as stayed with my partner and a friend. The double bed was quite small for 2 people to share. They do a parking service at the hotel which costs $40. If you need the car brought back allow approx 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel- room a little too small”
Reviews.Author: z235e49
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, nicely appointed room, nice sized bathroom, great location but the room itself was a little too small. a king sized bed, a comfortable chair, a desk with chair, 2 nighttables, a dresser and not much room to maneuver.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel - great find thanks to Trip Advisor!”
Reviews.Author: mandaJ
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading decent reviews about it on-line. Thought I would add my own because I was very impressed with this hotel. From the moment we arrived the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Nothing was a problem and they greeted us warmly each time we went through the reception area. The hotel was very tidy and well-kept, both outside and throughout. Our room on the 9th floor was spotless and tidy. I had read reviews that the rooms were small, but ours was sufficient for 3 people and all our luggage. The double beds were very comfortable and the linen/towels etc were spotless. There were a couple of dressing gowns to use, and a hair-dryer, large TV and IPod docking station. Also a well-stocked mini-bar if needed. We received complimentary breakfasts both days which was a real bonus and a nice touch. The breakfast food was lovely and free newspapers were available. Also there was free wine between 5-6pm in the bar for all guests and soft drinks for children. We were very pleased with the standard of this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again or recommend it to friends. It was about a 5 minute walk away from the market area and the harbour, and was close to a subway for speedy transport into the centre of Boston. If I had to be negative about anything to do with the hotel I would say that the air conditioning was abit loud in the room, and internet access wasn't free (but not expensive either) but apart from that it was a great little place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome......”
Reviews.Author: massass
Reviews.Content: had an Awesome time..the service was 5 star rating...From the room to all the employees there...Patrick,Joe "The Bartender"..Amy "GM"...Mikuta.."Door man"...and so on..had A Blast..Ty and Would Definately recommend The On Onxy to anyone Whom plans to stay in Boston On buisNess or "Pleasure"...

Reviews.Title: “if a shoe box is your style this hotel is 4 u”
Reviews.Author: navawritz
Reviews.Content: This hotel have the best images and yet the tiny tiny room plus the area is down town to the core yukkie sorry no cozy feeling no friendly service we didnt even stay the 2nd night which we paid via hotwire we just walk a way and say thanks but no thanks~

Reviews.Title: “Different - and this kind of different is a good thing”
Reviews.Author: MrktMgr
Reviews.Content: In the unassuming neighborhood halfway between government center and the TD center, or what I will forever refer to as â€žthe gardenâ€œ, is the Onyx Hotel. If you happen to find the right street, you'll find them thanks to the large â€“ yet decently proportioned â€“ signage in the form of an awning out front. Actually the sign for the â€œRuby Roomâ€� was easier to see than the sign for the Onyx. I got off to a bad start with the Onyx as they have one of those annoying rotating doors at the entrance that invites you to bang your ankles trying to drag your luggage into the all-too-small compartment causing you to then trip from the momentum of your towed baggage overtaking you. It wouldn't be bad if the circumference of the door was appropriate, but it's a couple sizes too small. So instead of an elegant entrance you find yourself propelled into the lobby, stumbling and cursing, looking back at the rotating contraption that is supposed to save the world from global warming. My immediate question was â€œam I in the right place?â€�. Three feet in front of me a sofa, to the left a rack with some newspapers and to the right what I thought was a concierge desk, but turned out to be the lobby and front desk. The answer to the question, â€œis this it?â€�, is â€œyesâ€�. It's small, reminiscent of a London hotel conversion - but much brighter and cheerful. Four stars usually could mean that there is somebody waiting to help you with your luggage â€“ but that wasn't the case for me. Check-in was fine and I was invited to the wine reception to be held later. Thankfully, they didn't put me in the basement based on my Priceline booking and actually were quite friendly and helpful. My room was on the 8th floor and I had a view of the room across from me â€“ I think it was room 811 that I could see out my window. I really, really, liked the room. It was interesting, lots of details to take in and thankfully different from the typical cookie cutter Hyatt-Hilton-Marriott blandness. The rooms I had was small, but well organized. I would take this room over a large cookie cutter room any day. I felt like somebody actually made an effort to give the room a bit of soul. It was the striped wallpaper, the excellent draperies, black and white tiled carpet, great looking lamps, bright red accents, the tiger print bathrobes. Lots of details...except one: Where's the coffee maker? They had everything else, ironing board, iron (and there was actually an outlet to use it with without having to move the bed away from the wall like in other hotels) safe, and all those other four star things you would expect. The flat screen TV was a bit too big for the room â€“ but I'm guessing there are some out there who think the TV can never be big enough. The wireless internet is free if you join their loyalty program. I think that is a very clever idea and more hotels should realize the benefit of doing this versus offering a ridiculously overpriced â€“ low performance â€“ service that alienates their customers. I should also mention that the hairdryer was a treasure hunt reward â€“ hidden in a bag hanging inside the bathrobe in the bathroom. Finally finding it made me happy â€“ looking for it...well, let's say happy wasn't the word. Makes me wonder if I just didn't find that elusive coffee maker.... After dropping my stuff, I was on a mission to grab a meal at my Grandfather's old haunt, Durgin Park over in Faneuil Hall. Back down to the â€œlobbyâ€� - which is actually a wide-ish curving passageway from the elevator to the door, they had a little table set up with a few wine bottles. There were several people mingling around partaking. The space wasn't there for this very neat idea â€“ they should have moved it into the Ruby Room, which actually is what takes up all the space of what could be the Lobby. I managed to make my way through the group after several pardon me's. Out the door â€“ and I really didn't pay close enough attention â€“ to the left I started walking towards Government center following the road that passes under the parking garage there. I'm guessing about 10 minutes walk up the road and you see the Union Oyster House, another couple of minutes and you're at Quincy Market, Faneuil Hall. I had my meal and it was on the way back that I missed Portland street and ended up walking around like a true foreigner trying to figure out why my Hotel wasn't where I expected it to be. But you can't really stay lost for long in this section of Beantown. Unlike my stay at the Marriott Long Wharf last November, that had been taken over by drunken college kids, I slept very well at the Onyx. The bed was comfortable and I didn't hear a thing. When I got up in the morning I spent a few minutes trying to find the coffee maker â€“ which I never did find - and resigned myself to getting dressed and heading out to Dunkin Donuts over at Government center for my morning cup. 5:30 a.m. found me passing through the lobby. The lady working reception seemed to be having a very involved conversation (me thinks personal conversation) on the phone and didn't really seem to see or acknowledge me on my way out. But I'm like that early in the morning â€“ I'm not very visible. Back to the hotel after my 15 minute walk and she's still at it â€“ but smiles at me this time without missing a beat on her phone call. Summary: Good hotel. Very nice room. Staff, for the most part, quite good. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SweetieTooth
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for a quick getaway... The Onyx is in a great location, ESPECIALLY if you are going to a show at TD Garden (literally, 2 blocks).. VERY Clean, Looks newly redone, and attention to detail is great. The rooms are fairly small, however, the set up is well executed so there feels like enough space... The location of the hotel is a little tricky to get to... It is on a one-way street and a map would be a good tool... We were lost, called the hotel, and the staff got us there in a jiffy :-) We did a package... It was called "refresh yourself", it was a good way to go.... it included Parking (w/ valet) which is $40... and if you're planning to do room service be prepared.... The package we did had a $50 breakfast credit... We aren't huge eaters, but we spent $60.... The best part of the package was the late checkout of 2:00 pm... It allowed us to take the T and leave our car at the hotel so that we could explore Boston without worrying about traffic and parking (as parking is ridiculous in Boston) If you choose not to do a package, however, there is an au bon pain right across the street and a Dunkin Donuts around the corner and if you have to pay for parking, you can get a $20 credit by driving a hybrid. Check out is normally at noon w/o a package. The hotel was close to the freedom trail and the north end... and just about 2 blocks away from the North Station "T" stop... Which can take you anywhere. It was a great weekend and we will be staying at the Onyx next time we stay in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Place by the Garden”
Reviews.Author: bgbbe
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff although Valet was a bit confusing and at $40 a bit expensive. Room was small but comfortable. The 13 year old loved the BathRobe. One minute away from the Garden so great if you are in for a game or show. Short walk to North End restaurants and Faneuil Hall. Overall a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: guggid1
Reviews.Content: Our seven nights in The Onyx hotel made our visit to Boston all the more enjoyable. Perfectly situated to explore the sights and spotlessly clean, it offered comfort and relaxation in equal measures. Having read several of the reviews before arriving, a charming staff was expected. However it was only when you are pleasantly welcomed upon arrival and warmly greeted as you enter and leave throughout the day, you begin to realise the incredible friendliness of the entire team. Cordial without being insincere, interested and enthusiastic without being intrusive, the staff is to be highly commended. They organised trips outside the city, offered advice and always encouraged an early return for the comforting hot chocolate in the afternoon. It really enhanced the experience. Complaints about room size were in our experience, unfounded. Ours was more than adequate unless you intend on bringing a herd of elephants with you!! Boston is an exciting and beautiful city to explore and the warmth of the Onyx welcome and the quality of the service provided ensures your memories of your holiday will always be joyous.

Reviews.Title: “I thought the place was great for young couples”
Reviews.Author: James4228
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Onyx hotel over the Feb 5, 2010 weekend. I thought the room was small, but well spaced, with a comfortable size bathroom. We went with another couple and they gave us the corner rooms which aloud us to lock the outer doors, while keeping our inner doors open for easy passage. On the second night as we came into our room, we smelled smoke coming from one of the vents, as neither of us are smokers, we immediately reported this to the front desk, and advised them of our concern, as well as concerned for being charged. They sent someone up to examin the issue, and felt it was nothing serious. After reading some posts I am slightly concerned that they may try and charge us for this, but I feel reasonable good that this wont happen. I don't believe there is a deep cleaning scam as I don't see how it would benefit employees. Maybe the hotel itself. But as an employee if you are asked to do this, which it is illegal, that would be a great lawsuit for them. Anyways assuming over the next week, we do not get charged for the deep cleaning, then I will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: Evjerr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to celebrate our son's 40th birthday and to attend the Boston Bruins/LA Kings Hockey Game at the TD Gardens which was a block away. The service at this hotel is extraordinary. They couldn't do enough for us. It's in a very good location, close to everything. The rooms are small but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!! - Friendliest Place In Boston!!”
Reviews.Author: Nelak
Reviews.Content: When we arrrived, we were greeted by the very friendly front desk staff!! We were quickly registered and went up to our room. We were given a room on the 10th floor of the hotel. The room was very well decorated and very clean!! We stayed for 2 nights, and every time we went down to the lobby area, we were greeted by friendly staff!! An excellent place to stay, especially if you are going to an event at the TD Gardens, as they are about 2 minutes away!! I would definately stay and recommend this hotel to friends and family!! Well worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Style not Substance”
Reviews.Author: GeeWP
Reviews.Content: When you travel a lot, expectations are high. This boutique hotel is in decent location, but if I was a woman at night when the nearby TD Garden is empty, I would be very uncomfortable. The staff is welcoming (on the way in). Then you pay $40 for valet parking, and its downhill. The small room had too much bulky furniture, "cute" leopard robes which were too small to fit a 6'1" 185 lb man and a nice flat screen TV which was placed on top of a high dresser, making viewing from anywhere in the room a sure prescription for a stiff neck! Room service came quickly, but the $16 chicken club was a poor imitation of a McDonald's chicken sandwhich. The sleek bathroom includes plenty of towels, and a glazed tile floor that when wet was slick. The sink was large, but so deep front-to-back that it was impractical. Finally, the decorative bed pillows must have taken a turn in the fitness club - musty and smelly. They were stashed in the closet for my stay. All in all, a place that's pleasing to the eye but falls short on useful comforts. I did get a kick out of the departure process - two desk clerks who were to busy to have eye contact, and a car valet who cleverly left my car essentially in the middle of the street. What a jerk.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions and good customer service are the most important part of a hotel stay.”
Reviews.Author: KToodle
Reviews.Content: From my intial phone call to the greeting upon entering the lobby I rate the Onyx hotel as excellent. I mentioned it was my birthday and the front desk manager arranged chocolate covered strawberries and champagne with a thank you/birthday wishes card for me next to the bed. The color scheme is vibrant yet warm, relaxing yet energizing. Its a very sexy atmosphere for the sophisticated crowd. Our suite, beautiful. Bed, pillows and linen exceptionally comfy. We were referred to the Fours bar and grill excellent food and service if you like american food about a block away. I am satisfied thus far with the deal I got on the Onyz website The refreash package is so worth it. I did have some hesitations after reading the reviews but after speaking to Hyut desk manager on the phone I was sold. She really extended herself to make my stay special. Because of Onyx's customer service, I give this hotel five stars. Sincerly, KToodle, CT

Reviews.Title: “Another victim of the Onyx and their "deep-cleaning" scam!”
Reviews.Author: unhappvisitor
Reviews.Content: I would like to make potential guests at the Onyx aware of a little scam thay seem to be perpetuating to charge extra fees. Without any warning or communication from the hotel staf, my credit card was billed for a "deep-cleaning": charge for "smoking" in a room at the Onyx, and the staff insinuated that we were liars when we said that neither one of us smoked. I am convinced this is an on-going scam by the Onyx to make up lost revenue due to the economy and rooms being booked at lower prices. The only reason that management responded to the previous poster about the same issueis tis o try and spin a little damage control and make themselves look good. We were contacted and also told the reasons for the "deep-cleaning" fee, which were totally fabricated by the Onyx staff. They refused to do anything about it and were condescending and rude. Money talks, and I would advise anyone thinking of booking at the Onyx to take their money and book elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Onyx”
Reviews.Author: dpkearney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a connecting room and brought our dog. The hotel is in a great location, 2 minutes from Quincy market and the train. The staff was lovely and rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: charlieg
Reviews.Content: Perfect location if you are planning on attending a Celtics/Bruins game. Hotel was clean, room was small, staff pleasant, free cocktails and evening drinks was a nice touch. The area seems to be in transition with one tree lined street full of nice pubs next to a less attractive parking lot type place Short walk to Faneuil Hall Marketplace and a bit longer but do-able to the Common and Beacon Hill. Reasonable access to the last blue "T" stop which is great for the airport I would stay again if I was returning to TD Gardens but if not I might try another part of town

Reviews.Title: “Overall horrible stay”
Reviews.Author: Kaijah8
Reviews.Content: I was referred to the Onyx Hotel by a friend. Over the phone, they were great. When we got there, half the staff could barely speak English. The room was very small but overall very clean and nice and view from window was horrible; trash and debris. Everything in the room had a price tag on it; including stuff in the closet and an unlocked mini bar that stares at you through a glass door. Prices are horrible for the mini bar; Aquafina water is $5 a bottle. Restaurant downstairs had completely different prices then were listed on the website. You get a super tiny bowl of soup for $9. We had to ask numerous times for a crib that had previously reserved. The staff was rude; including the valet. Hotel is in a good location for adults, about 10-15 minute walks to Quincy Market, New England Aquarium and the Museum of Science. Not a good place to bring young children because you have to walk everywhere. T-station (bus/train) is about a 10 minute walk away, but a tough walk through thick traffic and with young kids. Hotel is right next to a pub, so great for young couples who want to go out. Would not recommend this hotel for young children as you have to walk everywhere; the Marriot is much closer to the t-station. Also did not feel that this hotel was luxury, but about equal to that of a nice Holiday Inn. If you are a young couple and donâ€™t mind walking, the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel perfect location fantastic room”
Reviews.Author: mazthirkell
Reviews.Content: Have literally just returned from a 4 day stay in Boston and can HIGHLY recommend the Onyx Hotel, Portland Street. Having read almost all the reviews on this hotel we decided to go ahead and book for 4 nights we were slightly apprehensive as a few of them had commented on how small the rooms were - RIDICULOUS unless you're freakishly oversized the rooms were amazing with great colour schemes and amazingly comfortable beds. The location is spot on with Quincy Market a 5 minute stroll and an abundance of restaurants and bars to suit all tastes. TD Garden (home of the Boston Celtics) is 2 mins away and well worth catching a game if you can the atmosphere was amazing especially for the likes of us Brits. I urge you all to give it a try!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff - Great location - Truly pet friendly!!!”
Reviews.Author: MGrace8627
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at this hotel because we were in town to see the Celtics play at the TD Banknorth Garden. I can't emphasize enough how convenient it was to be within 1 block of our hotel after the game got out. If you ever been to the garden for an event, you know how IMPOSSIBLE it can be to get a cab when SO MANY people are competing with you. We literally just had to walk across the street and we were in bed in our pj's within 10 minutes! Speaking of beds, they are very comfortable at this hotel and we are truly bed snobs! Also, this hotel is very close to the Italian district (I think they call it the "East end"??) where all the amazing restaurants are located. We also brought our dog, a 120lb Rottweiler, with us for our stay. If you are the type that likes to bring your pet along when you travel, then you know that hotels who claim they are "pet friendly" often really aren't. Some hotels charge crazy fees, have size and breed restrictions that are competely unreasonable, and they treat you almost as if they are doing you a favor by letting you bring your pet along. Now I acknowledge that our dog isn't exactly an average sized dog and can be intimidating if you don't know him, but nonetheless if a hotel calls themselves "pet friendly," the dog's size and breed shouldn't matter (especially since our dog is a BIG BABY). This hotel was truly PET FRIENDLY. There was no pet fee, no size or breed restriction and the staff completely spoiled and indulged him. They even had the names of all the pets staying at the hotel on a sign above dog bowl full of water and doggy treats! It was really cool to see the manager of the hotel get down on his knees in his suit and tie to pet and hug our pup. The staff at this hotel is very attentive. Additionally, they are true professionals yet they are also able to make you feel at home by conversing freely and almost acting like friends instead of servants. We stay at only 4 and 5 star hotels and believe it or not it gets old when hotel staffers act like robotis. They were laid back and made us feel right at home- so much so that when my boyfriend asked the manager questions about how to get to the ticket office we needed to get our tickets from and expressed concerned about time constraints, the manager of the hotel took out his personal vehicle and drove him clear across town in rush our traffic to the ticket office to pick them up. Talk about service!!! All in all, we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We've stayed at several 5 star hotels in Boston and this will be our go-to hotel when traveling there from now on. Our only "complaints" (for lack of a better word) are the size of the rooms (small indeed), lack of a pool or recreational facilities and none of the rooms offered views of the city/harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service! Wost Hotel Experience! No Not Stay.. ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: casualtraveler28
