Reviews.Content: Horrible customer service. Seems nice at fist look.. online. We're typically a "you catch more bees with honey" kind of family. The valet was very rude.. I chaulked it up to a language thing. Went for a nice walk to quincy market.. grabbed a small meal and 6 cans of beer for the evening. The "valet/bouncer" stoped us and said it was illeagal to bring in alcohol.. then said it was actually hotel policy. Regardless.. this was not advertised, nor disclosed whatsoever upon reservation, online confirmation, or even at check-in. Understand businesses need to make money, but a little common sense goes a long way. Please do not stay at the Onyx in Boston - customer service ruined my weekend!

Reviews.Title: “A glass of wine when we checked in!”
Reviews.Author: MountainOlga
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at the Onyx -- the location put us walking distance to Faneuil Hall, the North End, and everywhere else we wanted to go. Thank you for the glass of wine when we checked in, the extremely friendly service, and the lovely decor. It felt like a real vacation -- exactly what we needed. My only kind of complaint is that we weren't told there would be an extra charge for not picking up our car with the valet by a certain time. The valet was kind and let us off the hook. Got this room on Priceline.com, which was the only way we could have afforded it. Appreciate their commitment to being a green hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service along with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: KRGreenBay
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Boston and dropped our luggage early at the hotel. The staff was very helpful with maps and city information. They also informed us of the 2:00 daily popsicle hour (which we never made it back for) and the 5:00 wine hour (which we always made it back for)! The rooms are small, but stylish and the hotel was exceptionally clean. The staff was great. They always asked how our day was when we returned and were very willing to help with suggestions for dinner locations. The location was an easy walk to attractions. We also walked to dinner in the North End every evening. The subway and commuter trains are just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “quite the small room”
Reviews.Author: SeattleJC
Reviews.Content: My partner and I prefer boutique hotels with a touch of trendy decor and some character -- and the Onyx fits this profile. As long as the bed is comfy, we are usually happy. This bed was fine. But I must say the room was really tiny. It was standard room i think, and we got a decent price online. We always pack light but we felt quite cramped -- we did room service one night which was a joke as we had no idea where to put the tray and plates! After the third night in such close quarters, we were ready to head home. I will say the bathroom was fairly large in comparison to the rest of the room. Even for a boutique hotel renovation, this small room size was pushing credulity. Had we known, we would have spent a more for a suite or something with a bigger footprint. Service was pretty good from all the staff. Good location. Oh, funny thing: when we asked where there was a liquor store, the desk clerk told us there was one around the block but that were we not allowed to bring our own booze into the room!?!? Ridiculous. (Of course, we did anyway.)

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITELY not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: IndieQueen819
Reviews.Content: to describe these rooms as small is an absolute understatement. The rooms were MINISCULE and crammed full of what seemed like oversized furniture. The "deluxe double room" that we stayed in was cramped for just 2 people...and there was not nearly enough drawer space for two women on a long weekend. The service wasnt awful, but it was SLOW. it took them an hour to get our car out of valet...thank God we called early or else i'm sure we would have missed our dinner reservation. The bar was overpriced, but that came as no shock since i'm from the NYC area and used to overpriced drinks. It seemed like it was one thing after another with this hotel...we check into a tiny room with a lovely view of a BRICK WALL and there are no towels, no soap...we get those things and then are nearly late for dinner b/c it took an hour for the car to arrive....which brings me to my next complaint: parking is valet only, and $40 a night!! There is ample street parking...but it's meters and overnight parking isn't allowed. The only good thing about the Onyx was the location...about a 5 minute walk from the waterfront which was nice. Otherwise, i would see no reason at all to stay there. We got a discounted rate at about $200 a night...i've stayed at Courtyard's for $75 a night with better service and more comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Fred7861
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are clean and rather nicely decorated, beds are small (they definitely do not fit for two adults), rooms are also very small and the air conditionning system was very noisy. Only good point, personnel was kind. This would be acceptable for $80 per night, but really not for $239 (plus $20 for the breakfast and $40 for the car park) !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Service, More like 3.0 Stars Though”
Reviews.Author: devils107
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I recently stayed at the Onyx for our 4 day honeymoon in Boston. We read a ton of reviews on this hotel before we booked the room. We stayed in a standard King room. 1. Location--absolutely perfect location if you intend to visit the North End (Boston's version of Little Italy) and the bars/restaurants located in Center City/Boston Commons. The North End was a ten minute walk at most and Boston Commons was at most a fifteen walk. The block itself has two bars and two restaurants on it, a dunkin donuts and Au Bon Pan on it and a 7-Eleven on it. Also, Canal Street, which is all breweries, bars and pubs is located one block over, which is super convenient. Public transportation like the "T" is also two blocks away. It's so worth the money to book this hotel and save $200 as opposed to those located in center city. One important note, there was construction on the street in front of the hotel, so make sure you request a room in the BACK of the hotel, because it's loud in the morning!!!! 2. Staff--super friendly, young. Upon check-in, we were promptly given our room and our car was parked. They were upfront right away about the $40/night parking fee and that the valet would require a 30 minute lead time to get your car (you should walk everywhere anyways in Boston). They promptly brought up our bags to the room and even gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne and a card to welcome us for our honeymoon. Throughout the 4 days we stayed at the hotel, we called down several times for more bathroom items and various things and someone came to our room w/in 5 minutes and assisted us. People at front desk were very helpful and accomodating though. 3. Amenities--considering they tout themselves as a 4 star hotel, there could have been a lot more, this is my only complaint. No frills all the way. Only given a coffee maker on request, sheets and towels weren't super plush for this hotel, no fridge, no microwave in 4 star hotel, that's a shame!!! Probably my only complaint about this hotel. The wine reception (free wine from 5-6pm each night) is cool, but how much wine can you drink in an hour before dinner. Didn't use the fitness room or anything else, and no pool in this hotel, which sucked. Free wireless internet at least. 4. Room--the room had one of the best beds I've ever slept on and I liked the bathroom. The room was super clean when we checked in. That being said, the room is WAY SMALL!!! We didn't care, but the walls are kind of thin and there is definitely no view to be had based on the location of the hotel, you'll either look at the back of the building, an alley, or another building in the front. We stayed here for the location, not the view. One thing--the air conditioner is LOUD, omg is it loud. 5. Overall--the location of this hotel is wonderful, that's why we stayed there. It's not even close to a 4-star hotel, more like a 3 star. The staff was very friendly and courteous. The room was nice enough, but very small. No amenities at all left a lot to be desired, especially when you're paying $200+ a night. The $40/night parking sucked, but I've read everywhere that it's commonplace in Boston to pay through the nose for parking. If you're booking for location and a mostly quiet, tucked away place to stay, then this is your hotel. If you're looking for a 4-star, then stay elsewhere. This hotel is really tiny though, tiny rooms, tiny lobby, tiny lougue in lobby, tiny everything, so be ready for that. The hotel suited our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time with the family”
Reviews.Author: fergus1369
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a night in Boston so we could take the kids (ages 4 and 6) to the Science Museum so through Priceline we ended up at the Onyx. And the experience was great great. We checked in mid-afternoon at popsicle time (not a typo) and the kids thought we had landed in some grown-up/child hybrid where it "looks like it is for big people but it has things for little people too." Then in the rooms the kids immediately but on their faux leopard house coats and strutted around for an hour. Plus the kid-bag was probably the best I have seen anywhere, including luggage tags for their bags, pens, deck of cards, and bubbles. For dinner we walked to the North End in about 15 minutes - just about the right distance. You could even walk to the museum if you were not included to take the T. Room was small but it was beautiful, service was exceptional, kids had a great time and so did the adults (wine tasting hour...). We even played Wii in the lobby for a while (something new for all of us). Overall a great experience and terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: SoCalFamily2009
Reviews.Content: The rooms look just like the internet pictures, but are also the same size as the pictures...stylish but small. Conveniently located across the street from the TD Center and the subway station. Staff was pleasant. Close enough to downtown historic sites to walk, but maybe a bit far at the end of the day with small kids. Tip: room service is faster than the restaurant service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, with exceptional service.”
Reviews.Author: laurabelledec
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. The room, although a bit small, was beautifully decorated. The bathroom was large, upscale and modern. The bedding was ultra comfortable. But the hotel is really about the service. The staff was wonderful. My husband and son got lost trying to circle the block (you can't do that in Boston, nothing goes thru) while waiting for me to check in, and the front desk talked him back to the hotel, with turn by turn directions. The valet literally waved him down when he got near the hotel. The location, near the North End, was great. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, nice rooms and a so-so location”
Reviews.Author: CaNo
Reviews.Content: Our experience found the hotel staff to be attentive and friendly and appreciated our patronage. The rooms were well decorated and we enjoyed the complimentary happy hour and internet service. There's an Au Bon Pain across the street for breakfast and Porter's down the block was an OK place to grab a bite. During the day this is an excellent location. At night, I have to agree with the other posters that the neighborhood is currently subpar. Since there is little foot traffic and an abandoned/to be refurbished building down the street, its not a comfortable place to be walking at night. The street was also completely torn up for repairs during our stay. An odd location for such a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Tombosh
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt one of the best, if not the best hotel my wife and I have ever stayed in. Went to see Paul McCartney at Fenway and spent the rest of the weekend in Boston, and I am so glad I chose the Onyx. Everybody was so nice and friendly from the front desk to the custodians. Talk about clean. Even the hallways were spotless. A very safe and secure hotel. What a fantastic rate we got also. A1 in our book. Can't wait to go back.. The only place we will ever stay in Boston. Tom and Brenda Bomil Dracut Mass.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Hotel with Super Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: miltonandmarvin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Onyx Hotel for a one night getaway following a Red Sox game. We live in Western Massachusetts and didn't want the hassle of driving home after the game. We found the location to be perfect and the staff very accommodating. Although the room was on the small side it had everything we could ask for, including a very comfortable bed. We also found the room to be very clean. We go into Boston about once a year for an overnight stay, and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Large $ for Valet Parking, but GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: ses-merrimack
Reviews.Content: JULY 3-4, 2009: Onyx is only a few minutes walk from TD Northbank Boston Garden, Faneiul Hall, Fantastic North End Italian food, and the Hatch Shell (where the July 4th celebrations take place.) Our very small King Bed room was $229 plus tax, plus $40 per day for parking. Front Desk help was excellent. It's a dog-friendly hotel, and staff was totally great with the pets. North Station is a block away, so it's a fine hotel to come into town via commuter rail from the North. There were no views from our 7th floor room or the public part of the hotel. Free WIFI had minor set-up bugs, but then worked well. Basically a good hotel that I would like to revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for Sports Nuts”
Reviews.Author: wyde1340
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous!!! The fact that it is really close proximity to the TD Banknorth, makes it fantastic for us hockey-nuts!!! The T is right around the corner and everything is within walking distance - you don't have a view from the windows, but really, who the heck is busy staring out a window in Boston?!!! :) This was the 2nd time I've stayed at this hotel and will continue to stay there - the hotel staff is down to earth and the atmosphere is homey...which is exactly what I want.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but poor location”
Reviews.Author: calair9
Reviews.Content: the hotel lobby/bar area is small & basic but the rooms (albeit on the small side) had everthing that we needed including towelling robes, large flat screen TV, free morning newspaper & fully stocked mini bar etc. We did sleep in a room next to the 7th floor lift but no problem with noise etc. However, their was construction work happening in the nearby streets which started at 6am every morning which did interupt our sleep!!! The hotel is comfortable but NOT 4 star - I would give it a generous 3 star rating. The surrounding area is more business than tourist which means not a pleasant walk back from downtown in the evening especially with the high number of down & outs in the city

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: loveabuy
Reviews.Content: We stay at Kimpton hotels frequently, and love them. This hotel is no exception. We were cordially greeted, our room was ready (be sure to call ahead for early check-in),and the room itself was fun, well-stocked, and clean. Even our Lhasa Apso dog was greeted with water and treats. We were concerned about the area, after reading several reviews, but could not find a reason for concern. The North End, Faneuil Hall, and the new Garden are within walking distance. As well as several fun pubs and places to eat and drink. We got a great rate on the Kimpton website, and would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location if you are attending an event at the Garden”
Reviews.Author: PGtraveler
Reviews.Content: I was a first-time visitor to Boston during graduation season and this was one of the few hotels with a vacancy. It was very close to the "T" so we were able to either walk or take the subway to all the sites we wanted to visit. Very nice rooms even though they are small ,but a larger room is not necessary for most travelers unless you plan to entertain in the room. Staff were very friendly and helpful.IThis DEFINITELY is the place to stay if you are in town for a Celtic game. The only reason I give it only 4 stars is because it is necessary to walk to the "T" to get to downtown (if you don't know the area). Quincy Market and Fanuil Hall are close enough to walk easily.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: JenAnnB
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Onyx, while attending two shows at the Boston Gardens. This hotel is ideally located for this activity, just down the street from the Gardens. The hotel is very stylish and friendly. The rooms are great, with everything one could need. I particularly liked the ipod dock, the bathrobe, and the very comfortable bed. The staff was friendly, and arranged an early check-in for me, which I was very grateful for. I had one dinner in the restaurant, and it was of excellent quality. However, the hotel is quite pricey, although this may be typical for Boston. I had the special "Garden" rate, but even this was expensive. One other small complaint - I had not brought a laptop, and the internet access in the basement was quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Boston”
Reviews.Author: jooph
Reviews.Content: This is truly a hidden gem in Boston. Not a large chain hotel, but part of the elegant Kimpton hotel chain. Rooms are elegant and special, atmosphere is nice. This is a place that I can recoomedn to both business travellers and tourists. Definitely value for money. Also nice that the company is trying hard to be "green".

Reviews.Title: “The staff took very good care of us.”
Reviews.Author: mikect
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Onyx because we were going to a Celtics game for my birthday,and it seemed like a nice hotel that was within walking distance of the Banknorth Garden. The fact we received a reduced rate because we were going to a game was icing on the cake. We asked if we could check in early and we were very pleased they had a room ready for us when we arrived at noon, When we came back to our room after the game there was a bottle of Champagne and a post card from the staff with a nice message on it wishing me a happy Birthday. (Thanks Sara and Hayat!) Our room was beautiful and very relaxing and we wished could stay more then one night. When we were checking out the wife declared..."Whenever we come to Boston, we are staying here!"

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotelâ€¦Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nsalphadog
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here on March 21/09. No surprises, we asked for two beds on an upper floor and thatâ€™s what we got, and they were comfortable beds. Never read any of the reviews until we came back and I must say I am a little surprised at some of the comments. It looks like some people just complained to see if they could get a free night and then were mad that they didnâ€™t. Personally, I donâ€™t think $149 or $169 is overpriced for a hotel like this at this great location. We chose this hotel because we were going to the Bruins game on Sunday. I felt it was a bonus to be able to walk to numerous bars/pubs, and had a great time Sat night. On Sunday, we walked over to Quincy Market. We had no idea what it was and ended up spending a few hours there and also had lunch outside on one of the benches. It was a great time! Sure, the room wasnâ€™t huge, but very adequate for the two of us. Very nice, clean modern bathroom. I do have to agree that there wasnâ€™t much of a view from the window but sitting at the window looking outside wasnâ€™t the purpose of our visit, lol. The staff did a good job looking after us. In the morning, we didnâ€™t want to partake in the full buffet and only wanted some toast and a little fruit, so they only charged us $8.50 instead of the full buffet price of $16.00, thanks. When we checked out, they looked after our bags until the game was over, NC, thanks for that as well. We didnâ€™t even have to wait for someone to go get our car as it was waiting out front when we walked back from the game, a third thank you. I forgot a shirt at the hotel that I had bought, I called them on Monday and they were able to find it and make arrangements to FedEx it to me. Another job well done by the staff at the Onyx. Our trip was all good and we plan to go back to Boston again to see another game and will no doubt stay at the Onyx again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, valet service needs work.”
Reviews.Author: brianx40
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I traveled to Boston on Thursday, March 19 for a night on the town celebrating our anniversary. We arrived at the hotelâ€™s curbside check-in, unloaded our bags and searched for a valet driver, who apparently was on break. I walked into the lobby and was greeted by a friendly wine host who offered my sweetheart and me wine and crackers. Again, I searched for a valet to move my illegally parked car to no avail. As we checked in at the front desk, I watched as an individual drove down the one-way street in his Dodge pickup truck, pulled in front of my car, and reversed until the trailer hitch of his behemoth was thru the front bumper of my sedan. Now, this clearly was not the fault of the hotel but the incident was absolutely in part due to the inconvenient drop off location and poor valet service. My car should have either been moved immediately or a valet should have been available curbside to direct incoming guests where to park, as is common place at most valet locations. After reading some of the phenomenal reviews I must say I expected hotel management to compensate us in some way for the unfortunate incident. I understand that expecting anything more than the minimum from most hotels these days is a direct route to disappointment, but the highly touted Kimpton Management group seems to hold itself to a higher set of standards. I was reassured when my girlfriend told me that the front desk clerk had asked her what our room number was. I assumed that either our parking fees would be deducted from our bill or at the very least to be compensated with a bottle of wine, which they seem to give away so liberally. Needless to say, I felt a little bit slighted when we saw no such return. Again, I realize that this incident was unfortunate and accidental and I donâ€™t believe that this experience should deter anyone from staying at the Onyx. As far as the rest of my stay, here are my thoughts: Yes, the rooms are slightly smaller than usual, but make up for it with a cozy feel and nice setup. More importantly, the room was IMMACULATE, and I do mean immaculate. The bathroom was clean and stocked to perfection. Complementary high-speed internet is a rare find. I had correspondence with 3 hotel employees, the wine host, front desk clerk and Ruby Room bartender, all of whom were pleasant. Lastly, my request for a late checkout was granted and we were able to stay until noon the next morning, without a single pestering knock from housecleaning. All in all, the hotel offers nice accommodations in addition to a pleasant staff. Consequently, if there had been a valet available to either move my car or direct a careless driver, than I believe the Onyx would have offered nothing less than a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience of our lives-horrible service”
Reviews.Author: rigbyL
Reviews.Content: rooms not ready(3hrsbehind) staff was rude. finally given 2 rooms for our group of 8 & beds weren't made. 1 person was promised a cot upon booking & returned around 1am & still no cot. After this horrible experience I wrote a complaint letter and it was given to an employee for the co. & her boss said it is only one complaint but couldn't really help us. I wanted another stay for 1 night to make up for this- they said no. we booked this 3 months in advance!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, especially if you're a Celtics fan”
Reviews.Author: rogjaminov
Reviews.Content: The Onyx is a great hotel. The only issue we had was the location, which is a bit of a hike to restaurants on Hanover Street. If you're coming to Boston to see a Bruins or Celtics game, however, you'll love the location, which is about three block from the stadium were they play. The rooms are a little small, but very clean and chic - very Kimpton. You might want to park your car at the stadium's extended car park, because the valet parking is pretty dear.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SwoonGmail
Reviews.Content: Pros - Really great staff, genuine and not phoney, Close to North Station and The Banknorth Stadium, Handy for The North End for great Italian food !, Nice Public bar with, again, great staff Cons - Rooms Small, Windows that don't open, Rooms a bit claustrophobic for 2 adults and 1 child with luggage in tow ! It's a pricey room for what you get, take for example, The Radisson, it's a better location, bigger rooms and cheaper, but then they don't have the staff of The Onyx ! They are a great asset.

Reviews.Title: “So Awesome”
Reviews.Author: soundofmine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove 14 hours to Boston with two 70lb dogs and this hotel was a welcome sight. The staff was so friendly to our hyper dogs (from being cooped up in the car), gave them treats and even brought up dog bowls and bottled water free of charge! This in the ONLY hotel in Boston that allows big dogs and they had amazing services. The hotel offers free dog walking, free dog sitting and a range of treats and food for purchase. I should also mention the spectacular rooms, Aveda bath products, trendy bar and delicious breakfast. The hotel was also in walking distance from some great Italian restaurants and bars. I will stay at the Onyx with or without my dogs every time I'm in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Best for Fleet Center events”
Reviews.Author: HikerTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a half block from Fleet Center. Not sure it is possible to find a better location for events there. The hotel rooms a re small, but nicely furnsihed. Bathrooms and functional and well appointed. The Ruby Room is very small, but breakfast is convenient and satisfactory ($16). Valet parking is available, but be aware that it is $40 a night. Actually a good deal if you weigh it against other Fleet Center parking options.

Reviews.Title: “great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: lissa60106
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be in a great location. It's roughly a 5-7 minute walk to Quincy Market and the street is directly across from where the Bruins and Celtics play. PERFECT FOR FANS! The bars and night-life was also a plus plus for us. Driving around Boston is still a little tricky, so allow plenty of time for yourselves. We've been to Boston before but this time took one of the Trolly Rides around. We would recommend that you take it. Its alittle pricie, but the guy selling tickets gave us a nice deal. Roughly $22 each (we're students) compared to $32. The hotel assistants were very nice and extremely helpful with anything we needed. We thought the atmosphere of the hotel was very relaxing, which is what we were looking for. The Ruby Room was amazing, much smaller than what we pictured but I think it added to the comfort feeling. Food wasn't amazing...not bad but nothing great and a tad over priced. The rooms were very nice and for the most part very clean. There were some clothes left over in one of the drawers, clean, but not ours. Of course it's alittle expensive, but your in Boston so it's expected. Their Vallet price is $40. We didn't know it was $40 a day though. We only stayed for 2 nights, so it wasn't too bad. If you have pet allergies, don't worry too much because we coudn't even tell there were pets there. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would plan on staying again. It is a little expensive, but it is located in the heart of Boston, so it's ecpected. A plus to staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bdumont1063
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Onyx 1/2 - 1/3. This hotel is very clean. Room was small but cozy (booked a deluxe king). We only stayed one night to see a Celtics game. All staff was very friendly. Hotel allows pets, which were no problem. We stayed on the 5th floor. No noise, found hotel to be very quiet. After the game, we went to hotel bar (Ruby Bar). Met some great people, only downfall is they usually call last call at 11:00pm which is quite early, but because the bar had a few customers, they kept the bar open until 12:00. This hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to Faneul Hall, and the TD Banknorth. There are many restaurants and bars in the area. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: weirdpie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Onyx hotel for 4 nights in December to attend a meeting in Boston. I enjoyed my stay and here are my pros and cons: Pros - Friendly helpful staff - Great decor in public areas and in the room - Nice ambience in public areas - Good location near to The Freedom Trail - Good room price (although gets pricey in high season) - Good food in restaurant. The continental breakfast is excellent Cons - Room was a little noisy, both from other guests and the street - Public areas could get a little noisy too In summary, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Off the tourist track, but great for NHL/NBL at The Garden”
Reviews.Author: travelerMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a little off the tourist track, so if you're expecting tourist attractions at the doorstep, look elsewhere, but is in a perfect location across from The Garden for NHL or NBL games, as well as North Station (for commuter rail and T-subway). It is within walking distance to North End (Italian village), Waterfront, Beacon Hill, Faneuil Hall, and for the energetic to Boston Common/Downtown Crossing. While it's a little quiet at night, I didn't feel unsafe. There are a few pubs/restaurants on the same street as the hotel (but better to go to North End), as well as Au Bon Pain and 7-Eleven. Free morning coffee/tea was no longer available while I was there, but they happily supplied me with a coffee percolator. The staff were friendly and helpful. The entrance is a bit crowded in the evening when there's free wine/cheese, but I didn't partake in this, nor use the bar or room service. My room was on a high floor, was bright, clean and of average size, and decent comfortable bed. I was initially a bit concerned about having pets as neighbours, but was reassured they're sequestered on allocated floors, and I didn't hear a peek out of any pet/neighbour during the stay. The CRT TVs were replaced by large screen LCD TVs while I was there. Overall, it's a decent convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place . . . .”
Reviews.Author: afitzg75
Reviews.Content: I'm a little late posting this, we stayed here last year for our anniversary, and we are going back this year at the end of this month again to celebrate our anniversary so I will update any changes I see. This is a fantastic place to stay if you are doing anything at the Garden, the location cannot be beat. The staff was extremely helpful in finding restaurants, etc. They recommended a fantastic place in the North End, Al Dente, and seemed eager to help with whatever we needed. Yes the lobby is a little dim in the evening but it is just to create the atmosphere for the bar/lounge area that is located in the lobby. It didn't feel like it was hard to see or anything like that. It did seem pet-friendly, we saw a few very well-behaved dogs there that we barely noticed they were so quiet. All-in-all this was a great weekend and we are so excited to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service; Poor value”
Reviews.Author: docproc
Reviews.Content: The Onyx promotes itself as a "luxury boutique hotel," but that was hardly my experience. Let me summarize a few of my disappointments with the service I received: --On three occasions I called the front desk to get assistance and no one answered. 20 rings each time, no response. --When I finally got through to the front desk, I was put on hold for more than five minutes. --When I went to the hotel bar around 5:15, there was no bartender on duty--despite there being several customers waiting at the bar. I had to ask staff members three different times if a bartender was on the way. The bartender didn't show up until about 5:45. --I asked the front desk for a wake-up call at 7:30 a.m. the following morning. The call never came. I woke up at 8:15 and was late to a business meeting that I had to race to without showering. Very embarrassing and frustrating. There were other problems as well, including the fact that when I wrote a message outlining my complaints, I didn't get a response (I'm guessing a staffer might have kept it from getting to the manager). Suffice it to say that I would not stay at the Onyx again and will not recommend it to friends. At more than 300 bucks a night, this is not a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cja10
Reviews.Content: The concierge at the Onyx was unbelievably helpful. He took care of every detail of our trip, from coordinating airport pickup, restaurant reservations and car rental. Really made for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not like Marlowe”
Reviews.Author: trekker86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Marlowe 2 years ago in Cambridge, MA and loved it! It was by far the best hotel service we had and we enjoyed taking our dog along with us. The staff was so helpful and went beyond the definition of pet-friendly. So, when we heard Kimpton had a hotel near the Northend, we were eager to try it out. While it was not the perfect location for taking your pet (Marlowe had a park right next to it), it was nice to be downtown so close to everything. The rooms were a bit small, but decorated the same. My real disappointment came in the service, I didn't think the staff was as friendly. Marlowe had a ton of amenities for our dog, and Onyx seemed a bit bothered by him. Overall, the stay was okay...I would definitely choose Marlowe next time. It was more scenic, more pet friendly, and overall a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible -”
Reviews.Author: taby12
Reviews.Content: The place is dark and depressing. It tries to be boutique but the decor is horribly cheesy. The guy working the front desk made me nervous. He comes across as a car salesman promising everything under the sun but never really follows through. That fake hospitality always makes me uncomfortable. I rather someone just be nice and calm. Also, charging 40 bucks for valet is tacky. They should raise the rate instead of trying to slip in all these hidden costs. The rooms were tiny with obscenely large pieces of furniture which adds to the claustrophobic feel of the place. Sorry to be so negative but with so many great hotels in Boston I really felt let down by the experience.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel - but the porter stole my wallet!!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayMaker1974
Reviews.Content: We checked in on 1 Sept, handed over my credit card and went up to the room. We had been in the room on the 7th floor for less than 3 minutes when the porter knocked on the door to deliver wine. I was in the process of looking for my wallet as I realised I no longer had it and wanted to tip him. We let him in and he behaved very nervously setting out the wine and glasses (which I didn't really think much of at the time). I called down to the front desk to ask if my wallet was left on the desk and it wasn't. I then requested them to review the security camera of the lobby (they stupidly don't have them on the individual floors) what they saw was me put my wallet back into my shorts pocket and even tap it to check it was safe before movign to the lift. I then remembered taking my wallet and map and putting it on my suitcase outside our room door as I took the room keys from the same pocket. I immediately complained to the concierge that within 2 minutes of being in the room the porter appeared and my wallet had gone. He had concerns and took my to the kitchen and checked the bins there as well as the private outside bins that only the staff have access too. He made a brief search but didn't find it and spoke to me in whispers as he was obviously afraid of being overheard by the staff that he also suspected the porter. Next I called the police (who only completed an incident report over the phone and never visited the hotel to see me or question the porter) and then the head of security got involved and said he'd quizzed the porter and thought he was suspicious. After all this, my wallet, with my credit card, $424 cash and drivers licence were never returned. I am really disgusted at the way it was handled - I feel that they should have searched the bins thoroughly and had the police come to question the porter (who was quick to ask me if I'd reported the credit card stolen the first time I went to the desk to complain). I have visited this particular hotel 3 times in the last 18 months with my wife as we really liked it, but after this incident and the way it was handled, I will never be returning. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “not as good as the brochure”
Reviews.Author: yoyoEngland
Reviews.Content: not exactly how appeared in the brochure. the staff were off hand a novelty in boston where people are exceptionally polite an friendly. all rooms dark and not too clean. overall was not worth even half the cost of the three nights. would be reluctant to recommend thi hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Kirsch Hotel, Everything is For sale except the Mold in Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: goTurk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews thinking that it would be a good one night stay in Boston before flying out. We got the rooms from by calling the hotel. Hotel provides no breakfast included with $240 a night charge, i guess this may be normal in Boston area, not sure. Lobby of the hotel is very dark, you can almost run into other guests. The place is like a Batman movie set. They tried to provide some sort of 90s Euro-trash ambient not for 2008 Boston. I guess their clients are mostly "wanna be" types. Hotel is pet friendly, so you will be seeing K9s, but leashed. The initial room we were provided was very small and it had a window about one feet wide. At our request, the room was changed. The new room was equally small but with a larger window looking at another room room six feet away from the hotel next door. The room decor is very kirsch, (but very very kirsch). It is mostly black and red, remind me of red light districts of Amsterdam. More importantly, everything that you can touch is for sale, from bathrobes to umbrellas in the closet to tiger pattern boxers. You are not sure what to use or not, concern of the extra charge you may get when you checked out. It is not enough that they charge over two hundred dollars for this room, they also want to make few extra buck by selling novelty kirsch item of the hotel. I would personally be embarrassed to buy "Fredrick's of Hollywood"type of stuff from the room inventory. I guess there are such people in the World. Funny, 200lbs Sony CRT TV is bolted to the TV stand. I cannot imagine who would dare to steal a TV this large and Heavy from a small hotel. One thing is not for sale, the mold on bathtubs (see the uploaded photos). I guess management is too busy selling bathrobes that it cannot focus on cleaning aspects of the hotel. Overall, minuses: -Molded bathroom -Cheap money making style -Kirsch decor -Expensive rooms -Small rooms (again, very SMALL) -Trashy view -Dark ambiance Good things: -Aveda products (although only for one person) -Free wireless internet (this is almost default for all hotels) Final conculusion: Find another hotel to spend $250 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: HalifaxTravelers
Reviews.Content: Three 30-something women travelled last week to the Onyx Hotel in Boston. We experienced top-quality service and the accomodations were above and beyond our expectations! From the minute we jumped out of the car..we had excellent service. We were greeted by the fantastic Chris (Head Concierge) and then we checked in under the direction of the fabulously friendly Alexis! We missed the 5-6 o'clock happy hour but Chris visited our oom with a complimentary bottle of wine!!The people who work here are exceptionally friendly and professional. Top Notch! Thanks to the Chris and Chris P., Alexis and of course, Darnella! If I could remember the rest of the employees, I would mention them too ,but I can't recall. The rooms are gorgeous. The decor is beautiful, the corridors and lobby are immaculate. Everything is of a very high-quality. The location is key..a 5 min walk to Faneuil Hall , a 7 dollar cab ride to Newbury Street. I will go nowhere else the next time I am in Boston!!! Awesome family- like atmosphere!!! in a gorgeous european setting! Incredible experience at the ONYX!!!:)

Reviews.Title: “Very hip and dog friendly!”
Reviews.Author: janeenee
Reviews.Content: Very hip and modern. We walk by it all the time on the way to TD Banknorth Garden and thought we'd give it a shot for a weekend treat. Nice furnishings, complementary wine and cheese in the lobby at check in (good wine too)....I thought it was great that I could bring my dog so I didn't have to leave him home (he hated it but for reasons the hotel cannot be faulted for) BUT there is no grassy place for a place to readily relieve your dog, all cement around but if you're dog doesn't mind where he goes, bring him! Also, they treated him like a king, and we're very nice to us too. One thing though, it was December and they had the AC on in our room at check-in (maybe to move the air around) I froze my butt off for a while before realizing it. We chose a street side room, I thought it would be fun to be able to look out but I was woken up by the garbage trucks at 3am raising and dumping all the way down the street but I guess that's the city for you. I'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Onyx was fab”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamp74
Reviews.Content: We made our first trip in to Boston in July and stayed at the Onyx - we were not disappointed! The staff was wonderful, as was our room. We were in town for the Eagles at the TD Banknorth and the location was excellent - we were a stone's throw from the Arena. Everyone was so friendly, it was incredible. Our room was beautifully appointed and our floor was very quiet. We enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Onyx and would definitely recommend it to anyone staying in Boston. We will most certainly stay again and are looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ducati40
Reviews.Content: Good location. Easy walking distance to the Italian district, to the center etc we actually waked everywhere. Do not bring a car, parking is very expensive and driving in Boston is quite difficult! Walking on the other hand, is easy! Rooms are nice, clean and tidy, but small. Bathroom good size. Beds comfortable. Ask for a coffeemaker if you want one, it is not in the room but you will have one for free. Wine hour is nothing to rush home for - it's between 5-6 every evening, a glass of cheap wine or a bear - nothing more. Staff friendly and will give you advice if you need them. Exercise room extremely small; donâ€™t go if you have claustrophobia! Air-condition extremely noisy, and turns on during the night, so if you are a light sleeper you will definitely wake up! There is a micro brewery around the corner - good one! There is a 7 eleven shop at the corner, if you want a soda or anything. Just across the street you find a nice place for a healthy breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “The Onyx - a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Jan024
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Onyx for a few days in July 2008. We had stayed in a few different hotels during our visit to Boston and this was the best. The rooms were clean and extremely modern, and while our double/double room was not huge we managed with two adults and two teens. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and were usually about during the wine and cheese hour (a lovely touch) to give tips on restaurants or attractions in and around the city. The location is only a very short walk from Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market, the Aquarium and wharf, etc. The only negative comment we had was that a fee was necessary here to use the computer with internet access, while at most of the other hotels we visited, this was a complimentary service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel (4th of July weekend)”
Reviews.Author: ungrecco
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Onyx for the 4th of July weekend. Chose the hotel based on price and pet friendly policy. Hotel looked great in pics on website... looks just as good, if not better in person. The decor was very nice.. modern look, but nothing crazy.... nice combination of colors and materials. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. The room was not huge, but served its purpose. We had a king sized bed, very nice bathroom, desk, tv, iron, floor to ceiling windows, free wifi... couldn't ask for more. The bed was SUPER comfy. The bathroom was very inviting and spacious. There was a nice arm chair in the room as well. We had a pet friendly room on a pet friendly floor. You would never know the floor or room were pet friendly by seeing them (or smelling them). The location was great. We valet parked the car for our stay. You just call the reception before you need the car and they pull it to the front for you. Haymarket is the closest stop, although it is Boston and you can walk EVERYWHERE. Faneuil Hall is just blocks away. We walked to the North End, the aquarium, downtown crossing... everywhere. Again, I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice european style hotel, a few problems but still an excellent bargain!”
Reviews.Author: dmsgrl
Reviews.Content: We love the Kimpton Hotels and, while this was not our favorite, it is a very nice little hotel. The rooms are on the small side. On the plus side, the location is quiet but is within convenient walking distance to all the major downtown attractions. The staff, as always for Kimpton, was very helpful and friendly. The beds at Kimpton hotels are INCREDIBLY comfortable, so much so that people often buy the mattresses from the company who supplies them, and my bed was no exception. The sheets are always Frette and so nice to settle in to. The evening wine reception featuring different types of wines each month is something I always look forward to at Kimpton properties. I was disappointed to arrive in the early evening, exhausted after traveling from Paris to Newark and then to Boston, and get no help lugging my two bulky bags in the door and to the desk even though two employees with no other clients stood behind the desk and watched me. Not exactly the welcome I've come to look forward to for this particular company. That and the very small room are my only issue. BUT I still plan to stay there again next time I am in Boston because it's such a welcoming atmosphere and (with the exception of my arrival which I think must be an anomaly) it is one of the most welcoming hotels I've ever stayed in. I would say for the price it's a very good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed-Fore Warning Pets allowed!!”
Reviews.Author: vacationqueen33
Reviews.Content: For a four star hotel the Onyx really missed the mark. We arrived on Friday afternoon, we entered the hotel and the check in area was non existent. People were trying to check in/out and the entire area was congested with people and luggage. A complete mess. If they hadn't built a semi-circular sitting area in the front entrance way there would be more room for the check in/out process. We got to our room, to find we had a guest with a dog right next door to us. I have no problem with a hotel allowing pets but all the pets should be on the same floor all next to each other, so when the dogs bark they can bark continuously to each other, when they are left alone by their owners. We went to Boston for a romantic getaway we had to call the front desk twice regarding the dog barking next door. I needed a nap mid day and never got one. The room is small but we knew this from previous reviews. Four star bathroom it's not! The bathroom tub and shower needs a serious update. The hot water took forever to come on. The stopper in the shower didn't work so I had to pull it in and out with my nails and almost broke them to get it to work. The Aveda products do not make up for anything. The bed is very comfortable although I never got a full nights sleep because the entire hotel had to evacuate their rooms for a false fire alarm after midnight no less. So there we all stood outside or sat in the Ruby room in our pajamas, messy hair, and swollen eyes from no sleep. Children with their stuffed animals sleeping in their parents arms...for nothing. They couldn't even get the alarm turned off. I never got to sleep in this place. The valet service is brutal. For one thing it's $40/day. In Boston downtown with no parking you can expect to pay something. However you expect to get your car in a timely manner. Forget that make sure you call the front desk at least 20 minutes ahead of when you need it. However the Onyx is located in the center of everything, so you can walk minimum of 1 mile to everything. I exercise a lot so I didn't mind the hike to Faneuil Hall, shops, etc. Bring comfortable shoes, historic brick and stone roads everywhere. Do not eat at the Onyx. The Ruby room is nothing to write home about. I have been to many high class restaurants/clubs in Boston this does not even come close. There also is no business center, unacceptable for a 4 star rated hotel so if you don't bring your lap top you're out of luck. The computers they have only let you print your boarding passes. But when I went to print mine downstairs the printer was out of ink, so I was checked in but had no passes that I had to reprint at the airport anyhow. So as far as the Onyx goes be prepared to pay pay pay, be inconvenienced a lot and definitely leave exhausted if your room is next to someone whom brought their dog. We should have gotten a full refund for all the inconveniences and everything the 4 star Onyx didn't live up to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: irnmadn9
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Boston. Next to the Garden and <5 min walk to the North subway station. Friendly service! Nice linens, comfortable size rooms, free wine from 5-6pm in the lobby, Aveda products. Would have given this hotel an "excellent" rating but be warned of the loud banging noise if staying next to the electric room. Almost sounded like a jack hammer going off once per hour for about 3 secs. Not too sure what the noise was but became used to it. Check Priceline for GREAT deals!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Merv1955
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Onyx twice in a fortnight at each end of a tour of New England, having stayed at Kimpton hotels before. These stays were as expected, nice room and very good service from all the staff we encountered. Location is fantastic for the centre of Boston either if you want to walk or get a cab. Couldn't fault any of the services provided, very clean and well equipped and enjoyed the wine & beer hour which is a chance to chat to those who gather informally in the lobby each evening. Would certainly return when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Onyx - another Boston winner!”
Reviews.Author: Bunknown
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Onyx the night of the NBA Finals in the penthouse. We believe the Onyx, the Onyx staff and the Celtics to be winners. Onyx staff emailed us before our arrival and asked if we had any requests for our visit. I emailed them a short list, including a couple specific items. Upon our arrival, waiting in our rooms were the exact items on our list. Everyone from the parking attendant to front desk staff greeted us as old friends, even though it was our first visit to Boston. Our rooms were immaculate and with four of us in the penthouse, we each had our own bathroom. Each exceptionally clean and well stocked with quality products. Many things are within close walking distance of the Onyx, such as the subway, restaurants, shopping and of course the Garden. it doesn't get much more convenient. We were driving a slightly unusual vehicle that created a minor problem for parking, but Onyx staff managed to park it safely away for the evening without complaint and made special arrangements for our late departure the next day. Security was not a concern the night of the NBA final, as the Onyx staff had prepared a letter of procedures hotel staff would follow and hotel guests could follow for festivities after the game. We felt at ease and secure during our visit. We watched the game from our living/office area of the penthouse and enjoyed the wet bar facilities and the large TV. Did I mention we had a great nights sleep, well we did as the beds are great. We would enjoy returning and recommend a visit to the Onyx to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jerome R
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Found the hotel typical of Kimptons hotels, meaning very nice. Something I wish I knew about before I booked is that they have kayaks and bicycles for use by guests. Close to subway. Found the restaurant food alright, service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay...”
Reviews.Author: keeblapooh
Reviews.Content: This is the second Kimpton hotel I've stayed in while visiting Boston. As expected, the hotel delivers on its promises. Beautifully appointed rooms, exceptional guest and service staff, and wonderful location in terms of proximity to transportation and area attractions (Beacon Hill, TD Banknorth Garden Stadium, the Back Bay, and Faneuil Hall are all within walking distance). However, the room I stayed in was much smaller in comparison to the one at the Hotel Marlowe (the other Kimpton hotel) in Cambridge. Nonetheless, the Onyx offers the convenience of downtown Boston right outside the lobby doors.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great service”
Reviews.Author: tsc16
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in March. Usually stay at another hotel in Boston, but was prompted to stay here by a traveling companion. What a great surprise. Room was very nice, great staff, good location close to the North End. Only negative - area is a little sketchy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: BonzoGal
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Onyx for a long tourist weekend and could not have been happier with the location and the staff. Every person who worked there said hello to us and could not do enough to help us with any and all requests. The room was small but sparkling clean and had nice furnishings and comfortable beds and bedding. I always love the leopard-spotted robes at the Kimpton Hotels. The shower has good water pressure, unlike showers in most hotels. We were just two blocks from Fanueil Hall and most downtown attractions, and there was a 7-11 and a subway station right around the corner. Getting a cab there was no problem, and we were about 10 minutes from the airport. The immediate neighborhood isn't much to speak of, but has a couple of decent pubs and a nicer bar down the block. I'd recommend not walking around on Causeway at night by yourself, but other than that, I felt safe the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “You don't really get a choice”
Reviews.Author: LyndaCarter
Reviews.Content: I booked through the hotels website. They offer a choice of smoking or non-smoking. I chose smoking. At the time of check-in I was notified there is no smoking anywhere in the building. The desk told me that was a special request and that all requests were not guaranteed. I contacted Kimpton(the hotels owners), and they said the same thing-special requests are not guaranteed. I suggested they should change their website and not offer smoking as a choice because it not available. To this day, they still offer a choice of smoking and non-smoking rooms. Very misleading. Also, when I booked the room, I had to prepay for my stay.(I did that a month in advance). The day I am leaving, they put a copy of the invoice under my door and it was more than I had prepaid. (And they charged the extra to my credit card) I took the bill to the desk and they insisted I was not overcharged. I showed them my copy of the invoice that I had brought from home and they still insisted I was not overcharged even though the charges were clearly higher than what I had prepaid. Overall, the staff attitude was that they were not very concerned about making the customer happy. The young man at the desk was actually paying attention to something or someone else as I was expaining these problems.

Reviews.Title: “Multi Stays at Omni because it is aweomse”
Reviews.Author: neonvicki
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I have stayed at the Onyx twice. We went on Valentines of 2007 and were given a room and my fiance had requested roses and champagne and it was wonderfully provided. This year we went during the St. Patty's day weekend. Although the hotel was very busy as many people were coming in and out, the front desk staff was excellent. They were able to hold onto our bags until after the game when we would check into our rooms (we were very early). The area is very lively-within walking distance of many pubs and restaraunts and even Haymarket and Fennuel Hall. The north end (great italian restaurants) are not too far. Also, there is a dunkin donuts not too far, but its a little sketchy area, but if you need your fix (which we do) its available for a quick stop. We will always stay at Onyx when we go to Boston because of its proximity to great things, cleanliness, comfortability (the beds are great and comfy) and the staff is very polite. The first time we stayed we think someone played a prank on the staff (eek-it wasn't us) and asked for hangers to be delivered to their room.Well, the staff ended up at our room and was very gracious when we said it wasn't us! Oh well, that happens!! But otherwise, Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: oceanstater
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Onyx Hotel last weekend. The service at the hotel was outstanding from the front desk, concierge, bartenders, etc. Checking in, we were greeted by the friendly front desk staff. They informed us that our room was ready and we would be located on the 9th floor. Once we arrived at our room we were greeted with a glass of green m&m's (it was st. patrick's day weekend). We were also provided with a note stating that our requests for champagne flutes and newspapers were made. We were also happy to see a complimentary bottle of wine, nice touch. The rooms are not large but comfortable enough for 2 people. The mini bar was fully stocked with beverages and snacks. FYI, bring your own bottled water if you don't feel like paying $4-5 a bottle. They also provide AVEDA products shampoo, conditioner and lotion ( ladies will appreciate that) The Ruby Room restaurant/bar was a great place to unwind. Again not a huge place but suffiecient enough. We had the breakfast buffet there one morning. It was $13 p/p plus auto 18% gratuity. There were probably cheaper places for breakfast in the area, but it was snowing and we did not feel like venturing out that early. We also had the handcut russet potato chips with blue cheese (delicious) and some cocktails before dinner one night. They offer a complimentary beer/wine hour with cheese and crackers nightly. This was great and a chance to sample some different wines and talk with some interesting people staying at the hotel. It runs from 5-6 p.m. The location of the hotel is perfect if you are going to see an event at the TD Banknorth. We had Celtics tickets and were able to walk to and from with no problem. We also had dinner in the North End which was walking distance. Can't say enough good things about the Onyx and its helpful staff. We can't wait to return. If there was one negative thing to write, it would probably be about the fitness facility. It was really tiny. The equipment was pretty new but, it was just small with a couple of treadmills and some free weights. I would reccommend the Onyx for a great stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Tip Top”
Reviews.Author: Traveler267
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days in Fantastic Boston.We landed in a blizzard at Logan but were in the hotel reception within 30 mins.We received a very warm welcome from Bonny(hope I got the right name)and Michelle.The Hotel is spotless and very funky.The Bathrobes were unusual to say the least.The rooms are large by European standards.The hotel is in a great location in the North End.There are 2 very good bars right beside the Hotel.Mcganns,which shows rugby,soccer etc live and the porterhouse(name?)really nice crowd.I have never stayed in a Kimpton Hotel before,and I must admit I enjoyed my first visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mcast654
Reviews.Content: Upon check in greeted with very friendly staff. Room nicely appointed with every need. Even given an umbrella to use while staying. Small bar/restaurant area. Free wine and cheese every evening from 5pm to 6pm. Rooms a little small but very clean. One of the best hotels i have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: quietkeyIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. The staff were friendly, the room was clean and the sevice was excellant.

Reviews.Title: “Onyx is ok, but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: ASWh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Onxy for 3 nights over Superbowl weekend (go Giants!). The rooms are nice, quite spacious and well decorated, bathroom roomy and well fitted but the overall feeling in the hotel is that it's a converted office block (not least as it overlooks office buildings opposite). The reception area has a bar & restaurant (the Ruby room) which has a very low ceiling and they've tried to compensate for the squareness of the space by adding curves - which sound great but actually take away a lot of space and you feel like you're falling over people to get from the bar to a table. As with all Kimptons, it's a pet friendly hotel which is fine (and hasn't been an issue in any of the other Kimptons we've stayed in) but on Sat eve there were about 4 dogs and 3 cats in and out of the lifts and one man sat with his cats on his lap in both the reception and the bar. Would be a nightmare if you have pet allergies! The other disappointing thing was the breakfast - on Sat & Sun there's no room service until 8.30am which is late, and when we did order one hot breakfast and one cereal breakfast, we got one bowl between us (which had yoghurt in) and one set of cutlery. We managed, but it wasn't very sensible of them as they knew there were two of us in the room! I saw a previous review which said this was a good location - I wouldn't totally agree with that, it's a little out of the way (although it only takes 10 mins to get into the centre of things on foot) but is round the corner from the Bruins ice hockey stadium so gets very busy when there's a game on. A big positive for this hotel - as with a lot of Kimptons - is that the staff are very nice, and we found the Spanish receptionist (who I think was called Cecile) extremely helpful and accommodating. They also have a wine hour from 5pm which was a nice addition. All in all not bad, but not as good as we were hoping. One thing to watch for as a general point - we got ripped off by the taxi driver from the airport who took us the scenic route and charged us $35. On the way back, the hotel got a limo for us which arrived early, was very comfortable and we got to the airport in 10 mins in comparison with 30 mins on the earlier trip and it was only $25! The first taxi driver said he didn't know where the hotel was, put the address in his sat nav and then didn't ask it for the route - and we went via Fenway Park which is out of the way. Something to watch for as they don't have a set rate into town from the airport as they do in New York.

Reviews.Title: “They were the best!”
Reviews.Author: thinkinglady
Reviews.Content: We had the most interesting fourth of July visit to Boston and were treated exceptionally well by the staff at the Onyx. From the great conversations during wine hour to the generousity of the staff for some unusual requests, we were greeted with friendliness, generosity and entertainment on all fronts. Our room was clean and the special 4th of July duck was an exceptional touch. The bathroom was spotless. The staff also made some great recommendations for off-the-beaten-path restaurants and activities. We had some issues with Internet access, but they were remedied in a timely manner, and the staff even followed up after the visit. All in all, it was one of the most pleasant hotel experiences we have had in Boston. We will most likely stay in the Onyx the next time we trek up to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice Kimpton property”
Reviews.Author: jmackq
Reviews.Content: Just returned 3 nights at The Onyx which included New Years Eve. First Night in Boston is a lot of fun. Great service, clean, very dog friendly, walking distance to Freedom Trail and great North End Italian restaurants and cafes, close to the TD Banknorth aka new Boston Garden and North Station T stop, immediate neighborhood much improved since completion of Big Dig and new Garden. Nice Kimpton touches like the evening wine/beer tasting with cheese and crackers. Knowledgable staff re restaurants etc. Had a delay in fetching car from parking garage at departure, but they volunteered to refund that day parking charge which you should know is a bit steep at $38/day, but thats not too unusual for city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: veek61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Onyx for two nights right before Christmas with our two teens (14 and 15). Since we were just passing through, we only rented a single room for the 4 of us (two double beds). The room was average-sized for a city hotel room (spacious by European standards). The beds were very comfortable - there was also a desk and sitting chair in the room, and a decent sized tv. We did not have wireless internet in the room. There was also a mini-bar/snack drawer. The room was perfectly clean. The closet was weird enough to bear mentioning. It had an ironing board mounted in it and at least once the ironing board attacked us as we opened the closet door. It was odd because between the ironing board and the safe, there was almost nowhere to hang your clothes. This did not matter to us but it would matter to a business traveler I suspect. The bathroom was quite spacious - a single room with commode, double sinks, and shower. There was no tub, just a walk-in shower. The shower had no door (just a curtain), its floor was just slightly slanted down and away from the bathroom floor so water drained naturally - but we still had a hard time keeping the water in the shower and so had a perpetual puddle on the tile outside the shower. Nothing a towel couldn't soak up. The main thing to note about the bathroom (besides the snappy leopard print chenille bathrobes, available for purchase) was that the floor was freezing. I mean c-o-l-d. Uncomfortably so. Bring slippers! We asked housekeeping for extra towels which she doled out generously so we had a little towel path running through the bathroom. We went to the Ruby Room for breakfast on the first morning. It was $12 for only a moderately decent buffet. Only my daughter indulged and her review is: "meh". I had a cup of tea for $3. Right across the street from the hotel is an Au Bon Pain so the rest of us got our breakfast goodies there - but beware, for some reason that Au Bon Pain is only open Monday-Friday so when we walked over the second morning (Saturday) we were SOL. There is a complimentary wine hour in the Ruby Room late afternoons but we did not partake. Apparently dinner is served in the evenings but we were never there to check it out. The hotel location is awesome. You are right down the street from the Garden (Fleet Center or whatever it is called these days) if you are there for a Celts or Bruins game you are in good shape. You are also easy walking distance to the North Station T stop. You can easily walk (4 blocks) to Fanueil Hall, Quincy Market - heck you're even closer to the North End where there is GREAT italian food (we ate at G'Vanni's and LOVED it). There had just been a snowstorm the day before we arrived and we're still calling these easy walks. There are lots of cool bars and restaurants within a block of the hotel. We had a few pints at a pub just two doors down from the hotel - I can't remember the name! - but it had a nice atmosphere and good beer on tap and very friendly bartenders. Also, around the corner is a bar called The Fours on Canal Street (greatest sports bar for Boston fans - [--]) where we had lots of fun, good beer, good service, and all those friendly fans. We also grabbed some good old fashioned Boston pizza at Half-Time (also around the corner from the hotel). All in all, we would definitely recommend the Onyx. We got the room through Hotwire and so the rate was decent considering the location and style of hotel ("boutique"). The staff at the hotel could not have been nicer. We fell in love with Boston all over again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good night's rest at the Onyx”
Reviews.Author: CristinaNYC
Reviews.Content: I went on a business trip to Boston and my employer forgot to book a room until I was on the bus up there! I had a penthouse room and the staff guessed my name since I arrived super late. The bathroom was very spacious and clean, and the room overall was spacious. The bed looked like a sofa bed and I was not to happy looking at it but I got WONDERFUL sleep on it. Definitely too much money for the room that night since I only stayed a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Rooms, and Service”
Reviews.Author: derekgorman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Britney Spears Foundation Room which is a speciality suite that they have there (which will soon be closing) and the room was superb. This is a 5 star quality boutique hotel. The rooms were perfect and the bathrooms were as well. I cannot fault the room. Checkin staff were very very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was superb. Service again was superb. The location of the hotel is perfect, very near the subway and not too far from the freedom trail and right next to the basketball venue.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: sparkling_xena
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I went to Boston from Nov 22-24, 2007. We had never been to Boston, and I booked this hotel because it looked like something different than your typical franchise hotels, I thought it would make our trip special, and memorable. We booked our room through the hotel, and we had a king bed room, their most simple room. We were planning on doing a lot of sightseeing, and thus not spending a lot of time in our room, so we didn't see a point in getting a fancier room. Before our trip we had some plans of what we wanted to do, but I still wanted to talk to someone to get an idea of the best tourist attractions to see in Boston. I decided to call the hotel concierge to get his opinions. I was so delighted to talk to him, he was very patient, gave us a lot of great tips, and spent about half an hour with me on the phone. He even informed me that we could book Boston Trolley Tour Tickets at the hotel, which we did. Upon arriving at the Onyx we were greeted by the valet, it costs $38 per night to park at the hotel, and it takes 25-30 mins to get our car out of the garage. The valet helped us with our luggage, and we were checked into our room in about 2 minutes. My first impressions were good, the hotel was clean, trendy looking, and had a nice vibe, however, the lobby is very small, so if we were to have checked in during a busy time we would have been quite cramped in the lobby. When we entered our room, it was reminiscent of the lobby. Decorated in red, black and white colors, and had a very trendy vibe. I liked the decor very much, it was very different. The room was very small, my husband was not happy about that, but I found the room to be very cosy. The minibar was great, and they had a lot of great items in there. We were also very easily able to log into the hotel internet, that was a big help for us, and we were very pleased to have it. The room was very clean, and the bed was super comfortable, although I did wish that we had an extra blanket. The TV worked well, and had all the typical channels. The bathroom was also very nice, and they had Aveda products in there. The shower was ok, the water pressure could have been better, and it wasn't very clean, that really bothered me. Otherwise there were plenty of towels and the fun robes were great! One other downside about the hotel was that we could hear a lot of noises within the hotel. Our room was near the elevators, and we could hear them open, we could hear people walking in the halls, and we could hear people in adjacent rooms. On the whole we liked staying at this hotel, we loved the location, its close to everything. In addition, the staff was wonderful, they will bend over backwards to makesure you're happy. The service is quick, and friendly. Actually, we wanted to go see the Blue Man Group, and the front desk clerk tried to help us get tickets, and I also got cold, one night, so I ordered another blanket, it was in our room in 10 minutes. A side tip, we ate breakfast in the Ruby Room, it was $13 per person, and they added 18% gratuity, and I thought that was a lot considering there wasn't really a waiter who waited on us, its a [--] buffet. We ended up spending over $30 for our breakfast, which I thought was a total rip off, they had the cheap run-of-the-mill scrabbled eggs, cold hash browns, and then everything else was continetal. I was not impressed. We did not eat there again. I would highly recommend eating at a diner, or even Burger King around the corner. Also, there were a few homeless people around, and that was good, and the hotel is a bit off the main roads. I would stay there again, but if I were going back to Boston I would probably try something new, just to see what else was out there.

Reviews.Title: “Omni is OK”
Reviews.Author: Degas
Reviews.Content: Lets face it improving my mood when arriving in Boston in Nov in the pouring rain would challenge even the best hotels. However the Onyx managed to do it. My room overlooked the street - but was quiet - not sure if thats good insulation or lack of noise. The decor was very lush - dark rich colours - with surprizing accents of animal skin prints . I was so amazed at the leopard skin printed towelling robe that I had to take a photo of it! Really made me smile ( and wonder at who chose these....) The hotel is popped into a side street near the river - its convenient both form the metro and for walking. Liking a cool bedroom was impressed that I could adjust the AC down - even though we are officially in 'winter mode'. The staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel provides free wireless internet, that works with no hassles, and a well lit work desk. It suited me and I would be happy to investigate other hotels in this chain (Kimpton).

Reviews.Title: “Good boutique hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: EssexMichael
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to Fanueil Hall, a great eating place and central to the Freedom Trail. It has a very small lobby (which hosts a free wine hour every day) but staff are welcoming. The neighbourhood is quite quiet and dark but only two blocks before you are on the main roads and close to the Civic Centre. There you can catch the subway or one of the tourist tours. Plenty of places to eat and drink! Rooms were very well equiped, and very modern, including leopardskin print bathrobes! Spacious bathrooms. Easy to get to from the airport with a taxi costing around $17.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Onyx”
Reviews.Author: orlakay
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a three night stay at the Onyx Hotel, Boston. The staff here were fantastic. They were helpful and friendly and seemed to really enjoy their jobs! We got a great rate of 550 euros, room only, for 2 people. Our room was mediocre, being quite small and the view of a brick wall from our window was less than endearing! The decor is great, red and black being the main colour theme. If you like art deco style, you'll love this. The rooms and bathrooms were immaculately clean. The only drawback of this hotel is location. It is a good 20 minute walk to Downtown Crossing and the neighborhood at night is less than savoury, with alot of undesirables wandering the streets. There are very few places in the location to eat, with many of the local bars closed down. There is a 7/11 on the corner of Portland St., but again we avoided it at night. All in all, the staff made the stay extremely enjoyable, and took away from the disappointing location and lack of amenities in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay on 2nd floor the room next to the main extractor fans”
Reviews.Author: London_LLady
Reviews.Content: It would have been a perfect hotel but for a few very big issues. I stayed on the 2nd floor a room right next to the main extractor fans - had to put up with a constant load hum what made this worse is that I had an early flight so it was like being on the plane but lying down. Shower not hot water - so was up all nite then having to face a freezing cold shower. It's a shame cause the hotel seemed very grand but they just didn't get the fundamentals right. Yes I did try to change rooms but hotel fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “The Onyx is Top Drawer Accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: Regular-NYC-Visitor
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault this place at all! Staff: switched-on, genuinely helpful and polite (couldn't do enough for us). Hotel room: spotlessly clean, massive choice of in-house films on demand, splendidly equipped mini-bar, good room-service menu and - uncommonly for most US hotels - a large, well equipped bathroom (New York take note!) with a range of shower settings which gave you, variously, a happy medium between a rabbit-punch and a Thai Massage. There's a great Irish (as opposed to the usual 'Oirish') Pub just down the street and you're in 10 mins walking distance from the a range of top restaurants, town centre and the waterfront. Would we go back? Absolutely - and look forward to it. Now that 'The Big Dig' is finished, Boston itself looks glorious and is a real walker-friendly town with plenty to do and see, even for the most jaded/hard-to-impress traveller. The staff here genuinely care about your experience at their hotel and go out of their way to ensure that your time here is hassle-free.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky little hotel you've probably never heard of”
Reviews.Author: jkb1516
Reviews.Content: This hotel reminded me of a small upscale European hotel; part of Kimpton Hotels. Very trendy decor. Very courteous, friendly staff. Complimentary wine in evenings & a small restaurant/bar serving breakfast & dinner.
