Ate dinner here once ... there are a lot of other options in the neighborhood to limit to this restaurant if you're in town for more than a night. This hotel is not in the mainstream flow of traffic (car or pedestrian) and if you take a cab from the airport they may not know where it is. It is, however, close (walkable) to the T (Haymarket, Orange line), Quincy Market, North End & the Arena (don't know what they're calling it these days) where the Celtics play.

Reviews.Title: “So far my least favorite Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt89
Reviews.Content: This review is a bit unfair, I will be honest. I actually had a nice 5 night stay and found the staff to be very friendly. I can not put my finger on it but I left the hotel feeling a bit "cold" about the experience. If you are staying in Boston longer than 2 nights, I would automatically pick another hotel on this basis alone. It simply is too small of a hotel. The boutique definition is taken to an extreme here. I did find the staff to be friendly. I like to have an area in a hotel where you can go a sit, somewhere other than your room. This is a very limited option in the hotel. They have a smaill restaurant and bar and small gym and that is it. You really do get a cramped feeling here. My other pet peeve was the Front Desk was also where guests went to ask for directions, reservations, etc. The efficiency of the hotel would be greatly enhanced by moving the concierge position elsewhere. I waited in long lines to check out and check in when this could easily have been streamlined. The guest rooms are nice but again very smail. Location is in an interesting area near some of the tourist sites and the fantastic Italian restaurants in Boston. My overall feeling is try another hotel. A bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Bucajack
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotell with my girlfriend in July as we were attending the John Mayer concert in the TD Banknorth Garden. The reason i chose the hotel was mainly its close proximity to the TD Banknorth Garden (Its only 500 meters away). We arrived at around 12:00pm and were greeted by a very pleasant valet parking attendant. Checked in with no problems at all. The girl at the desk was very helpful. We didnt eat in the hotel but there is a great irish bar accross the road called The Harp which we did eat in. I would recommend it especially if ther is an event on in the garden as the atmosphere was great. The rooms are decorated very nicely with a nice mdern feel. We stayed in a King room which was a little on the small side but lets face it you only want a place to put your head down at night! Would definitely recommend a stay. PS I read a review here that said the hotel was down an alley. This is not true!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive, Well Located”
Reviews.Author: daisymae112
Reviews.Content: We just returned from five nights at the Onyx Hotel and found it delightful. While the room was small, it was more than adequate for two. This was our third Kimpton experience -- San Francisco, Portland and now Boston. Unlike the first two, the Onyx lacked a sizable lobby "family room" though the hotel staff insisted the Ruby bar could be used. We couldn't have found a better-located hotel with Quincy Market, the subway and waterfront easily within walking distance. Our favorite restaurant was the Boston Beer Works on Canal Street two blocks away. Awesome suds, including a watermelon beer. If there were any negatives it would be these two: First, the lobby was absolutely frigid. Second, we were shocked by a $12 phone charge for a long-distance call which was not completed. Read the fine print before placing a call.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, But Beware”
Reviews.Author: moongirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three day stay at the Onyx Hotel in downtown Boston. We booked this stay on Priceline and upon arrival were given a corner, very small room. I was getting claustrophic and called the desk, the next day they kindly switched our room and I was relieved. The staff was extremely accomodating, recommending restaurants, attractions and very very courteous. The location was also great as it was near the subway and the North End which has the best Italian restaurants in Boston. The hotel is truly a downtown place, with a very small lobby but all in all OK. However, upon returning home, I noticed on my credit card which I viewed online that they had charged $300 to my card. I called and they said they do that automatically as a security measure in case you used the minibar or if things were missing from the room! Well, thank you, but how about telling us! We have never stayed at a hotel that did this. Yes, we received a bill upon check out with the fee for using the valet parking, but another $300 for security??? Was it because we used Priceline? Anyhow they said they have released the money and it will come up as a credit on our card with 48 hours? Has anyone ever heard of such a policy? Is this something new? Too bad, we had a great time in a great town, and the staff at Onyx are terrific, at every level.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: berniss
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised at the extraordinarily friendly and efficient service. We were almost bowled over by the warmth. It was our anniversary and we were offered a choice of any room (all are rather small, but very nicely appointed), and given a bottle of wine. Sightseeing and dinner recommendations were taken seriously and were very efficient. The bed was comfortable. We did not find the room noisy as others have reported and the water temperature was fine. Each evening between 5-6, there is a wine and cheese hour, which is a nice touch. We also received a cute rubber duck. Toiletries are Aveda. Just a touch left it from being a top star,e.g., no turn down service, the wine and cheese hour offered no non-alcholic beverage... It wasn't terribly expensive..under $200, but the parking was $36 per night! A nice touch is the pet friendly atmosphere. They will walk and babysit your dog for free. Breakfast is $13, $2.75 for tea or coffee or a pastry and coffee are $7. Breakfast for $13 is a bit expensive. An Au Bon Pain is across the street. You are about 10-15 minutes walking distance from Fanuil Hall and close to the North End. It is off the main drag, but not a bad location.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff, just avoid the "penthouse suite"”
Reviews.Author: KGandSC
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is ok--the decor needs a little freshening, but the rooms are very quiet and the staff are nice. The problem was that we prepaid for a king room in the hotel for two nights. We realized on the night that we were supposed to check in that we would be late, and we called early in the evening to let them know that we were still coming. When we finally arrived at midnight we were told that the only room available was the "penthouse suite" that had only a pullout full-size sofa bed (see photo). The night staff bent over backwards trying to make amends, but it was still a very uncomfortable night. When we checked out, the hotel manager told us that "Expedia just guarantees a room", not the type of room, and that there was nothing they could have done about it. We were really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A glorified Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: fogeo1977
Reviews.Content: I have no idea what people are saying when they give this hotel a 5. The staff is fantastic. So sweet and they work so hard. Everything else associated with this hotel is your run of the mill Howard Johnson or Holiday Inn. First of all, the shower was COLD. When I called to ask them about it, they replied "if you would turn on the sink faucet while running the shower, you'll get hot water". OK, well it worked - but what kind of hotel makes you do that to simply get a hot shower. The hairdryer in the bathroom was broken, the walls are paper thin and I heard doors shutting and opening all night. Very annoying. The rooms are SUPER small too. I know small because I live in New York, but this is ridiculous. Look, I love staying at hotels but don't love spending alot of money. I like cute boutiquey hotels. And I am not a very picky person. This is fine to stay at. But do not think you're going to stay at a trendy upscale hotel. It's a clean Holiday Inn and worth no more than $150-175 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very friendly but need more training”
Reviews.Author: SBeg
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay in early June 2007 for business travel. My overall impression is staff is very friendly, however they need more training, because nice doesn't get the job done. My 1st night I order room service, food was not that great. 2nd night gave it another try - after 40 minutes I called the front desk - the man at desk said, oh, your food is on it's way up. Another 10 minutes later woman at front desk cld to tell me my food order had never gone in, they were very sorry, and it would be up in about 15 minutes and the dinner would be on the house. When my meal came, the server handed me the bill with the charges. I told him it was to be comped, he said no problem. The next morning the charges - even though I did not sign any room service bill - were on my checkout statement. I called down to have a credit and new statement issued which they gave me as I left. Each time I had to call, front desk was very polite, however the follow through on real service did not occur. Rooms were fine, place is very close the Garden. Neighborhood just ok, don't know if I would wander too far at night here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: traveljh
Reviews.Content: This was our first 'fun' trip to Boston...what a blast! The Onyx was conveniently located and all of the attractions were in walking distance. The hotel staff was friendly and attentive. They went out of their way to make the stay enjoyable. The hotel was very clean and the cleaning service was amazing...our room was spotless when we returned each day. Nice wine reception...complementary with cheese and crackers each evening. Breakfast buffet available for charge. Rooms are not large but very 'hip' and the bed was FABULOUS!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: BriKell
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights on Memorial Day weekend 2007 in a King Deluxe. The great thing about the Onyx is that is a new, off-the-beaten path hotel with a modern, trendy feel to it. It is not a mammoth hotel (I think there are only 11 floors). It is perfect if you want a short walk to North End (Little Italy), the Waterfront, and to Fanueil Hall/ Quincy market, as well as Gov't Center, the Boston Common and Beacon Hill. The hotel itself is looks brand new with a modern lobby, etc. We previously stayed at a Klimpton in Scottsdale AZ, which had a similar well-appointed touch. The room we stayed in, on the 9th Floor in a King Deluxe, was modernly furnished, very new, and clean. The front desk and attendants were very helpful, friendly, and went out of their way to convey a friendly attitude. Two other small items worth mentioning demonstrating the good nature of this hotel: First, upon arrival, the hotel was just ending its complimentary wine hour. After telling us that we had "just missed it", one of the hotel attendants later hand delivered a complimentary bottle of pinot grigio to our room. Second, after check out and on our trip home, we realized that we had inadvertently left our (expensive) memory-foam pillow in the room. We called the hotel, and it turned out that their housecleaning staff put it aside for us, and the hotel offered to ship the pillow to us promptly at no charge. No regrets, except the $38 daily valet charge I thought was a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: We booked the Onyx hotel because of the location. It was close to the TD Banknorth Center and the T. It was just perfect to get around the city quickly. The staff was very friendly and knowledable about surounding events and places. The room was small, but comfortable and quiet and peaceful. They had our room ready at 10am day of check in!! The beds are to die for!! There are 3 little pubs/bars on the same street that was very convenient and nice, and also a 7/11 on the corner for any general/food needs with prices that were very reasonable...for Boston. Room service and the restaurant is a bit expensive. I would recommend actually going somewhere "special" if you are going to pay that kind of money. All in all i was very satisfied with the hotel. Just keep in mind that the rooms are a bit smaller, and the decor is a bit different.

Reviews.Title: “would go back”
Reviews.Author: anectine
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Onyx hotel. We loved our stay, confortable bed, nice view, great service and friendly staff and valet service. Close to Hanovre street where are all the nice italian restaurants and cafes. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Onyx”
Reviews.Author: Misha76
Reviews.Content: The Onyx hotel is a great place to stay in Boston. The hotel is a boutique style hotel like most Kimpton properties but what really made the difference was the staff. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. The rooms are a little smaller than I'm used to but they are nice. The view I had from my room wasn't so great though. Overall the hotel was very pleasant. I highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “If they priced rooms by the square foot this would be no bargain”
Reviews.Author: pls1271
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I chose to stay in a "boutique" hotel in Boston. We got what was supposed to be a great rate ($180) plus taxes and parking and ended up paying at over $240. The room was the smallest I have ever stayed in, and I have been traveling for 30 years. If you have read any other reviews on this site you will find reference to the maddening humming noise that actually made our room vibrate. The staff was over-friendly and the one hotel bar was closed for a private function. Complaints at checkout about the room size and noise were just ignored. Unless you are in town for a sporting event at the Fleet center you can do far better at hotels closer to Faniuel Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms-close to airport”
Reviews.Author: lgcoto
Reviews.Content: This was an okay hotel. I found the rooms to be very small and bathroom was tiny. It was very 'boutique' type hotel.More modern than I like. Lots and Lots of RED. I wouldn't think it would go over well with a hangover. I had an early flight out of the country so it wasn't an issue....The beds were comfortable, not ultra wonderful. I think I would probably like to stay somewhere else next time. I can't say I was so thrilled that i would go back. It was nice. Just nothing too special.

Reviews.Title: “7 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: vaughn4242
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Onyx overnight. If you are not familiar with Downtown Boston, you will have trouble with finding this Hotel. Upon arrival, the staff was very friendly. The room was an average size with a above average bathroom and a very comfortable bed. Overall, the Hotel is nice; however, if you stay on the weekend, and are a early riser like myself, find somewhere else to get coffee or have breakfast. Breakfast doesnâ€™t begin until 8:30 on the weekends. It looked ok at best.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: tomwhey
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel itself appeared quite nice to begin with, we were met with problem after problem throughout our entire stay. Here were just some of the problems: - There was an obvious sewage problem in the hotel causing a horrible smell of waste in our room in the evenings. We would come back to the room after being out and our entire room was overwhelmed by the smell. - The bar staff were horrible. We went to the bar for a pint most nights and faced the same problem each night. The woman serving us was slow and most days, I believe, forgot that she was actually working. We would request our drinks and then just wait. On one night in particular, we asked for our bill three times over the course of an hour! Another night, there was a dj that set up in the bar (that just happened to be in the middle of the lobby) and they blasted music until the middle of the morning - It bothered us and we're 22!! - The staff were consistently rude. I would defintiely not recommend this hotel. It has mistakenly been given a 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Dque
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while visiting family in the states. We thought it was very reasonably priced and the room was a good size. The only negative was the area, but I guess that's why the rates weren't too bad. We thought the staff were exceptional, nothing was too much trouble. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Smart choice”
Reviews.Author: travell_chic
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the onyx hotel several times, and each time seems better then the last. it is a fabulous hotel with staff to match. overhearing me and my friends were staying on behalf of a birthday, mr. howlzworth sent an adorable card accompanied with a bottle of wine to our room. he was also increadibly helpful with recomondations on resteraunts, local attractions and nightlife. other than the staff the onyx is hip, clean and has a convienient location. based on my stays here i would recomend the hotel anytime, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Onyx”
Reviews.Author: david_k001
Reviews.Content: Booked Onxy based on reviews and price. It's definitely a good value for the money: free wifi, coffee in the AM, newspaper, free wine in the lobby after work. Room was clean, a little on the small side, but definitely comfortable. Friendly staff, located close to public transport. It's kind of on the outskirts of town in my opinion, but a quick walk, taxi ride or train ride to anyplace in Boston. It's contemporary in design, but a little more vibrant than I like. I guess I'm more of a minimalist. As for the bathrooms, they were actually kind of bland when it comes to style. The important thing, however, is that eerything was pretty clean. I'm nuts when it comes to cleanliness, and with the exception of a small stain on the carpet in my room, it passed the cleanliness test. I'd definitely stay there again, unless I come into a windfall and can afford to stay at XV Beacon.

Reviews.Title: “Good & Bad - watch the rooms though”
Reviews.Author: NSmith1985
Reviews.Content: Stayed he with friends so we had three rooms in all on adjacent floors. Room 201 which I was in should be avoided at all costs. Nothing wrong with the room and comfortable beds, except it looks straight out onto an extractor vent. Worse than that the vent is humming day and night, especially early morning. Thought we would get used to it, but after the three nights of our stay I was please to leave. Rest of the hotel was very pleasant, very polite front desk staff. Bar pretty poor with slow service even when not busy. Seems to also have a general shortage of glasses and cup for the bar and breakfast in the morning. Overall not bad, but the noise outside our room and the other 2 rooms above 301 and 401 ruined what was otherwise an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Allen W
Reviews.Content: overpriced. Not as good as other boutique type hotels. Limited space. Limited hanging space. Limited hot water. More like 3 star instead of 5 star. would not stay again

Reviews.Title: “Room Noise”
Reviews.Author: offtoeurope
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day trip of Boston, and surrounding areas. We booked the Onyx Hotel through Priceline, so we got a reasonable rate of $150.00 per night for a deluxe king (what does that mean?). We got in late as we took the â€œTâ€� from the airport and then walked with our luggage to the hotel. Itâ€™s not too far, but the area has some construction going on, and it is a little dark in that part of town. So only venture out if you feel safe. The staff greeted us and was friendly. We took our own luggage to the room, and were not offered assistance. We stayed in room #402. Please beware; the room is nicely appointed, but very small with a view of the next wing of the hotel. The major issue was the noise. We had to listen to a constant, humming and chugging noise, all day and night, and also a rushing water sound. When we commented to the front desk, they acted surprised. I am sure we were given this noisy room because of the booking through Priceline. Please DO NOT use the concierge for any assistance with restaurants and bars. We asked her for an upscale bar, with 30-40 year olds, for a pre-dinner cocktail. We told her we were dining at the Federalist (a top-rated restaurant) and wanted something nearby, in walking distance. She sent us to Emmettâ€™s. Oh my goodness, it was a pub. Had we been in our jeans and Red Sox sweatshirts and wanted beer, we would have fit right in. Needless to say it didnâ€™t fit the bill. Boston is a fun town, just do your research in advance, and donâ€™t leave anything up to inexperienced concierges.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: cubanito1
Reviews.Content: You are right next to the fleet center or whatever they call it now. Shopping and bars. If youre planning on seeing a show there, its a no brainer to stay. Its part of the Kimpton hotel chain, which is very trendy and hip. I stayed for 2 nights and had a blast! The rooms are really funky with decorations, and the bed was oh my God comfortable! I felt like I was sleeping on a giant cupcake! The rooms are a bit tight, but who cares it worth it due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler21
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Boston (alone) to visit a friend. I wanted to stay at a hotel near central downtown that i could walk to Quincy Market and Fanueil Hall and also feel safe (i'm a lady). My sister reccomended a Kimpton chain hotel. The Onyx hotel was fabulous. The front desk was very friendly, attentive and helpful. I made several requests at the time of my reservation (high floor, not near elevator, mini bar/fridge cleared out, vanity mirror etc). All of which were taken care before I got there. (The reason I cleaned out the mini bar fridge was so i could store my own bottled water and food in the fridge.) Kimpton hotels are great because they are very chic and modern. Feather duvets, robes and slippers in room for your use etc. The only down side was they only offer 2 double beds vs. 2 queen size beds. But everything else was great. They also have a free computer with internet for your use in the basement next to the mini gym/workout room. This was perfect so I could login and print my boarding pass. They also have a free happy hour in the lounge downstairs. The location was fabulous literally across the street from the Fleet Center and walking distance to Fanueil Hall and Quincy Market. Plus there's a T stop right around the corner. I would reccomend this place for honeymooners, families, college kids/high school kids, anyone!!! Boston is an expensive hotel city, similar to NYC if you want to stay in downtown. I paid $188 per night plus tax and it was worth every penny! I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “rooms too”
Reviews.Author: seamtress
Reviews.Content: The customer service was fine, the room was clean and nicely decorated but compared to the website virtual tour the room was very very small and had little room for clothing. The tour is definently misleading. Also do not charge $5.00 for a bottle of water, just supply it and add it to the room fee. The wine hour was pitiful, with cheap wine and meager snacks. Other hotels have had very nice wine hours with cheese trays, sweets etc. and palatable. Also make sure the coffe cups in the room are in place. Also the breakfast was ridiculous for that price. People do not mind paying for a breakfast but the "lounge area "is not the place and the selection was poor. Michael at the front desk was very polite and helpful, he was personable and gracious. Perhaps a shuttle from the airport could be included as we were shuttled to the airport. Add these little amenities to the price of the room. We would pay for all of it. The more you can make your customers think these things are included in the price the more credibility you give to your hotel. We did love Boston and the beds were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Mojotokin
Reviews.Content: I don't write too many reviews but this hotel deserved it! It was a fantastic place to stay. I have stayed in hundreds of hotels and the staff in this hotel is probably the best I have ever experienced. They were so friendly and helpful. I wish I remember their names so I could thank them personally. Our room was very nice. Different colors/themes were a refreshing change. Looked just like the website. Nothing dramatic- just subtle changes. We had a king room. I asked for a high floor away from the elevator and I could not have been higher or further away. Talk about taking someones request to heart. The room was a bit small but with just 2 of us, no complaints. Great Bathroom (good size) and everything was very clean and functioned without a problem. At 5:00pm that night they had a free wine tasting that my husband enjoyed. Pet Friendly so we saw a couple cute dogs, didn't hear a single one or smell any kind of pet smell. Adorable little welcome bowls for em with bones and kibble...too cute. We also had an early check-in with no problem. Beautiful lounge/sm. restaurant in lobby, very stylish, very expensive. They have a beautiful breakfast set out in the morning, but everything has a charge...so be careful. It is not a complimentary buffet. Tons of things to do..we went during the North End Italian Festival - about 10 min. walk. Faneul Hall/Quincy Market - 5 minutes. Great Location, not on top of a million bars so doesn't get crazy loud. Although we were on the top floor so I cant say for those lower. Anyway, can't say enough about this place and how great our stay was. Drawback-parking (but u will find that everywhere in Boston) We paid 35.00 (charged to our room) and just had the valet take care of it. Never saw our car again til we left. Again-this place is grea and I don't think you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Super Duper Luxury”
Reviews.Author: yankeefan94
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a Red Sox game and were we pleased with this hotel. None of the fanfare of a Hyatt or Marriott just great service and luxurious accomodations. The front desk treats you as if you are their main priority and they are a wealth of information about things to do in Boston. The hotel is close to everything including a T stop that will take you everywhere. This hotel is exceptional and I will only stay at Kimpton Hotels in the future when given the option. This is a no brainer...make this your first choice!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: queendomcome
Reviews.Content: The place is a jewel of a fine. Especially the complimentary wine hr in the lobby every night. Its really cool. There are a number of eateries and bars just around the corner. It seems many reviewers did not find them, but thier there. Little Italy is a short 6/7 min. walk away. Fanuiel Hall/Quincy Market is 5 min. walk away Onyx is a boutique hotel with a funky red lounge. Very sexy, and cozy. Its in the North End area just around the corner from the Fleet Center, now named something else - TD Waterhouse something. The area is unobtrusive and away from the many tourist crowds which I happen to like a lot. The staff is a young, friendly, attentive bunch. The rooms are small but nicely decorated as the other reviews state. My only complaint would be more counter space in the bathroom. Loved it and i would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “cool hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bosox06
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel, staff wonderful, room cozy. great lounge area. would recommend. only downside is you need to walk through a bit of a seedy section of town to get to the main popular spots.

Reviews.Title: “A1 Service”
Reviews.Author: gary1580
Reviews.Content: got a great deal for this hotel on [---] for $125 and it was worth every penny. their service is exceptional. upon check-in, they make you feel very comfortable and everytime you come and go they agknowledge you. it is a small boutique hotel with a really cute lobby bar that has free wine hour from 5pm-6pm... the rooms are a bit small but are decorated very modernly with checkered carpeting. the location was great. only 1 1/2 blocks from the North Station subway stop. I would of rather stayed in the Copley area or near Downtown Crossing but i really did not mind the subway. It was actually pretty fun! i would definantely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: nunu102
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for a mini college reunion, the staff were soooo nice. One of the three rooms we booked wasnt ready at 4pm when we checked in so they took off $100 the rate per room, and even threw in a free drink at the bar while we waited. The beds were super cushy with down comforters. The room size was average for a big city, but the bathroom was big I thought. Also we could walk to almost anything, North End, Fanueil Hall. Had an awesome breakfast at Kinsale an Irish restaurant nearby as well. Would definately stay here again next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Markus47
Reviews.Content: What a treat to move from the Westin Waterfront to the 2/3 as expensive, hipper, better located Onyx with my family (2 preschool kids). I'm typing this from the hotel's lobby using the free wifi. Sure, there's no pool and the rooms are small (although with a family of four we were put in an end handicapped-access room and had plenty of space). The room was clean and well kept (especially considering the pet-friendly policy), and we liked the leopard-print terry robes. The staff is very friendly and personable, and if you bring your dog (we didn't) they make up a sign with a personal greeting for the pooch. Kimpton hotels seem to be the Virgin Airways of hotels - hip, fun, aggressively priced and they don't try to assess a charge every time you turn around. I have a free copy of the sunday New York Times sitting next to me. Breakfast yesterday was great. Last night the "Ruby Room" adjacent to the lobby became a nightclub with a DJ, and it's situated at the end of a miles-long nightclub crawl you could do through Boston on a weekend night. The Onyx rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: callowaygirl22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Onyx for a weekend in July. The location was perfect for us - it's within walking distance of the North Station, the North End and the Quincy Market area. The hotel was beautiful, but small, hence the name "boutique hotel"! If you plan on living in the room all day and night, that might bother you but if you want a nice place to stay at an affordable rate, this is it. The room was absolutely beautiful - and immaculate, which is very important to us. Down comforters, feather pillows, bathrobes, the Aveda bath products, we were totally pampered all weekend. The wine hour was an especially nice touch. After walking around the entire city of Boston each day, it was nice to have a glass of wine waiting for us when we returned to the hotel. Most of the staff was friendly and pleasant, but there were usually several women who worked at the front desk who were less than pleasant.... All in all, we will definitely be back there!

Reviews.Title: “Super-Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two nights in 11th floor (PH) king prior to attending July 2 wedding in Maine. Hotel is gorgeous. Staff are most helpful and friendly we've ever experienced in a hotel anywhere. They take care of any- and every-thing for you with great enthusiasm. Four-star food can be had within walking distance at Mare in North End, which Onyx recommended and arranged. On our own we dined at Dante in Cambridge, Royal Sonesta Hotel, outstanding. The staff at the Onyx would bathe and feed you if you wanted it. Exceptional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: allenak5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Onyx for 3 nights, and was really impressed by the extraordinary service from the staff. They were friendly and professional, and went above and beyond at every opportunity. We travelled with our small dog, and love to stay at Kimpton Hotels when we bring him along. Not only do they put out a welcome dish of treats for your pet, but they will walk your dog (at no charge!) at prearranged times. This service costs at least $15/visit at home. They took wonderful care of our dog, left little notes about his behavior on the walk, etc. I was really impressed by the level of attention we were given, especially given that this is not an expensive hotel. The service here far surpasses service I have received at high end chains like the Ritz and the Four Seasons. This hotel offers nice little touches that a big chain doesn't, like a welcome note and box of cookies at check-in. The decor is funky and the rooms extremely comfortable. Some reviews said the rooms were small, but I didn't find this to be a problem--the rooms were really about the same size you'd find in any big city hotel. The only drawback to the Onyx is the location--near North Station. There are a lot of homeless people around, and the area is a drab, business area that's pretty dead on the weekends. However, it's about 1.5 blocks from an orange and green T-stop, which takes you to Back Bay, the South End, Fenway, etc. in about 15 minutes. Or, it is easily walkable to the North End or the historical sights, like Quincy Market.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a shot”
Reviews.Author: Peter H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Onyx June 1st for a business meeting the next day in the downtown area. The hotel is tucked away on a smaller one way street. The surrounding area was probably one of the only disappoints with this hotel. The area wasnâ€™t lively at night at all, and had few choices other than the hotel for dining. Not an ideal to take a casual stroll either I found. What the location lacked, the staff made up for. Small touches put a smile on my face such as a pre-shipped UPS package already placed in my hotel room before check-in. Top that off with a handwritten personalized greeting note placed on the roomâ€™s desk was really a prime example of the touches youâ€™ll find from a boutique hotel versus a mega-chain hotelier. The room was small, but average to what youâ€™d find in a NYC hotel. Ultra modern room with touches in white, black, gray and red rounded out the room.

Reviews.Title: “Onyx Hotel is a gem near North Station and Faneuil Hall”
Reviews.Author: amamba
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Onyx Hotel with my fiance for his birthday. We live in the Boston suburbs and we wanted to go out for a night on the town with our friends who still live in the city. We arrived mid afternoon after taking the commuter rail into North Station. The hotel is located just a few blocks from the train station. As I am a kimpton in touch member (their frequent stay program) we received a hand written welcome note and a can of rockstar energy drink for free in the room. This was a nice touch and really set the tone for our stay. The front desk staff was incredibly helpful and accomodating. The room is smaller than a hotel room in the suburbs, but for a boutique hotel in the city the rooms are a good size. I loved the modern/funky decor! What makes kimpton hotels so great is that all of them have their own, unique feel. We enjoyed the complimentary wine hour before we went off to meet our friends for dinner in the north end, which is just a short walk away. This hotel is also close to Faneuil Hall and the Quincy Market, which are great for tourists, and not far from the famed "freedom trail". We awoke to one of the bigger snow storms of the season and were quite happy that we had left our car back at the house and would be taking the train home. We cancelled our plans to kick around the city for the afternoon, but did take advantage of sunday brunch in the ruby room. The bar was transformed into a breakfast buffet that was not well stocked - the hot entrees were mostly empty and the muffins had been really scavanged over. Also, the bowl of fruit salad was empty. I overheard the waitress apologize to another hotel guest about the slow service - she said that half the staff had called out and were unable to make it in because of the snow storm. I understand that and suspect that normally the service and food are quite good, although my experience was a little different. I would highly recommend this hotel to tourists, business travelers, and anyone who finds themselves in Boston for the evening. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Snug & Stylish”
Reviews.Author: ActionCat
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Sure, the bar is a bit like a European hostel lobby - I'm a hotel bar afficianado and expected this to be much more swank and sexy based on the website - and has an unnecessary flatscreen TV playing, of all things, the Discovery Channel. But my room was a perfectly put-together little hideaway that was full of lovely little touches. What the rooms lacks in physical size it more than makes up for in personality. I loved everything about it - the black wooden headboard and furniture, the red accessories, the petite red armchair, and the checkered carpet. Even the leopard print bathrobes make sense once you're there. The bathroom floor was so shiny you could see your reflection. All of my requests were attended to promptly and with kindness. The staff are definitely great. This hotel has atmosphere once you get into your room. Because of the size, it's best that you stay here with someone you really like. Which reminds me...the beds are marvelous!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjf123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Onyx hotel for the St Paddy's day weekend. This was my first visit to Boston, and the first time staying at a Kimpton Hotel. First impressions were great. We had a car, and were greeted at the front door by the valet, who quickly unloaded our luggage, and ushered us inside. The front desk was extremely helpful - at all times - and checked us in with efficiency, and asked if we had any questions or special requests. The room was cool - very modern decor with red highlights. I can see how some might not like the decore, however it was to our liking. Loved the terry cloth leopard print bathrobes - lots of fun! The location is excellent. Being St Paddy's day there were lots of choices of nightlife. The hotel is really centrally located to the waterfront and downtown Boston, and is also very close to the subway. In all, we had a great first visit to Boston, and loved this hotel - I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not a "W" okay!!!”
Reviews.Author: BCMSW06
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was okay. The rooms were funky and had some nice touches, like the aveda bathroom products. However, the rooms had a somewhat "seedy" feel to them. I stayed in a double double deluxe room and it was literally smaller than my walk in closet at home (RM 1010). If I was offered a smaller room, I easily could have been in a broom closet. The ruby room which is right next to the lobby has a cool bar but is very tiny. It certainly lacks ambience for having a nice dinner as the ruby room feels like a lounge. This was my first time staying at a Kimpton Property and for a hotel thats only two years old is looking a bit worn. The hallway carpets I assume are supposed to be "funky" but look like rugs you may see in a 2 star casino in las vegas. I assume this hotel is trying to cater to the "chic 30 somthing crowd" but is surely missing the target. This hotel is trying to have a "W" feel but are missing the bar completely. If you want a nice botique hotel in Boston, stay at hotel nine zero. I hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, loved the staff!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, 2 teenage boys and our dog spent 3 delightful nights at the Onyx Hotel. As others have noted, the staff at this boutique hotel were superb. We were a bit nervous traveling with a pet but were greeted at the door by a "Welcome Willy" sign accompanied by dog biscuits and water! The boys had made an error when trying to watch a movie and the staff were gracious and non-judgemental in refunding the amount. The room decor was sumptuous, the bath products of good quality and the complimentary wine hour was a treat. As for the location, we walked every night and at no time did we feel our safety was compromised. Again, the staff were adept at suggesting walking routes, restaurants and the best way to exit the city! We would most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “the onyx is great”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Onyx for 2 nights. It was perfect ;our room was immaculate,very quiet, spotlessly clean,with a very comfortable bed.But the main plus point was the staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them, and their courtesy, cheerfulness, and efficiency was the best we have ever encountered.We had come from the UK and only had a two night trip, so every minute counted,and the Onyx ensured that it was well worth it.If you are visiting Boston, don't waste time looking at alternatives. This hotel has an excellent position,wonderful rooms, and above all a staff who convince you that you really matter.It wasn't just one or two of them; they were all superb.We are planning our return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend at The Onyx and really enjoyed our stay. We got this hotel by chance on Priceline. I chose a four star hotel for $100 a night and this was what I got. The hotel and rooms are definately small, but that's what a boutique hotel is. I really still like the large hotel with a big lobby and even a pool which this hotel lacks. But we got an excellent price for a beautiful hotel. Everything was very luxurious and rich feeling. The mattress and pillows were heavenly and the fluffy down comforter made you want to stay in bed suggled up all morning. Everything was definately clean and I did not have any problems at all. The staff was very kind and helpful. Anything we wanted to know, they answered it quickly. The valet parking is a little expensive to me $32 a day...but that's the going rate in Boston. There is NOWHERE in that area to park at night so even if you are lucky like we were to get metered parking in the day you have to have your car off the street by 2 a.m. or you will be towed. So valet is your only choice. I would say it is convenient to have your car brought to you, but you really don't need it. It is more of a hassle to drive and find parking than to walk or take the T. But when we did ask for our car they got it immediately and brought it right to the front door. There is a free wine hour from 5-6 which is really nice. They have red and white wine. The Ruby Room is really pretty and a nice place to relax. We enjoyed the wine on our first night but forgot about it on our second night. It was one of the highlights in my opinion. As for location. Some people have commented that it is not in the best area. We did not feel this way. It feels very safe, even at midnight. It is a quiet street so you do have to walk a few blocks to get where the action is, but it's really not a problem. The T stop is also only a block or two away which is a huge convenience. Overall our stay at The Onyx was great. We had no problems and really nothing to complain about. We were very impressed. We had a nice, but freezing, time in Boston and would like to come back in the Spring.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: annasmom73
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on a side street, the Onyx is a wonderful gem! We stayed there after a Celtics game. I didn't know that there was a discount for attending garden games, so after I had already booked, I emailed and asked for the lower rate, which I got, no questions asked. It was my boyfriend's birthday, so I also requested the turn down service with rose petals and champagne which was wonderful! The room was quiet, well appointed, but small. This was ok, though. The bathroom was very nice, with Aveda toiletries and robes. The staff was so helpful, offering assistance whenever needed. We walked to the aquarium and the North End, which were very close. A great find!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Stacey&Ian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights while sight seeing in Boston. The hotel is in a pretty good location - only a few blocks to walk before you are on the freedom trail, about halfway along the route. The hotel itself doesn't look like much from the outside. When walking into the lobby, I had to do a double-take and wonder if we'd come in a back door or something. The hotel's bar is front and center and the check-in is off to the side. It was nice looking, but a bit odd. Not much of a lobby. I personally enjoy walking into a fancy lobby at a nice hotel, and felt that this was lacking. The check-in staff were so friendly I was amazed. I would have to say this is the most friendly and helpful I have ever experienced in a hotel. I was very impressed. The room itself was small, but very nicely decorated and very modern looking. It had a cozy feeling to it. The bathrooms were also very modern, and the shower had a curving shower rod, which kept the shower curtain from getting too close to you while showering. There was one patch of carpet in the entryway that was fraying, which gave the feeling that the hotel was getting a bit worn, but everything was definitely very clean. The hotel emailed me a survey, which I completed, and noted that my only disappointments were the frayed carpet and the lack of a nice lobby. The following day someone from the hotel had emailed me back to thank me for the feedback and said they were checking into the frayed carpet to have it replaced. That impressed me also - that they care about the comments they receive. Overall, we found an excellent rate through travelzoo and I was happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sofisticated Fun”
Reviews.Author: travel4beer
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Kimpton Hotel and after reading several posts on TripAdvisor about The Onyx, we weren't sure what to expect. The front desk and doormen personnel were courteous, professional and happy to take care of our requests. When asked about a nearby restaurant, both front desk staff eagerly answered. My husband went searching for a vending machine to get bottled water and one of the hotel staff went into the employee lounge and gave him two cans of coke. My only complaint was that the people staying in the room next to us partied well into the early morning hours. OK, it was New Year's Eve, but still. In all, The Onyx was a cool place to stay and convenient to area attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, Another great Kimpton stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from the Onyx... A regular Kimpton guest and a fan of the Marlowe in Cambridge, I decided to give the Onyx a try. Overall, I would have to say that the Marlowe exceeds the Onyx in hotel class, size, service, food, and room quality, the location of the Onyx is much better for spending time in Boston proper. I found the location to be terrific--a short walk to both the North End (where we had a terrific dinner at Lucca) and Fanueil Hall/Quincy Market neighborhoods, and to the T for farther excursions (though when in Boston, I prefer walking). I generally stay in the Back Bay, but wanted to explore a different part of the city and the Onyx was a perfect place from which to do so. About the hotel-- Service--Excellent! Very attentive front desk staff (evening) who were more than willing to call the restaurant to let them know we were coming. Decor/Quality--The rooms were well appointed and the smallish size didn't bother me. However, the public areas of the hotel (lobby, bar, hallways, etc.) seemed cheap or "faux luxury) and not up to Kimpton standards. The lobby has an awful drop-down foam tile ceiling and the bar area leaves much to be desired. However overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to travelers looking for a fun, hip, non-traditional hotel with close proximity to the Garden/Fleet Center, North End, Fanueil Hall/Quincy Market. If you are looking for a more luxurious Kimpton stay, the Hotel Marlowe in Cambridge is your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Time at the Onyx”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 days at the onyx and it was amazing. my mother loves to harass the front desk people for all kinds of services and they were great, VERY helpful and attentive. The rooms were really cool and clean. Totally worth the reasonable price and the area is kind of perfect, right by a major T line. I would highly recommend staying there!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Time Was Had @ the Onyx”
Reviews.Author: RH35
Reviews.Content: I spent four days at the Onyx and had a great time! I loved the sexy decor. The room was spotless. The kingsize bed was heavenly and the shower plenty big for two people. ; ) Loved the Aveda products and the huge pedestal sink. The staff was attentive and friendly. I didn't have any meals at the Onyx as there are so many wonderful restaurants in the area, especially the North End (I had some marvelous pasta at Giaccomo's). I did not find the neighborhood to be 'run down' or unsafe-feeling as some of the other reviewers stated. I would definitely stay here again with my boyfriend and highly recommend the Onyx for young (or young-at-heart) couples!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: houl
Reviews.Content: The Onyx hotel in downtown boston was our choice of property probaly because we have had a preference for a Boutique contemporary operation, we Checked in to a very cold recpetionist who told us to fill out forms in regard to customer services on how we booked and the hotel, I told him we had just walked in the door and he just said NOW SIR. Having just got off a 7 hour flight, i was in no mood to argue the point a filled it out. we got our keys still no eye contact never mind a smile and went to our room, Quite a good room and was true to the oictures on the website when we booked, tastfully furnished but looking a little worn, Very little natural light. Beds were comfy two double beds in the room and the bathroom was spotless with a generous anount of towels etc. This Hotel from start to finish is quite well run although quite small, It is the front line staff need a serious amount of training in customer services, the front desk staff are not only rude but do nothing to accommadate you for any request. The prices this property charge are nothing close to the service you should be receiving, and i feel the |GM should take this on board. We were paying as far as I could see 5 star prices having stayed in in over 100 hotels to date and recieving poorer service than a 2 star. (In fact the 2 star operators are more pleasent and will do their best to acccomadate guests? Atitude is the key here, with staff having full scale conversations hanging out of the back office door whilst clearly ignoring you untill you have to excuse your self for the fifth time. i feel if the staff were retrained or even fired at this proerty it would do quite well for itself. I thought I would never have had to feel like I am asking my 2nd grade a teacher a question again, but these people like atitude and do their utmost to enforce it. My atitude is if you don't like your job leave it especially if it is effecting your performance and those you are giving it to.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: mcd63
Reviews.Content: I really like Kimpton hotels and Onyx was no exception. The room was spotless and modernly decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable. The shower was great and they provided Aveda products. The staff is really nice. There is a complimentary ride to the financial district in the mornings and a wine tasting (I couldn't make it to that) each afternoon. I think that there are some people who would not like the neighborhood. It is near the Garden and there were a few unsavory people walking around, but honestly, I was approached by homeless people in many other neighborhoods. I thought the location was great. It is close to the North End, Beacon Hill and Faneuil Hall. The city is great for walking. The only down side to the Onyx is the size of rooms. There were two people in my room for 4 nights and we used almost every bit of storage. I would definitely recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “quite good experience”
Reviews.Author: Kat43
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Onyx in mid-October for three nights. Arrived at 7 pm and found king room to smell of cleaning products and deodorizing machine running. Called front desk to complain and they immediately gave us another room, which was double/double but it was much larger than king, didn't smell and we weren't about to quibble because they were sold out during our stay. Ate a grilled chicken sandwich in the Ruby Room which was ok but not great. Next morning discovered Au Bon Pain across the street. We brought fabulous croissant and coffee back to the room each morning. Also had lunch at Au Bon Pain. Terrific Pumpkin Soup, ok sandwiches. Didn't see any scary people around hotel but were not out on street after 8 pm. Ate at Anthem an upscale very good restaurant a block from Onyx. Found Haymarket T stop to be close and very convenient. No complaints about desk staff, they arranged for "bridge" for internet access and got us taxis in minutes when we requested them. Location was great - easy walk or T ride to all top spots. Would stay at Onyx again, generally pleased with hotel. But not as nice as Hotel Monaco, a Kimpton hotel in Chicago, which was very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all...”
Reviews.Author: printer
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Onyx in mid-October, room was small but very clean and well appointed. I liked the bed. The bathroom was functional, but a little cold. For the most part a typical Kimpton Hotel. There is no HBO on the TV. There is free wine in the evening (for exactly 1 hour) but no cheese, etc. Front desk staff was OK but not overly friendly. The doorman was helpful with suggestions for places to eat and drink. One thing I will mention, when I booked the room I asked for a higher floor,away from the elevator -- I got just the opposite, lower floor right next to the elevator -- maybe it was because I was there only one night, but then again, I am a member of the Kimpton quest loyalty program??? I'm usually in Boston once a month for business and this is the first time I stayed at the Onyx. I may try it again -- not sure, it's hard to tell from just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you don't spend much time in your room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot to offer if they can get a handle on a few things. The location is excellent if you are planning to use the T for transportation in Boston, less than two blocks from North Station for the T and the commuter rail is easy to get to and a cheap alternative to taxis. It is walking distance to North End and some of the best Italian food in the US. But they are in a neighborhood that is making a comeback so there are some rather scary looking people around. We didn't even try to eat in the hotel, the pricing was a bit high when there are so many other options in the area. The house keeping staff was very accomodating for us but they did seem to knock on the door about once an hour after 9 am even with the do not disturb sign out. No turn down service was offered. The in room yoga is a nice idea but you would have to stand on the bed to do it since there is just enough room to walk around the bed in the room. The fitness room was great if minimal; treadmill eliptical and exer-bike. We both used it at different times and got the impression that very few people actually take advantage of it. Their materials describe the hotel as "Sexy" this can be translated to mean they like to use red leather accents on everything from the chairs to the wastebins. The room decor was very trendy and I liked it, my husband did not. The room was small by american standards but there was absolutely no noise from outside (10th floor). And the bathroom was hard to get ready in due to the unusually large pedestal sink, looked great but it is hard to put in contact lenses when you are three feet from the mirror with no counter to speak of to place things on. They did offer a hair dryer that was good and actually dried my hair. The front desk staff was hit or miss. The evening staff (6pm and later) seemed to be on top of things and was very helpful. The day staff (8am-6pm) was not as good. They regularly had 2 or more staff on hand at any time that seemed more interested in each others weekend plans than the guests waiting for their attention. The day group also seemed to not know where they were in relation to any Boston sights. The doorman was a differnet story, each one did a great job of giving us help with directions, driving and on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Ehh at the Onyx”
Reviews.Author: systematicdc
Reviews.Content: What I will give boutiful kudos to are two of the Concierges I dealt with (not the weekend staff). I had them set up a great surprise for my companion and they pulled it off without a hitch! Also, the valets are curteous, prompt and pleasant as hell. However, that aside, I will say this. I nearly slipped and broke my bum on the shower and immediately asked for a shower mat (I am sure that somehow makes me an old biddy, but I continue) explaining to the front desk that I fell in the shower (one would think that would scream lawsuit and they would rush a mat right up). They told me "of course we'll have one right up." Twelve hours later, I asked again. And one more time we finally got the mat. One night we called for a wake up call...no such luck. Its a good thing we didn't miss our reservations. Just a heads up, when you order the Proud to Be In Love package (includes rose petals and champagne) for more than one night...the rose petals are a one time thing on your date of arrival. They charge the same rate for sure, but you don't get the petals on the following nights. I don't understand that, as a matter of fact, the front desk personnel didn't understand that either. When the day came for us to leave, I tried to print out my boarding pass from the room. No printer available. So I called the front desk and when I asked where I could email my printout for the staff to print for me, the gentleman was obviously ready to be off the phone with me. All he did was direct me to the website to find an email address on the website (thought that might be some kind of common knowledge) I love the Kimpton Brand (and by the way highly recommend the Hotel Marlowe in Cambridge Ma for a stay in the Boston area), but somehow they went wrong on this one. I guess I was expecting a bit more from a 4 star hotel right downtown... Small rooms, and mediocre service make this one a "Ehh" on a scale of "Yay" to "Nay."

Reviews.Title: “Great stay !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 2 nights at the Onyx. The overall experience was excellent. We found the location quite good, being just a short walk from fanuiel hall and a brief cab ride everywhere else. We even walked to Back Bay and found the journey to be extemely scenic. The neighborhood is not pristine but we did not find it to be the negative that some reviewers felt. There are 2 excellent restaurants within a block of the hotel. Our room, though small, was everything you expect from the boutique experience and very comfortable. The availabity of wifi was a nice surprise. The bar/restaurant was quiet and had a limited menu but was adequate for our needs. The on site gym could/should be better. Four pieces of cardio equipment does not constitute a gym for a hotel that appaels to the type of traveler interested in this level of design and style. My only other criticism relates to the staff. Although they were friendly, their level of professionalism and appearance were also not consistent with the design and style of the hotel. These criticisms were minor and did not bother us or negatively impact our experience. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Travel a lot mixed feelings on the Onyx”
Reviews.Author: carmellady
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for a large conference in September for a few nights. The meeting was at the Marriott Copley Square, and attendees were getting a very good rate and that is a central part of Boston. However I wanted to try a smaller hotel and had heard of Kimpton, and one of their ads says they try to cater to the woman business traveler (did not experience that at this hotel) I checked the Kimpton Web Site, Expedia as I always do, and noticed that if one wanted to join the Kimpton Frequent Guest club and earn points and free nights, that one could NOT get this if you went through what they termed a website such as Expedia, Priceline etc. So I paid rack rate, not the hotwire or priceline as some writers in this review have stated. If I had paid 150 or around that, I would have felt better perhaps at my experience at this hotel. Will agree with some of the other reviewers. Service: Great Bellman, and good car valets, but front desk was from fair to good to terrible. Front desk was Not CONSISTENT IN SERVICE and in many cases they had 2 to 3 people standing behind the tiny checkin that were not doing a thing, other then just standing there chatting. Agree after looking over the Continental Breakfast it just was so so and not worth the money. Agree that the area is still part gritty and there were derelicts around the place, which was a bit dicey, being a female traveler walking by herself. Also had the same experience, when on my one free night, asking for a dinner suggestion, that they suggested Legal Seafood and that was it. My only request from their reservation service was for a smoking room. The front desk person, even though there were 3 people, apparently did not notice what was on the reservation, and upon arriving in my room, noticed the non smoking signs. Out of courtesy to future guests, I will not smoke in a non smoking room. Since it was time for their wine hour, I went down to the lobby, had a glass and met a few other guests, and asked how they liked the hotel. One couple said, neighborhood a bit soso, cute room, liked the price they got on line ($100 a night less then me) So I went to the front desk, it was only 3 feet away and politely asked if I could be switched to a smoking room. Like one of your reviewers, I was told they were sold out. So I pointed out that I had paid full rack rate, unlike the couple I had spoken to, and since smoking is not allowed in any restaurants, meeting areas, bars, and the only place one could smoke would be one's guestroom, if they could not do this, I would be checking out, all of a sudden they found me a smoking room. I liked the new room, it was much bigger, since my first room was the smallest in the hotel, this was at the end of the hall and quiet. My shower did take 3 minutes to get hot water, and I tried 3 different times of the days I was there, and it always took a while to get hot water. Would I stay there again, not sure. Like the small hotel concept and I have stayed at other boutique hotels before and liked them better then this. Would like to try another Kimpton. Had really been looking forward to this, but paying full rate with such a small Kimpton (bar is also the restaurant) the spotty service and neighborhood as it is at the moment, would give this 3 stars instead of normally 4 or 5.\

Reviews.Title: “Onyx is a Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Ruffian42
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my first stay at the Onyx and my results were mixed. The rooms are pathetically small but wonderfully furnished. Bed, pillows and linens were first rate and with a 10th floor room I didn't hear any street noise. The staff was quite accommodating and friendly, from the gent who parks and retrieves your car to the desk clerk. However, $32 per day to park is a bit much. The location is terrific. Fanueil Hall/Quincy Market and the North End are both within an easy 10-minute walk and the Fleet Center is less than 2 blocks away. There's a T station close by. However, the area immediately surrounding the hotel has a fair allotment of derelicts. Beware of the breakfast buffet. Not worth the money. However, about 4 blocks away is a charming cafe called the ETC. Cafe where you can get bagels, eggs, muffins and the usual breakfast fare. The lobby area and Ruby Lounge are nicely furnished, the elevators are swift, pets are allowed and it is overall an attractive boutique-type hotel. I would consider staying there again but there are finer hotels in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan_Black
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Onyx Hotel on August 13th and was very impressed. The service was excellent - the staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. My room was small (as expected from reading other reviews) but was very nicely finished. I liked the extra touches like the CD in the room and the yoga channel and the complimentary wine for one hour in the evening. Although there wasn't much around the hotel in a one block radius, it only took 5 minutes to walk to some of Boston's main attractions. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would not hestitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel, but poor service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although I found my room to be clean, comfy and extremely attractive (if a bit small - I barely had room to walk around my king bed), my overall experience was marred by poor customer service. Some examples: * upon check-in, I inquired about high-speed internet service and was told that an ethernet bridge was recommended for the connection I needed, and that one would be brought up to my room right away. I waited an hour and 15 minutes, and not another word about it. I then called and it became apparent that someone had forgotten, so I requested it a second time and I eventually did receive the ethernet bridge. * myroom came without (1) a room service menu, and (2) a "do not disturb" sign. After pointing this out when I attempted to order room service, I was told that they didn't have any more room service menus....which seems odd to me. I was told that they'd deliver a "do not disturb" sign.....which they did, finally, on the fourth day of my five-day stay and after multiple requests (a few times I had to deal with housekeeping bursting in the room while I was showering or getting dressed). *Voice mail in the room didn't work. On several occasions, colleages left me messages but the message light didn't go on until the next day, for some unknown reason. Some messages that were left by a co-worker in an adjoining room never came through at all. Thank goodness for cell phones, or else I would be unreachable. I reported this issue as well, but it was never fixed. Only the message light on one of the two phones in room worked at all. *several times, I had people call me to tell me that they had to make several attempts to reach me in the room (either they were transferred to the wrong room or a different department of the hotel). *on the day that I was to check out, I learned that I needed to stay an extra day for the meeting I was attending. I confirmed via the hotel's website on my laptop that rooms were available at the same rate that I was paying, so I called downstairs to ask to stay an extra day. The individual I was connected to told me rather brusquely that it wasn't possible to extend my stay as the hotel was "fully booked." I then pointed out to him that I had actually just checked online, and there appeared to be rooms available, and if it was easier I would just book the room online He then quickly responded with, well, um, okay I just checked with my supervisor and we can accommodate you. I actually laughed out loud.....his response took about two seconds, and clearly he hadn't checked with his "supervisor." All I can figure is that he told me the hotel was full because I was receiving a discounted rate.....in any event, it was really rude, and laughable, when he then tried to cover his you-know-what by pretending to ask a supervisor about availability. I would think that the hotel would be trying to accommodate its guests, not brushing them off. *during one of the nights of my stay, a weeknight, I was forced to deal with what sounded like a live band in a nearby bar, going on full blast until well after 1m. Not the sort of thing you want to deal with if you are traveling on business and you need to wake early. I don't fault the fact that there are bars nearby, but I was suprised that my room was SO poorly insulated that it truly sounded like there was a live band right inside my room. Ugh! . *upon checking out, I informed the front desk that a bunch of the calls charged to my phone lacked complete information, i.e., the entire phone number wasn't listed, for some reason. In some places, it just listed the area code, so I had no idea if they were business or personal (makes a difference when you get reiumbursed for one but not the other). I was told that some research would have to be done (?), and that someone would get back to me, so I left my phone number with them since it was clear that they wouldn't be able to figure it out before I left town. After that< i never heard back from them; I had to call them myself about 3-4 times over the course of several weeks just to get someone to clarify my bill. In the end, they weren't able to track down the phone numbers. *Like others have mentioned, I too experienced trying to get someone to help me at the front desk, and the front desk staff seemed to be more interested in talking with eachother than paying attention to whether guests needed help. *Not very knowledgable with respect to recommending restaurants and the like.....the best they could come up with was a chain restaurant (Legal Seafoods, which had its best years in the 80s and is overpriced and mostly geared toward tourists). *I wrote a letter to Kimpton describing some of these experiences, and other annoyances during my stay, and never got even an acknowledgment. Bottom line: the good - nicely decorated rooms, upscale furnishings, nice touches like robe/slippers and high-end beauty products, convenient location; the bad - multiple technical difficulties, staff that can be rude and unhelpful, noise may be an issue depending upon the location of your room (?); expect to do your own research regarding things to see/do/places to eat (check out the Globe or Boston Phoenix).

Reviews.Title: “Have to agree with others........”
Reviews.Author: chifinn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great spot has a great look to it the lobby and the Ruby Room are very nice. The room is decorated very modern styles with a nice flair about them. Typical Kimpton Hotel which is why we choose to stay there. But the room is very small 2 adults and we felt cramped. With the wife ironing and me showering and getting ready was a challenge. The shower water pressure is poor and avoid the $13.00 each all you can eat breakfast. The hot food was dry and the bagels and cereal are just not worth it. Parking was $32.00 a day which is typical for a downtown hotel, but I found cheaper parking myself and walking one short block. Ruby room at night is very nice. Nice Martini specials. But when all is done and said we have stayed at better rooms for this price it was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJosephAlexandria_VA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Onyx is a charm. A new boutique hotel little more than a year old, it has all the charm and excellent service you would expect from a Kimpton Group hotel. The service was excellent -- my wife was having a headache and the concierge readily provided aspirin. Our room was tastefully decorated. The only potential drawback -- the neighborhood surrounding the Onyx is a tad gritty. You are very close to the Fleet Center and the North Station terminal hub -- great for easy access to the T system and the Green Line. That said, this is a neighborhood still on the rise -- and you will not be in the middle of historic Boston. We had no problems, but just don't expect to be walking distance from Newbury Street or other shops/restaurants. That said, you are walking distance from the North End neighborhood. A strong thumbs-up ....

Reviews.Title: “Quality of service clouds an otherwise great find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My travel agent recommended this hotel when it first opened with the caveat that this is a "new" hotel. I should have known better that this meant that the property will be nice but should not expect quality service. The location was very convenient. The hotel was within walking distance of North End, Mass General and the train station. The rooms were small but comfortable. The large bed did not leave any space in the room but the plush bathrobe and the stylish furniture were worth giving up some space. The service was another matter. I had to wait about 15 minutes at the front desk when I checked in because the staff were too busy chatting with each other (frequent occurance). The front desk staff lost a fax that I received. I was disappointed that no one at the front desk could give me any suggestions for a place to go for breakfast other than to eat at the hotel. (Fortunately, the hotel driver was very helpful and gave me a lift to a pretty good diner.) Most disappointing was the staff''s response when I her that I got violently ill after eating an appetizer from the hotel restaurant. I got in late on my last night and was tired but hungry. I was told that I could order food from the restaurant and eat it in my room. I ordered the asparagus spring rolls which were highly recommended. I ate it and got really sick. I mentioned what happened to the person at the front desk at check out early next morning. Absolutely no apology. All I was told was "that's weird, perhaps I should let the restaurant know." I asked to speak to the manager but was told that it was too early in the morning. On top of that, I was charged for the food that made me violently ill. I hope that the lack of experience of the staff will improve since this is the only decent hotel in this part of town. I probably will go back there again, but not for another few years to give the staff some time to learn how provide service on par with the quality of this property.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Onyx”
Reviews.Author: Balconylove
Reviews.Content: My daughter who is studying with the Boston Ballet this summer and I decided to arrive a few days ahead of schedule to acclimate to the East Coast time. We chose the Onyx Hotel as I have stayed in other boutique hotels by Kimpton before and prefer the intimacy of a small hotel. The Onyx was fantastic. We arrived at 6:00 am from a red eye flight from LA and they immediately accomodated us for early check in. The hotel is also conveniently right around the corner from the North Station as well as walking distance to many popular areas in and around Boston. The hotel offers a nice breakfast buffet in the lobby. The front desk was extremely informative in giving directions as well as what "T" line to take. Room service was prompt, and the maid even left my daughter a handwritten note thanking her for her note saying she liked the hotel. My only complaint was the reving of cars at 1:00 am in the morning on the weekend which woke me up. There are apparently some rowdy sports bars right around the corner. Other than that, I highly recommend the ONYX!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: danifAtlanta_Georgia
Reviews.Content: The Onyx has an ideal location, friendly staff and very clean and new rooms. The only complaint is that the beds are too small. (comfortable- but small) We stayed for 5 nights and walked everywhere and were centrally located to all of what Boston has to offer. Special features of the hotel were: Car service, coffee and 5:00 cocktails nightly, and special attention from the staff! We would definately come back to the Onyx!!!

Reviews.Title: “Onyx is very, very good!”
Reviews.Author: arnieman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I vacationed in Boston for eight days, staying the entire time at the Onyx Hotel. We were delighted with our choice. LOCATION: The hotel is very conveniently located. It is a 5" walk to the Fleet Center and to the North Station subway ("T"). It is a 10" minute walk to the North End and to Quincy Hall. Add another 5" to get to the Aquarium/Waterfront or to the Financial District. The subway is super convenient for reaching almost any tourist or business destination in town, including those in Cambridge. FACILITY: The room is small, no two ways about it. That said, however, it held a king size bed, two nightstands, an easy chair, decent-sized work table, and a small fridge. The furnishings were first rate, and the room was kept meticulously clean. And the hotel has free wi-fi! SERVICE: Outstanding throughout, from friendly and knowledgeable front desk personnel to the bellmen and doormen. VALUE: The prices seem to vary all over the lot. We booked directly with the hotel web site and were satisfied that we got good value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “perfect in town getaway”
Reviews.Author: jaxietoo
Reviews.Content: kimpton hotels rock, there's no two ways about it. They treat everyone as individuals and make you feel special, down to little notes and candy on arrival, calling you by name, and offering wonderful treats like in room yoga exercise cards and materials, "rock star" hour in the lobby bar, and a complimentary CD to listen to and bring home with you. I stayed here in March for my birthday- even though we live in Boston- we wanted a special night and we got one! The rooms are tiny, but the bed was huge, the furniture quirky and fun, the room was definitely big enough for sleeping but not much else. The little bar in the lobby was great, though one of the bartenders was a bit rude (which is a rarety at a Kimpton hotel). Love the location, lots of cool stuff around but far enough from the hustle of the rest of the city. Very romantic and overall good value. Will definitely stay there again!! Oh and good to note- they allow animals so if you travel with your kitty or pooch, this is the place to stay- luxury and convenience!

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: bock
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Onyx Hotel in Boston in February of this year, we found the hotel to be lovely and comfortable and cosy as the bar and lobby are all in the one area. The staff were very helpful and the bar staff were very friendly, and they made us feel welcome.
