The hotel is not far from Quincy Market and the Fleet Centre, it was very cold when we were there, but once you wrap up well it was not to bad, and there is p;enty of bars and resturants nearby , its a short walk to downtown crossing from the hotel or you can get T

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience!”
Reviews.Author: elle55407
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Onyx on a business trip Rooms are small but super comfortable and super clean. (And clean is a BIG issue with me!) Fun lobby and funky decor were a welcome sight. The leopard print robes were a hoot to lounge around in. My room was right next to the elevator and as a light sleeper, I was a little concerned. But I heard absolutely nothing during my two night stay. Room service was above average in trying to please, though not too much variety on the menu. But everything I ordered was delivered promptly and was delish. Entire staff was really friendly and accomodating. (PAUL in Sales and Catering - you are a ROCK STAR!!) Entire staff anticipated my needs ahead of time and offered suggestions without my having to ask. I travel about three times a month on business and always hit the top-notch hotels so I can honestly tell you ...an extravegant lobby and enormous room can't make up for a lousy staff. So what the Onyx may be lacking in size and over the top granduer, it more than makes up for in personality. You just don't get service like this anymore. Hands down, this was by far the most personable, pleasant experience I have ever had at any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I traveled here for work and loved it! Amazing design and and attention to details. Beds and pillows are perfect. Who also cant love a hotel that has FREE Wi-fi in the entire building? STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: annedy611
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent Thanksgiving Weekend at the Onyx Hotel. We were very pleased with every aspect of the hotel. The service was wonderful. The staff was very helpful & accommodating. The room was very comfortable especially the bed. We took advantage of the free breakfast. There were more than enough food choices. The only disadvantage (which I understand is common in Boston) is that the parking was expensive and offsite. When we wanted out car we had to call the bellstaff to get it for us. They did not keep us waiting but we found it inconvenient to say the least. Location was good for the T and shopping mall was a short drive away. Do not hesitate to stay at the Onyx. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Upscale, Attractive and Good Value for Boston”
Reviews.Author: rahzamazin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here March 15-18 2005 (business trip). Business travelers usually have to stay in large, impersonal hotels in Boston which are devoid of character and have small and worn rooms and so-so service at not so low prices. Sure enough, my company was going to put me up at the Sheraton Boston (corporate rate of $155). Based on TripAdvisor reviews I knew that my experience there would have been mediocre or, at best, fair. So I shopped around for a comparable rate at a better hotel. I had previously stayed at the Topaz in DC, another Kimpton hotel. That is a fantastic hotel. I figured that if the Onyx was half as good, it would still be a very good experience. I shopped around on the web and found the Onyx for $169 on a discounter's web site; called Kimpton and got a rate match. $169 is a very good value for a mid-week stay at this Boston hotel! I was not disappointed with the Onyx. It had a distinctly upscale feel to it. My room was relatively large by Boston Standards. The decor was bright, contemporary and tasteful. The beds plush and comfortable. CD player and large TV (and lots of satellite channels --but no HBO or Showtime). Gourmet coffee in-room. The room was spotlessly clean. The gleaming black marble bathroom was very stylish (the marble's pretty cold to walk on though!) No sign of wear and tear in the rooms at all (the hotel is very new). It was a treat to return to the room after a full day of work. There was not much else to the hotel...there is a small but very stylish lounge (I did not take advantage of the free happy hour). I'm sure it would be fun to have a drink there. There's not much to the lobby; although it is stylishly decorated, it is little more than a hallway! The front-desk service was impeccable and the staff eager to please. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Faneuil Hall. 2 minutes from the fleet center. 5 minute walk to the North station to catch the T. It's easy to get to all the interesting places in Boston from the Onyx. Tons of eating choices very close by. The cons: the only thing I can think of is that the street the Onyx is on and the nearby Fleet center area are somewhat run-down (vacant office buildings, trash on the street --probably thanks to the clientele of the numerous pubs and fast-food joints, lots of people standing around smoking outside the pubs, several panhandlers near the Fleet center). None of this would deter me at all from staying at the Onyx again though. I wish there was a 4.5 star option...that's what I would give to the Onyx. Stay here if you want a really nice place to stay with good service and well-maintained upscale rooms that have lots of character at not-so-high prices (for Boston).

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Cool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Onyx during a week-long vacation to the Boston area. It is a very hip hotel. Walking into the lobby, there's a dj spinning in the bar-area, adding a fun atmosphere to the place. The rooms are modern and very clean. They are a little small, but when you're in a place like Boston, you're not doing much in there except sleeping. It is also very quiet. My room was near the elevator and I never heard it. The service was fantastic. The front desk staff was especially friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel, Fab beds!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and felt at home. The rooms were less than 1 year old, small for US standards but cool deco. Very clean with great free Aveda products! Well worth the money! The gym isn't on site but only 100 yards away and we didn't use the bar or restaurant, too many near by! Good location, which will be even better when the road works nearby are finished. They made us feel v welcome!

HotelInfo.Name: Onyx Hotel - a Kimpton Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 155 Portland Street, Boston, MA 02114
